203 DEFINE_EVENT_TYPE(EVT_TRACK_PANEL_TIMER)
204 
205 /*
206 
207 This is a diagram of TrackPanel's division of one (non-stereo) track rectangle.
208 Total height equals Track::GetHeight()'s value. Total width is the wxWindow's width.
209 Each charater that is not . represents one pixel.
210 
211 Inset space of this track, and top inset of the next track, are used to draw the focus highlight.
212 
213 Top inset of the right channel of a stereo track, and bottom shadow line of the
214 left channel, are used for the channel separator.
215 
216 TrackInfo::GetTrackInfoWidth() == GetVRulerOffset()
217 counts columns from the left edge up to and including controls, and is a constant.
218 
219 GetVRulerWidth() is variable -- all tracks have the same ruler width at any time,
220 but that width may be adjusted when tracks change their vertical scales.
221 
222 GetLabelWidth() counts columns up to and including the VRuler.
223 GetLeftOffset() is yet one more -- it counts the "one pixel" column.
224 
225 FindTrack() for label returns a rectangle up to and including the One Pixel column,
226 but OMITS left and top insets
227 
228 FindTrack() for !label returns a rectangle with x == GetLeftOffset(), and INCLUDES
229 right and top insets
230 
231 +--------------- ... ------ ... --------------------- ... ... -------------+
232 | Top Inset |
233 | |
234 | +------------ ... ------ ... --------------------- ... ... ----------+ |
235 | L|+-Border---- ... ------ ... --------------------- ... ... -Border-+ |R |
236 | e||+---------- ... -++--- ... -+++----------------- ... ... -------+| |i |
237 | f|B| || ||| |BS|g |
238 | t|o| Controls || V |O| The good stuff |oh|h |
239 | |r| || R |n| |ra|t |
240 | I|d| || u |e| |dd| |
241 | n|e| || l | | |eo|I |
242 | s|r| || e |P| |rw|n |
243 | e||| || r |i| ||||s |
244 | t||| || |x| ||||e |
245 | ||| || |e| ||||t |
246 | ||| || |l| |||| |
247 | ||| || ||| |||| |
248 
249 . ... .. ... .... .
250 . ... .. ... .... .
251 . ... .. ... .... .
252 
253 | ||| || ||| |||| |
254 | ||+---------- -++-- ... -+++----------------- ... ... -------+||| |
255 | |+-Border---- ... ----- ... --------------------- ... ... -Border-+|| |
256 | | Shadow---- ... ----- ... --------------------- ... ... --Shadow-+| |
257 */
258 enum {
259  kLeftInset = 4,
260  kRightInset = kLeftInset,
261  kTopInset = 4,
262  kShadowThickness = 1,
263  kBorderThickness = 1,
264  kTopMargin = kTopInset + kBorderThickness,
265  kBottomMargin = kShadowThickness + kBorderThickness,
266  kLeftMargin = kLeftInset + kBorderThickness,
267  kRightMargin = kRightInset + kShadowThickness + kBorderThickness,
268 
269  kTimerInterval = 50, // milliseconds
270  kOneSecondCountdown = 1000 / kTimerInterval,
271 };
272 
273 enum {
274  // PRL:
275  // Mouse must move at least this far to distinguish ctrl-drag to scrub
276  // from ctrl-click for playback.
277  SCRUBBING_PIXEL_TOLERANCE = 10,
278 
279 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SCROLL_WHEEL
280  ScrubSpeedStepsPerOctave = 4,
281 #endif
282 };
283 
284 // Is the distance between A and B less than D?
285 template < class A, class B, class DIST > bool within(A a, B b, DIST d)
286 {
287  return (a > b - d) && (a < b + d);
288 }
289 
290 template < class LOW, class MID, class HIGH >
291  bool between_incexc(LOW l, MID m, HIGH h)
292 {
293  return (m >= l && m < h);
294 }
295 
296 template < class CLIPPEE, class CLIPVAL >
297  void clip_top(CLIPPEE & clippee, CLIPVAL val)
298 {
299  if (clippee > val)
300  clippee = val;
301 }
302 
303 template < class CLIPPEE, class CLIPVAL >
304  void clip_bottom(CLIPPEE & clippee, CLIPVAL val)
305 {
306  if (clippee < val)
307  clippee = val;
308 }

330  OnRate22ID, // |
331  OnRate44ID, // |
332  OnRate48ID, // | Leave these in order
333  OnRate88ID, // |
334  OnRate96ID, // |
335  OnRate176ID, // | see OnTrackMenu()

337  OnRate352ID, // |
338  OnRate384ID, // |
339  OnRateOtherID, // |

367  OnLastSpectrumScaleID = OnFirstSpectrumScaleID + 19,

369  OnZoomInVerticalID,
370  OnZoomOutVerticalID,
371  OnZoomFitVerticalID,
372 };

379  EVT_KEY_UP(TrackPanel::OnKeyUp)

382  EVT_PAINT(TrackPanel::OnPaint)
383  EVT_SET_FOCUS(TrackPanel::OnSetFocus)
384  EVT_KILL_FOCUS(TrackPanel::OnKillFocus)

387  EVT_MENU(OnSetFontID, TrackPanel::OnSetFont)

391  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnMoveTopID, OnMoveBottomID, TrackPanel::OnMoveTrack)
392  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnUpOctaveID, OnDownOctaveID, TrackPanel::OnChangeOctave)
393  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnChannelLeftID, OnChannelMonoID,
394  TrackPanel::OnChannelChange)
395  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnWaveformID, OnSpectrumID, TrackPanel::OnSetDisplay)
396  EVT_MENU(OnSpectrogramSettingsID, TrackPanel::OnSpectrogramSettings)
397  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnRate8ID, OnRate384ID, TrackPanel::OnRateChange)
398  EVT_MENU_RANGE(On16BitID, OnFloatID, TrackPanel::OnFormatChange)

402  EVT_MENU(OnSplitStereoMonoID, TrackPanel::OnSplitStereoMono)

404

407  EVT_MENU(OnTimeTrackLogIntID, TrackPanel::OnTimeTrackLogInt)
408

410  EVT_MENU_RANGE(OnFirstSpectrumScaleID, OnLastSpectrumScaleID, TrackPanel::OnSpectrumScaleType)

413  EVT_MENU(OnZoomOutVerticalID, TrackPanel::OnZoomOutVertical)
414  EVT_MENU(OnZoomFitVerticalID, TrackPanel::OnZoomFitVertical)
415 
416  EVT_TIMER(wxID_ANY, TrackPanel::OnTimer)
417 END_EVENT_TABLE()
418 
421 wxCursor * MakeCursor( int WXUNUSED(CursorId), const char * pXpm[36], int HotX, int HotY )
422 {
423  wxCursor * pCursor;
424 
425 #ifdef CURSORS_SIZE32
426  const int HotAdjust =0;
427 #else
428  const int HotAdjust =8;
429 #endif
430 
431  wxImage Image = wxImage(wxBitmap(pXpm).ConvertToImage());
432  Image.SetMaskColour(255,0,0);
433  Image.SetMask();// Enable mask.
434 
435  Image.SetOption( wxIMAGE_OPTION_CUR_HOTSPOT_X, HotX-HotAdjust );
436  Image.SetOption( wxIMAGE_OPTION_CUR_HOTSPOT_Y, HotY-HotAdjust );
437  pCursor = new wxCursor( Image );
438 
439  return pCursor;
440 }
441 
442 
443 
444 // Don't warn us about using 'this' in the base member initializer list.
445 #ifndef __WXGTK__ //Get rid if this pragma for gtk
446 #pragma warning( disable: 4355 )
447 #endif
448 TrackPanel::TrackPanel(wxWindow * parent, wxWindowID id,
449  const wxPoint & pos,
450  const wxSize & size,
451  TrackList * tracks,
452  ViewInfo * viewInfo,
453  TrackPanelListener * listener,
454  AdornedRulerPanel * ruler)
455  : wxPanel(parent, id, pos, size, wxWANTS_CHARS | wxNO_BORDER),
456  mTrackInfo(this),
457  mListener(listener),
458  mTracks(tracks),
459  mViewInfo(viewInfo),
460  mRuler(ruler),
461  mTrackArtist(NULL),
462  mBacking(NULL),
463  mResizeBacking(false),
464  mRefreshBacking(false),
465  mConverter(NumericConverter::TIME),
466  mAutoScrolling(false),
467  mVertScrollRemainder(0),
468  vrulerSize(36,0)
469 #ifndef __WXGTK__ //Get rid if this pragma for gtk
470 #pragma warning( default: 4355 )
471 #endif
472 {
473  SetLabel(_("Track Panel"));
474  SetName(_("Track Panel"));
475  SetBackgroundStyle(wxBG_STYLE_PAINT);
476 
477  mAx = new TrackPanelAx( this );
478 #if wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY
479  SetAccessible( mAx );
480 #endif
481 
482  // Preinit the backing DC and bitmap so routines that require it will
483  // not cause a crash if they run before the panel is fully initialized.
484  mBacking = new wxBitmap(1, 1);
485  mBackingDC.SelectObject(*mBacking);
486 
487  mMouseCapture = IsUncaptured;
488  mSlideUpDownOnly = false;
489  mLabelTrackStartXPos=-1;
490  mCircularTrackNavigation = false;
491 
492  UpdatePrefs();
493 
494  mRedrawAfterStop = false;
495 
496  mPencilCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_PENCIL, DrawCursorXpm, 12, 22);
497  mSelectCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_IBEAM, IBeamCursorXpm, 17, 16);
498  mEnvelopeCursor= MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, EnvCursorXpm, 16, 16);
499  mDisabledCursor= MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_NO_ENTRY, DisabledCursorXpm,16, 16);
500  mSlideCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_SIZEWE, TimeCursorXpm, 16, 16);
501  mZoomInCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_MAGNIFIER, ZoomInCursorXpm, 19, 15);
502  mZoomOutCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_MAGNIFIER, ZoomOutCursorXpm, 19, 15);
503  mLabelCursorLeft = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, LabelCursorLeftXpm, 19, 15);
504  mLabelCursorRight = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, LabelCursorRightXpm, 16, 16);
505 
506 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
507  mBottomFrequencyCursor =
508  MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, BottomFrequencyCursorXpm, 16, 16);
509  mTopFrequencyCursor =
510  MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, TopFrequencyCursorXpm, 16, 16);
511  mBandWidthCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_ARROW, BandWidthCursorXpm, 16, 16);
512 #endif
513 
514 #if USE_MIDI
515  mStretchMode = stretchCenter;
516  mStretching = false;
517  mStretched = false;
518  mStretchStart = 0;
519  mStretchCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_BULLSEYE, StretchCursorXpm, 16, 16);
520  mStretchLeftCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_BULLSEYE,
521  StretchLeftCursorXpm, 16, 16);
522  mStretchRightCursor = MakeCursor( wxCURSOR_BULLSEYE,
523  StretchRightCursorXpm, 16, 16);
524 #endif
525 
526  mArrowCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_ARROW);
527  mSmoothCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_SPRAYCAN);
528  mResizeCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_SIZENS);
529  mRearrangeCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_HAND);
530  mAdjustLeftSelectionCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_POINT_LEFT);
531  mAdjustRightSelectionCursor = new wxCursor(wxCURSOR_POINT_RIGHT);
532 
533  mWaveTrackMenu = NULL;
534  mChannelItemsInsertionPoint = 0;
535 
536  mNoteTrackMenu = NULL;
537  mLabelTrackMenu = NULL;
538  mTimeTrackMenu = NULL;
539 
540  mRulerWaveformMenu = mRulerSpectrumMenu = NULL;
541 
542  BuildMenus();
543 
544  mTrackArtist = new TrackArtist();
545  mTrackArtist->SetInset(1, kTopMargin, kRightMargin, kBottomMargin);
546 
547  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
548  mPopupMenuTarget = NULL;
549 
550  mTimeCount = 0;
551  mTimer.parent = this;
552  mTimer.Start(kTimerInterval, FALSE);
553 
554  //Initialize a member variable pointing to the current
555  //drawing track.
556  mDrawingTrack =NULL;
557 
558  //More initializations, some of these for no other reason than
559  //to prevent runtime memory check warnings
560  mZoomStart = -1;
561  mZoomEnd = -1;
562  mPrevWidth = -1;
563  mPrevHeight = -1;
564 
565  // This is used to snap the cursor to the nearest track that
566  // lines up with it.
567  mSnapManager = NULL;
568  mSnapLeft = -1;
569  mSnapRight = -1;
570 
571  mLastCursorX = mNewCursorX = -1;
572  mLastIndicatorX = mNewIndicatorX = -1;
573  mCursorTime = -1.0;
574  mOldQPIndicatorPos = -1;
575 
576  // Register for tracklist updates
577  mTracks->Connect(EVT_TRACKLIST_RESIZED,
578  wxCommandEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnTrackListResized),
579  NULL,
580  this);
581  mTracks->Connect(EVT_TRACKLIST_UPDATED,
582  wxCommandEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnTrackListUpdated),
583  NULL,
584  this);
585 
586 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
587  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_INVALID;
588  mFrequencySnapper.reset(new SpectrumAnalyst());
589 
590  mLastF0 = mLastF1 = SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency;
591 #endif
592 
593  mSelStartValid = false;
594  mSelStart = 0;
595 
596 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
597  mScrubToken = -1;
598  mScrubStartClockTimeMillis = -1;
599  mScrubStartPosition = -1;
600  mMaxScrubSpeed = 1.0;
601  mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown = 0;
602  mScrubHasFocus = false;
603  mScrubSeekPress = false;
604 #endif
605 
606 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
607  mSmoothScrollingScrub = false;
608 #endif
609 
610 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SCROLL_WHEEL
611  mLogMaxScrubSpeed = 0;
612 #endif
613 
614  mInitialTrackSelection = new std::vector<bool>;
615 
616  if (wxTheApp)
617  wxTheApp->Connect
618  (wxEVT_ACTIVATE_APP,
619  wxActivateEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnActivateOrDeactivateApp), NULL, this);
620 }
621 
622 
623 TrackPanel::~TrackPanel()
624 {
625  mTimer.Stop();
626 
627  if (wxTheApp)
628  wxTheApp->Disconnect
629  (wxEVT_ACTIVATE_APP,
630  wxActivateEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnActivateOrDeactivateApp), NULL, this);
631 
632  // Unregister for tracklist updates
633  mTracks->Disconnect(EVT_TRACKLIST_UPDATED,
634  wxCommandEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnTrackListUpdated),
635  NULL,
636  this);
637  mTracks->Disconnect(EVT_TRACKLIST_RESIZED,
638  wxCommandEventHandler(TrackPanel::OnTrackListResized),
639  NULL,
640  this);
641 
642  // This can happen if a label is being edited and the user presses
643  // ALT+F4 or Command+Q
644  if (HasCapture())
645  ReleaseMouse();
646 
647  if (mBacking)
648  {
649  mBackingDC.SelectObject( wxNullBitmap );
650  delete mBacking;
651  }
652  delete mTrackArtist;
653 
654  delete mArrowCursor;
655  delete mPencilCursor;
656  delete mSelectCursor;
657  delete mEnvelopeCursor;
658  delete mDisabledCursor;
659  delete mSlideCursor;
660  delete mResizeCursor;
661  delete mSmoothCursor;
662  delete mZoomInCursor;
663  delete mZoomOutCursor;
664  delete mLabelCursorLeft;
665  delete mLabelCursorRight;
666  delete mRearrangeCursor;
667  delete mAdjustLeftSelectionCursor;
668  delete mAdjustRightSelectionCursor;
669 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
670  delete mBottomFrequencyCursor;
671  delete mTopFrequencyCursor;
672  delete mBandWidthCursor;
673 #endif
674 #if USE_MIDI
675  delete mStretchCursor;
676  delete mStretchLeftCursor;
677  delete mStretchRightCursor;
678 #endif
679 
680  delete mSnapManager;
681 
682  DeleteMenus();
683 
684 #if !wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY
685  delete mAx;
686 #endif
687 
688  delete mInitialTrackSelection;
689 }
690 
691 void TrackPanel::BuildMenus(void)
692 {
693  // Get rid of existing menus
694  DeleteMenus();
695 
696  // Use AppendCheckItem so we can have ticks beside the items.
697  // We would use AppendRadioItem but it only currently works on windows and GTK.
698  mRateMenu = new wxMenu();
699  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate8ID, wxT("8000 Hz"));
700  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate11ID, wxT("11025 Hz"));
701  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate16ID, wxT("16000 Hz"));
702  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate22ID, wxT("22050 Hz"));
703  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate44ID, wxT("44100 Hz"));
704  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate48ID, wxT("48000 Hz"));
705  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate88ID, wxT("88200 Hz"));
706  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate96ID, wxT("96000 Hz"));
707  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate176ID, wxT("176400 Hz"));
708  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate192ID, wxT("192000 Hz"));
709  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate352ID, wxT("352800 Hz"));
710  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRate384ID, wxT("384000 Hz"));
711  mRateMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnRateOtherID, _("&Other..."));
712 
713  mFormatMenu = new wxMenu();
714  mFormatMenu->AppendRadioItem(On16BitID, GetSampleFormatStr(int16Sample));
715  mFormatMenu->AppendRadioItem(On24BitID, GetSampleFormatStr(int24Sample));
716  mFormatMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnFloatID, GetSampleFormatStr(floatSample));
717 
718  /* build the pop-down menu used on wave (sampled audio) tracks */
719  mWaveTrackMenu = new wxMenu();
720  BuildCommonDropMenuItems(mWaveTrackMenu); // does name, up/down etc
721  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnWaveformID, _("Wa&veform"));
722  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnWaveformDBID, _("&Waveform (dB)"));
723  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnSpectrumID, _("&Spectrogram"));
724  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(OnSpectrogramSettingsID, _("S&pectrogram Settings..."));
725  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendSeparator();
726 
727  // include both mono and stereo items as a work around for bug 1250
728 
729  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnChannelMonoID, _("&Mono"));
730  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnChannelLeftID, _("&Left Channel"));
731  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendRadioItem(OnChannelRightID, _("&Right Channel"));
732  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(OnMergeStereoID, _("Ma&ke Stereo Track"));
733  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(OnSwapChannelsID, _("Swap Stereo &Channels"));
734  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(OnSplitStereoID, _("Spl&it Stereo Track"));
735  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(OnSplitStereoMonoID, _("Split Stereo to Mo&no"));
736  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendSeparator();
737 
738  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(0, _("&Format"), mFormatMenu);
739 
740  mWaveTrackMenu->AppendSeparator();
741 
742  mWaveTrackMenu->Append(0, _("Rat&e"), mRateMenu);
743 
744  /* build the pop-down menu used on note (MIDI) tracks */
745  mNoteTrackMenu = new wxMenu();
746  BuildCommonDropMenuItems(mNoteTrackMenu); // does name, up/down etc
747  mNoteTrackMenu->Append(OnUpOctaveID, _("Up &Octave"));
748  mNoteTrackMenu->Append(OnDownOctaveID, _("Down Octa&ve"));
749 
750  /* build the pop-down menu used on label tracks */
751  mLabelTrackMenu = new wxMenu();
752  BuildCommonDropMenuItems(mLabelTrackMenu); // does name, up/down etc
753  mLabelTrackMenu->Append(OnSetFontID, _("&Font..."));
754 
755  /* build the pop-down menu used on time warping tracks */
756  mTimeTrackMenu = new wxMenu();
757  BuildCommonDropMenuItems(mTimeTrackMenu); // does name, up/down etc
758  mTimeTrackMenu->Append(OnTimeTrackLinID, _("&Linear"));
759  mTimeTrackMenu->Append(OnTimeTrackLogID, _("L&ogarithmic"));
760  mTimeTrackMenu->AppendSeparator();
761  mTimeTrackMenu->Append(OnSetTimeTrackRangeID, _("&Range..."));
762  mTimeTrackMenu->AppendCheckItem(OnTimeTrackLogIntID, _("Logarithmic &Interpolation"));
763 
764  mRulerWaveformMenu = new wxMenu();
765  BuildVRulerMenuItems
766  (mRulerWaveformMenu, OnFirstWaveformScaleID,
767  WaveformSettings::GetScaleNames());
768 
769  mRulerSpectrumMenu = new wxMenu();
770  BuildVRulerMenuItems
771  (mRulerSpectrumMenu, OnFirstSpectrumScaleID,
772  SpectrogramSettings::GetScaleNames());
773 }
774 
775 void TrackPanel::BuildCommonDropMenuItems(wxMenu * menu)
776 {
777  menu->Append(OnSetNameID, _("&Name..."));
778  menu->AppendSeparator();
779  menu->Append(OnMoveUpID, _("Move Track &Up") + wxT("\t") +
780  (GetProject()->GetCommandManager()->GetKeyFromName(wxT("TrackMoveUp"))));
781  menu->Append(OnMoveDownID, _("Move Track &Down") + wxT("\t") +
782  (GetProject()->GetCommandManager()->GetKeyFromName(wxT("TrackMoveDown"))));
783  menu->Append(OnMoveTopID, _("Move Track to &Top") + wxT("\t") +
784  (GetProject()->GetCommandManager()->GetKeyFromName(wxT("TrackMoveTop"))));
785  menu->Append(OnMoveBottomID, _("Move Track to &Bottom") + wxT("\t") +
786  (GetProject()->GetCommandManager()->GetKeyFromName(wxT("TrackMoveBottom"))));
787  menu->AppendSeparator();
788 
789 }
790 
791 // static
792 void TrackPanel::BuildVRulerMenuItems
793 (wxMenu * menu, int firstId, const wxArrayString &names)
794 {
795  int id = firstId;
796  for (int ii = 0, nn = names.size(); ii < nn; ++ii)
797  menu->AppendRadioItem(id++, names[ii]);
798  menu->AppendSeparator();
799  menu->Append(OnZoomInVerticalID, _("Zoom In\tLeft-Click/Left-Drag"));
800  menu->Append(OnZoomOutVerticalID, _("Zoom Out\tShift-Left-Click"));
801  menu->Append(OnZoomFitVerticalID, _("Zoom to Fit\tShift-Right-Click"));
802 }
803 
804 void TrackPanel::DeleteMenus(void)
805 {
806  // Note that the submenus (mRateMenu, ...)
807  // are deleted by their parent
808  if (mWaveTrackMenu) {
809  delete mWaveTrackMenu;
810  mWaveTrackMenu = NULL;
811  }
812 
813  if (mNoteTrackMenu) {
814  delete mNoteTrackMenu;
815  mNoteTrackMenu = NULL;
816  }
817 
818  if (mLabelTrackMenu) {
819  delete mLabelTrackMenu;
820  mLabelTrackMenu = NULL;
821  }
822 
823  if (mTimeTrackMenu) {
824  delete mTimeTrackMenu;
825  mTimeTrackMenu = NULL;
826  }
827 
828  delete mRulerWaveformMenu;
829  delete mRulerSpectrumMenu;
830 }
831 
832 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
833 void TrackPanel::UpdateVirtualStereoOrder()
834 {
835  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
836  Track *t;
837  int temp;
838 
839  for (t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
840  if(t->GetKind() == Track::Wave && t->GetChannel() == Track::MonoChannel){
841  WaveTrack *wt = (WaveTrack*)t;
842 
843  if(WaveTrack::mMonoAsVirtualStereo && wt->GetPan() != 0){
844  temp = wt->GetHeight();
845  wt->SetHeight(temp*wt->GetVirtualTrackPercentage());
846  wt->SetHeight(temp - wt->GetHeight(),true);
847  }else if(!WaveTrack::mMonoAsVirtualStereo && wt->GetPan() != 0){
848  wt->SetHeight(wt->GetHeight() + wt->GetHeight(true));
849  }
850  }
851  }
852  t = iter.First();
853  if(t){
854  t->ReorderList(false);
855  }
856 }
857 #endif
858 
859 void TrackPanel::UpdatePrefs()
860 {
861  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/AutoScroll"), &mViewInfo->bUpdateTrackIndicator,
862  true);
863  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/AdjustSelectionEdges"), &mAdjustSelectionEdges,
864  true);
865  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/CircularTrackNavigation"), &mCircularTrackNavigation,
866  false);
867  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/Solo"), &mSoloPref, wxT("Simple"));
868 
869 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
870  bool temp = WaveTrack::mMonoAsVirtualStereo;
871  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/MonoAsVirtualStereo"), &WaveTrack::mMonoAsVirtualStereo,
872  false);
873 
874  if(WaveTrack::mMonoAsVirtualStereo != temp)
875  UpdateVirtualStereoOrder();
876 #endif
877 
878  mViewInfo->UpdatePrefs();
879 
880  if (mTrackArtist) {
881  mTrackArtist->UpdatePrefs();
882  }
883 
884  // All vertical rulers must be recalculated since the minimum and maximum
885  // frequences may have been changed.
886  UpdateVRulers();
887  Refresh();
888 }
889 
893 void TrackPanel::SetCapturedTrack( Track * t, enum MouseCaptureEnum MouseCapture )
894 {
895 #if defined(__WXDEBUG__)
896  if (t == NULL) {
897  wxASSERT(MouseCapture == IsUncaptured);
898  }
899  else {
900  wxASSERT(MouseCapture != IsUncaptured);
901  }
902 #endif
903  mCapturedTrack = t;
904  mMouseCapture = MouseCapture;
905 }
906 
907 void TrackPanel::SelectNone()
908 {
909  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
910  Track *t = iter.First();
911  while (t) {
912  t->SetSelected(false);
913  t = iter.Next();
914  }
915 }
916 
918 void TrackPanel::SelectTracksByLabel( LabelTrack *lt )
919 {
920  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
921  Track *t = iter.First();
922 
923  //do nothing if at least one other track is selected
924  while (t) {
925  if( t->GetSelected() && t != lt )
926  return;
927  t = iter.Next();
928  }
929 
930  //otherwise, select all tracks
931  t = iter.First();
932  while( t )
933  {
934  t->SetSelected( true );
935  t = iter.Next();
936  }
937 }
938 
939 // Set selection length to the length of a track -- but if sync-lock is turned
940 // on, use the largest possible selection in the sync-lock group.
941 // If it's a stereo track, do the same for the stereo channels.
942 void TrackPanel::SelectTrackLength(Track *t)
943 {
944  AudacityProject *p = GetActiveProject();
945  SyncLockedTracksIterator it(mTracks);
946  Track *t1 = it.StartWith(t);
947  double minOffset = t->GetOffset();
948  double maxEnd = t->GetEndTime();
949 
950  // If we have a sync-lock group and sync-lock linking is on,
951  // check the sync-lock group tracks.
952  if (p->IsSyncLocked() && t1 != NULL)
953  {
954  for ( ; t1; t1 = it.Next())
955  {
956  if (t1->GetOffset() < minOffset)
957  minOffset = t1->GetOffset();
958  if (t1->GetEndTime() > maxEnd)
959  maxEnd = t1->GetEndTime();
960  }
961  }
962  else
963  {
964  // Otherwise, check for a stereo pair
965  t1 = t->GetLink();
966  if (t1)
967  {
968  if (t1->GetOffset() < minOffset)
969  minOffset = t1->GetOffset();
970  if (t1->GetEndTime() > maxEnd)
971  maxEnd = t1->GetEndTime();
972  }
973  }
974 
975  // PRL: double click or click on track control.
976  // should this select all frequencies too? I think not.
977  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(minOffset, maxEnd);
978 }
979 
980 void TrackPanel::GetTracksUsableArea(int *width, int *height) const
981 {
982  GetSize(width, height);
983  if (width) {
984  *width -= GetLeftOffset();
985  *width -= kRightMargin;
986  *width = std::max(0, *width);
987  }
988 }
989 
992 AudacityProject * TrackPanel::GetProject() const
993 {
994  //JKC casting away constness here.
995  //Do it in two stages in case 'this' is not a wxWindow.
996  //when the compiler will flag the error.
997  wxWindow const * const pConstWind = this;
998  wxWindow * pWind=(wxWindow*)pConstWind;
999 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_NOTEBOOK
1000  pWind = pWind->GetParent(); //Page
1001  wxASSERT( pWind );
1002  pWind = pWind->GetParent(); //Notebook
1003  wxASSERT( pWind );
1004 #endif
1005  pWind = pWind->GetParent(); //MainPanel
1006  wxASSERT( pWind );
1007  pWind = pWind->GetParent(); //Project
1008  wxASSERT( pWind );
1009  return (AudacityProject*)pWind;
1010 }
1011 
1013 void TrackPanel::OnTimer(wxTimerEvent& )
1014 {
1015  mTimeCount++;
1016  // AS: If the user is dragging the mouse and there is a track that
1017  // has captured the mouse, then scroll the screen, as necessary.
1018  if ((mMouseCapture==IsSelecting) && mCapturedTrack) {
1019  ScrollDuringDrag();
1020  }
1021 
1022  AudacityProject *const p = GetProject();
1023 
1024  // Check whether we were playing or recording, but the stream has stopped.
1025  if (p->GetAudioIOToken()>0 && !IsAudioActive())
1026  {
1027  //the stream may have been started up after this one finished (by some other project)
1028  //in that case reset the buttons don't stop the stream
1029  p->GetControlToolBar()->StopPlaying(!gAudioIO->IsStreamActive());
1030  }
1031 
1032  // Next, check to see if we were playing or recording
1033  // audio, but now Audio I/O is completely finished.
1034  if (p->GetAudioIOToken()>0 &&
1035  !gAudioIO->IsAudioTokenActive(p->GetAudioIOToken()))
1036  {
1037  p->FixScrollbars();
1038  p->SetAudioIOToken(0);
1039  p->RedrawProject();
1040 
1041  mRedrawAfterStop = false;
1042 
1043  //ANSWER-ME: Was DisplaySelection added to solve a repaint problem?
1044  DisplaySelection();
1045  }
1046 
1047  // Notify listeners for timer ticks
1048  {
1049  wxCommandEvent e(EVT_TRACK_PANEL_TIMER);
1050  p->GetEventHandler()->ProcessEvent(e);
1051  }
1052 
1053  const double playPos = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
1054 
1055  // The sequence of the next two is important.
1056 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
1057  TimerUpdateScrubbing(playPos);
1058 #endif
1059  TimerUpdateIndicator(playPos);
1060 
1061  DrawOverlays(false);
1062 
1063  if(IsAudioActive() && gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels()) {
1064 
1065  // Periodically update the display while recording
1066 
1067  if (!mRedrawAfterStop) {
1068  mRedrawAfterStop = true;
1069  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
1070  mListener->TP_ScrollUpDown( 99999999 );
1071  Refresh( false );
1072  }
1073  else {
1074  if ((mTimeCount % 5) == 0) {
1075  // Must tell OnPaint() to recreate the backing bitmap
1076  // since we've not done a full refresh.
1077  mRefreshBacking = true;
1078  Refresh( false );
1079  }
1080  }
1081  }
1082  if(mTimeCount > 1000)
1083  mTimeCount = 0;
1084 }
1085 
1089 void TrackPanel::ScrollDuringDrag()
1090 {
1091  // DM: If we're "autoscrolling" (which means that we're scrolling
1092  // because the user dragged from inside to outside the window,
1093  // not because the user clicked in the scroll bar), then
1094  // the selection code needs to be handled slightly differently.
1095  // We set this flag ("mAutoScrolling") to tell the selecting
1096  // code that we didn't get here as a result of a mouse event,
1097  // and therefore it should ignore the mouseEvent parameter,
1098  // and instead use the last known mouse position. Setting
1099  // this flag also causes the Mac to redraw immediately rather
1100  // than waiting for the next update event; this makes scrolling
1101  // smoother on MacOS 9.
1102 
1103  if (mMouseMostRecentX >= mCapturedRect.x + mCapturedRect.width) {
1104  mAutoScrolling = true;
1105  mListener->TP_ScrollRight();
1106  }
1107  else if (mMouseMostRecentX < mCapturedRect.x) {
1108  mAutoScrolling = true;
1109  mListener->TP_ScrollLeft();
1110  }
1111 
1112  if (mAutoScrolling) {
1113  // AS: To keep the selection working properly as we scroll,
1114  // we fake a mouse event (remember, this method is called
1115  // from a timer tick).
1116 
1117  // AS: For some reason, GCC won't let us pass this directly.
1118  wxMouseEvent e(wxEVT_MOTION);
1119  HandleSelect(e);
1120  mAutoScrolling = false;
1121  }
1122 }
1123 
1124 void TrackPanel::DrawQuickPlayIndicator(int x, bool snapped)
1125 {
1126  wxClientDC dc(this);
1127 
1128  // Erase the old indicator.
1129  if (mOldQPIndicatorPos != x) {
1130 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
1131  // On OSX, if a HiDPI resolution is being used, the line will actually take up
1132  // more than 1 pixel (even though it is drawn as 1), so we restore the surrounding
1133  // pixels as well. (This is because the wxClientDC doesn't know about the scaling.)
1134  dc.Blit(mOldQPIndicatorPos - 1, 0, 3, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mOldQPIndicatorPos - 1, 0);
1135 #else
1136  dc.Blit(mOldQPIndicatorPos, 0, 1, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mOldQPIndicatorPos, 0);
1137 #endif
1138 
1139  mOldQPIndicatorPos = -1;
1140  }
1141 
1142  if (x >= 0) {
1143  snapped ? AColor::SnapGuidePen(&dc) : AColor::Light(&dc, false);
1144 
1145  // Draw indicator in all visible tracks
1146  VisibleTrackIterator iter(GetProject());
1147  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next())
1148  {
1149  // Convert virtual coordinate to physical
1150  int y = t->GetY() - mViewInfo->vpos;
1151 
1152  // Draw the NEW indicator in its new location
1153  AColor::Line(dc,
1154  x,
1155  y + kTopMargin,
1156  x,
1157  // Minus one more because AColor::Line includes both endpoints
1158  y + t->GetHeight() - kBottomMargin - 1 );
1159  }
1160 
1161  mOldQPIndicatorPos = x;
1162  }
1163 }
1164 
1165 double TrackPanel::GetScreenEndTime() const
1166 {
1167  int width;
1168  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
1169  return mViewInfo->PositionToTime(width, true);
1170 }
1171 
1172 void TrackPanel::TimerUpdateIndicator(double playPos)
1173 {
1174  if (!IsAudioActive())
1175  mNewIndicatorX = -1;
1176  else {
1177  // Calculate the horizontal position of the indicator
1178 
1179  AudacityProject *p = GetProject();
1180  const bool
1181  onScreen = playPos >= 0.0 &&
1182  between_incexc(mViewInfo->h,
1183  playPos,
1184  GetScreenEndTime());
1185 
1186  // This displays the audio time, too...
1187  DisplaySelection();
1188 
1189  // BG: Scroll screen if option is set
1190  // msmeyer: But only if not playing looped or in one-second mode
1191  if( mViewInfo->bUpdateTrackIndicator &&
1192  p->mLastPlayMode != loopedPlay &&
1193  p->mLastPlayMode != oneSecondPlay &&
1194  playPos >= 0 &&
1195  !onScreen &&
1196  !gAudioIO->IsPaused() )
1197  {
1198  mListener->TP_ScrollWindow( playPos );
1199  }
1200 
1201  // Always update scrollbars even if not scrolling the window. This is
1202  // important when NEW audio is recorded, because this can change the
1203  // length of the project and therefore the appearance of the scrollbar.
1204  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
1205 
1206  mNewIndicatorX = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(playPos, GetLeftOffset());
1207  }
1208 }
1209 
1210 std::pair<wxRect, bool> TrackPanel::GetIndicatorRectangle()
1211 {
1212  wxRect rect(mLastIndicatorX, 0, 1, mBacking->GetHeight());
1213 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
1214  rect.Inflate(1, 0);
1215 #endif
1216 
1217  return std::make_pair(
1218  rect,
1219  mLastIndicatorX != mNewIndicatorX
1220  );
1221 }
1222 
1223 void TrackPanel::UndrawIndicator(wxDC & dc)
1224 {
1225  // AS: The "indicator" is the little graphical mark shown in the ruler
1226  // that indicates where the current play/record position is. (This also
1227  // draws the moving vertical line.)
1228 
1229  // Erase the old indicator.
1230  if (mLastIndicatorX != -1)
1231  {
1232  int width;
1233  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
1234  const bool
1235  onScreen = between_incexc(GetLeftOffset(),
1236  mLastIndicatorX,
1237  GetLeftOffset() + width);
1238  if (onScreen)
1239  {
1240  // LL: Keep from trying to blit outsize of the source DC. This results in a crash on
1241  // OSX due to allocating memory using negative sizes and can be caused by resizing
1242  // the project window while recording or playing.
1243  int w = dc.GetSize().GetWidth();
1244  if (mLastIndicatorX >= w) {
1245  mLastIndicatorX = w - 1;
1246  }
1247 
1248  // Restore the old position from the backing DC.
1249 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
1250  // On OSX, if a HiDPI resolution is being used, the line will actually take up
1251  // more than 1 pixel (even though it is drawn as 1), so we restore the surrounding
1252  // pixels as well. (This is because the wxClientDC doesn't know about the scaling.)
1253  dc.Blit(mLastIndicatorX - 1, 0, 3, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mLastIndicatorX - 1, 0);
1254 #else
1255  dc.Blit(mLastIndicatorX, 0, 1, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mLastIndicatorX, 0);
1256 #endif
1257  }
1258 
1259  mRuler->ClearIndicator();
1260  }
1261 }
1262 
1263 void TrackPanel::DoDrawIndicator(wxDC & dc)
1264 {
1265  mLastIndicatorX = mNewIndicatorX;
1266  if (mLastIndicatorX == -1)
1267  return;
1268 
1269  double pos = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mLastIndicatorX, GetLeftOffset());
1270 
1271  // Set play/record color
1272  bool rec = (gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels() > 0);
1273  AColor::IndicatorColor( &dc, !rec);
1274 
1275  mRuler->DrawIndicator( pos, rec );
1276 
1277  // Ensure that we don't draw through the TrackInfo or vertical ruler.
1278  wxRect clip = GetRect();
1279  int leftCutoff = clip.x + GetLeftOffset();
1280  int rightCutoff = clip.x + clip.width - kRightMargin;
1281  if (!between_incexc(leftCutoff, mLastIndicatorX, rightCutoff))
1282  {
1283  return;
1284  }
1285 
1286  // Draw indicator in all visible tracks
1287  VisibleTrackIterator iter( GetProject() );
1288  for( Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next() )
1289  {
1290  // Don't draw the indicator in label tracks
1291  if( t->GetKind() == Track::Label )
1292  {
1293  continue;
1294  }
1295 
1296  // Convert virtual coordinate to physical
1297  int y = t->GetY() - mViewInfo->vpos;
1298 
1299  // Draw the NEW indicator in its new location
1300  AColor::Line(dc,
1301  mLastIndicatorX,
1302  y + kTopMargin,
1303  mLastIndicatorX,
1304  // Minus one more because AColor::Line includes both endpoints
1305  y + t->GetHeight() - kBottomMargin - 1);
1306  }
1307 }
1308 
1309 #if 0
1310 // now unused
1315 void TrackPanel::DrawCursor()
1316 {
1317  wxClientDC dc( this );
1318  DoDrawCursor( dc );
1319 }
1320 #endif
1321 
1322 std::pair<wxRect, bool> TrackPanel::GetCursorRectangle()
1323 {
1324  if (!mViewInfo->selectedRegion.isPoint()) {
1325  mCursorTime = -1.0;
1326  mNewCursorX = -1;
1327  }
1328  else {
1329  mCursorTime = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
1330  mNewCursorX = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mCursorTime, GetLeftOffset());
1331  }
1332 
1333  wxRect rect(mLastCursorX, 0, 1, mBacking->GetHeight());
1334 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
1335  rect.Inflate(1, 0);
1336 #endif
1337 
1338  return std::make_pair(
1339  rect,
1340  mLastCursorX != mNewCursorX
1341  );
1342 }
1343 
1344 void TrackPanel::UndrawCursor(wxDC & dc)
1345 {
1346  bool onScreen;
1347 
1348  if( mLastCursorX != -1 )
1349  {
1350  int width;
1351  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
1352  onScreen = between_incexc(GetLeftOffset(),
1353  mLastCursorX,
1354  GetLeftOffset() + width);
1355  if( onScreen )
1356 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
1357  // On OSX, if a HiDPI resolution is being used, the line will actually take up
1358  // more than 1 pixel (even though it is drawn as 1), so we restore the surrounding
1359  // pixels as well. (This is because the wxClientDC doesn't know about the scaling.)
1360  dc.Blit(mLastCursorX - 1, 0, 3, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mLastCursorX - 1, 0);
1361 #else
1362  dc.Blit(mLastCursorX, 0, 1, mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, mLastCursorX, 0);
1363 #endif
1364  }
1365 }
1366 
1367 void TrackPanel::DoDrawCursor(wxDC & dc)
1368 {
1369  mLastCursorX = mNewCursorX;
1370  if (mLastCursorX == -1)
1371  return;
1372 
1373  const bool
1374  onScreen = between_incexc(mViewInfo->h,
1375  mCursorTime,
1376  GetScreenEndTime() );
1377 
1378  if( !onScreen )
1379  return;
1380 
1381  AColor::CursorColor(&dc);
1382 
1383  // Draw cursor in all selected tracks
1384  VisibleTrackIterator iter( GetProject() );
1385  for( Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next() )
1386  {
1387  if( t->GetSelected() || mAx->IsFocused( t ) )
1388  {
1389  int y = t->GetY() - mViewInfo->vpos;
1390  wxCoord top = y + kTopMargin;
1391  // Minus one more because AColor::Line includes both endpoints
1392  wxCoord bottom = y + t->GetHeight() - kBottomMargin - 1;
1393 
1394  // MB: warp() is not needed here as far as I know, in fact it creates a bug. Removing it fixes that.
1395  AColor::Line(dc, mLastCursorX, top, mLastCursorX, bottom); // <-- The whole point of this routine.
1396 
1397 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
1398  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(t)){
1399  y = t->GetY(true) - mViewInfo->vpos + 1;
1400  top = y + kTopInset;
1401  bottom = y + t->GetHeight(true) - kTopInset;
1402  AColor::Line( dc, mLastCursorX, top, mLastCursorX, bottom );
1403  }
1404 #endif
1405 
1406  }
1407  }
1408 
1409  // AS: Ah, no, this is where we draw the blinky thing in the ruler.
1410  mRuler->DrawCursor(mCursorTime);
1411 
1412  DisplaySelection();
1413 }
1414 
1416 void TrackPanel::OnSize(wxSizeEvent & /* event */)
1417 {
1418  // Tell OnPaint() to recreate the backing bitmap
1419  mResizeBacking = true;
1420 
1421  // Refresh the entire area. Really only need to refresh when
1422  // expanding...is it worth the trouble?
1423  Refresh();
1424 }
1425 
1428 void TrackPanel::OnPaint(wxPaintEvent & /* event */)
1429 {
1430 #if DEBUG_DRAW_TIMING
1431  wxStopWatch sw;
1432 #endif
1433 
1434  {
1435  wxPaintDC dc(this);
1436 
1437  // Retrieve the damage rectangle
1438  wxRect box = GetUpdateRegion().GetBox();
1439 
1440  // Recreate the backing bitmap if we have a full refresh
1441  // (See TrackPanel::Refresh())
1442  if (mRefreshBacking || (box == GetRect()))
1443  {
1444  // Reset (should a mutex be used???)
1445  mRefreshBacking = false;
1446 
1447  if (mResizeBacking)
1448  {
1449  // Reset
1450  mResizeBacking = false;
1451 
1452  // Delete the backing bitmap
1453  if (mBacking)
1454  {
1455  mBackingDC.SelectObject(wxNullBitmap);
1456  delete mBacking;
1457  mBacking = NULL;
1458  }
1459 
1460  wxSize sz = GetClientSize();
1461  mBacking = new wxBitmap();
1462  mBacking->Create(sz.x, sz.y); //, *dc);
1463  mBackingDC.SelectObject(*mBacking);
1464  }
1465 
1466  // Redraw the backing bitmap
1467  DrawTracks(&mBackingDC);
1468 
1469  // Copy it to the display
1470  dc.Blit(0, 0, mBacking->GetWidth(), mBacking->GetHeight(), &mBackingDC, 0, 0);
1471  }
1472  else
1473  {
1474  // Copy full, possibly clipped, damage rectangle
1475  dc.Blit(box.x, box.y, box.width, box.height, &mBackingDC, box.x, box.y);
1476  }
1477 
1478  // Done with the clipped DC
1479  }
1480 
1481  // Drawing now goes directly to the client area. It can't use the paint DC
1482  // becuase the paint DC might be clipped and DrawOverlays() may need to draw
1483  // outside the clipped region.
1484  DrawOverlays(true);
1485 
1486 #if DEBUG_DRAW_TIMING
1487  sw.Pause();
1488  wxLogDebug(wxT("Total: %ld milliseconds"), sw.Time());
1489  wxPrintf(wxT("Total: %ld milliseconds\n"), sw.Time());
1490 #endif
1491 }
1492 
1495 void TrackPanel::MakeParentPushState(const wxString &desc, const wxString &shortDesc,
1496  UndoPush flags)
1497 {
1498  mListener->TP_PushState(desc, shortDesc, flags);
1499 }
1500 
1501 void TrackPanel::MakeParentPushState(const wxString &desc, const wxString &shortDesc)
1502 {
1503  MakeParentPushState(desc, shortDesc, UndoPush::AUTOSAVE);
1504 }
1505 
1506 void TrackPanel::MakeParentModifyState(bool bWantsAutoSave)
1507 {
1508  mListener->TP_ModifyState(bWantsAutoSave);
1509 }
1510 
1511 void TrackPanel::MakeParentRedrawScrollbars()
1512 {
1513  mListener->TP_RedrawScrollbars();
1514 }
1515 
1516 void TrackPanel::HandleEscapeKey(bool down)
1517 {
1518  if (!down)
1519  return;
1520 
1521  switch (mMouseCapture)
1522  {
1523  case IsSelecting:
1524  {
1525  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
1526  std::vector<bool>::const_iterator
1527  it = mInitialTrackSelection->begin(),
1528  end = mInitialTrackSelection->end();
1529  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
1530  wxASSERT(it != end);
1531  t->SetSelected(*it++);
1532  }
1533  mViewInfo->selectedRegion = mInitialSelection;
1534  }
1535  break;
1536  case IsZooming:
1537  case IsVZooming:
1538  //case IsAdjustingSample:
1539  break;
1540  case IsResizing:
1541  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(mInitialActualHeight);
1542  mCapturedTrack->SetMinimized(mInitialMinimized);
1543  break;
1544  case IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks:
1545  {
1546  Track *const next = mTracks->GetNext(mCapturedTrack);
1547  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(mInitialUpperActualHeight);
1548  mCapturedTrack->SetMinimized(mInitialMinimized);
1549  next->SetHeight(mInitialActualHeight);
1550  next->SetMinimized(mInitialMinimized);
1551  }
1552  break;
1553  case IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks:
1554  {
1555  Track *const prev = mTracks->GetPrev(mCapturedTrack);
1556  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(mInitialActualHeight);
1557  mCapturedTrack->SetMinimized(mInitialMinimized);
1558  prev->SetHeight(mInitialUpperActualHeight);
1559  prev->SetMinimized(mInitialMinimized);
1560  }
1561  break;
1562  default:
1563  return;
1564  }
1565 
1566  // Common part in all cases that do anything
1567  SetCapturedTrack(NULL, IsUncaptured);
1568  if (HasCapture())
1569  ReleaseMouse();
1570  wxMouseEvent dummy;
1571  HandleCursor(dummy);
1572  Refresh(false);
1573 }
1574 
1575 void TrackPanel::HandleAltKey(bool down)
1576 {
1577  mLastMouseEvent.m_altDown = down;
1578  HandleCursorForLastMouseEvent();
1579 }
1580 
1581 void TrackPanel::HandleShiftKey(bool down)
1582 {
1583  mLastMouseEvent.m_shiftDown = down;
1584  HandleCursorForLastMouseEvent();
1585 }
1586 
1587 void TrackPanel::HandleControlKey(bool down)
1588 {
1589  mLastMouseEvent.m_controlDown = down;
1590  HandleCursorForLastMouseEvent();
1591 }
1592 
1593 void TrackPanel::HandlePageUpKey()
1594 {
1595  mListener->TP_ScrollWindow(GetScreenEndTime());
1596 }
1597 
1598 void TrackPanel::HandlePageDownKey()
1599 {
1600  mListener->TP_ScrollWindow(2 * mViewInfo->h - GetScreenEndTime());
1601 }
1602 
1603 void TrackPanel::HandleCursorForLastMouseEvent()
1604 {
1605  HandleCursor(mLastMouseEvent);
1606 }
1607 
1608 MixerBoard* TrackPanel::GetMixerBoard()
1609 {
1610  AudacityProject *p = GetProject();
1611  wxASSERT(p);
1612  return p->GetMixerBoard();
1613 }
1614 
1618 bool TrackPanel::IsUnsafe()
1619 {
1620  return IsAudioActive();
1621 }
1622 
1623 bool TrackPanel::IsAudioActive()
1624 {
1625  AudacityProject *p = GetProject();
1626  return p->IsAudioActive();
1627 }
1628 
1629 
1633 bool TrackPanel::SetCursorByActivity( )
1634 {
1635  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
1636 
1637  switch( mMouseCapture )
1638  {
1639  case IsSelecting:
1640  SetCursor(*mSelectCursor);
1641  return true;
1642  case IsSliding:
1643  SetCursor( unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mSlideCursor);
1644  return true;
1645  case IsEnveloping:
1646  SetCursor( unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mEnvelopeCursor);
1647  return true;
1648  case IsRearranging:
1649  SetCursor( unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mRearrangeCursor);
1650  return true;
1651  case IsAdjustingLabel:
1652  case IsSelectingLabelText:
1653  return true;
1654 #ifdef USE_MIDI
1655  case IsStretching:
1656  SetCursor( unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mStretchCursor);
1657  return true;
1658 #endif
1659  default:
1660  break;
1661  }
1662  return false;
1663 }
1664 
1665 bool TrackPanel::SetCursorForCutline(WaveTrack * track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent &event)
1666 {
1667  if (IsOverCutline(track, rect, event)) {
1668  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
1669  SetCursor(unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mArrowCursor);
1670  return true;
1671  // No tip string?
1672  }
1673  return false;
1674 }
1675 
1678 void TrackPanel::SetCursorAndTipWhenInLabel( Track * t,
1679  wxMouseEvent &event, wxString &tip )
1680 {
1681  if (event.m_x >= GetVRulerOffset() && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) )
1682  {
1683  tip = _("Click to vertically zoom in. Shift-click to zoom out. Drag to specify a zoom region.");
1684  SetCursor(event.ShiftDown()? *mZoomOutCursor : *mZoomInCursor);
1685  }
1686 #ifdef USE_MIDI
1687  else if (event.m_x >= GetVRulerOffset() && t->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
1688  tip = _("Click to verticaly zoom in, Shift-click to zoom out, Drag to create a particular zoom region.");
1689  SetCursor(event.ShiftDown() ? *mZoomOutCursor : *mZoomInCursor);
1690  }
1691 #endif
1692  else {
1693  // Set a status message if over TrackInfo.
1694  tip = _("Drag the track vertically to change the order of the tracks.");
1695  SetCursor(*mArrowCursor);
1696  }
1697 }
1698 
1700 void TrackPanel::SetCursorAndTipWhenInVResizeArea( bool bLinked, wxString &tip )
1701 {
1702  // Check to see whether it is the first channel of a stereo track
1703  if (bLinked) {
1704  // If we are in the label we got here 'by mistake' and we're
1705  // not actually in the resize area at all. (The resize area
1706  // is shorter when it is between stereo tracks).
1707 
1708  tip = _("Click and drag to adjust relative size of stereo tracks.");
1709  SetCursor(*mResizeCursor);
1710  } else {
1711  tip = _("Click and drag to resize the track.");
1712  SetCursor(*mResizeCursor);
1713  }
1714 }
1715 
1718 void TrackPanel::SetCursorAndTipWhenInLabelTrack( LabelTrack * pLT,
1719  wxMouseEvent & event, wxString &tip )
1720 {
1721  int edge=pLT->OverGlyph(event.m_x, event.m_y);
1722  if(edge !=0)
1723  {
1724  SetCursor(*mArrowCursor);
1725  }
1726 
1727  //KLUDGE: We refresh the whole Label track when the icon hovered over
1728  //changes colouration. As well as being inefficient we are also
1729  //doing stuff that should be delegated to the label track itself.
1730  edge += pLT->mbHitCenter ? 4:0;
1731  if( edge != pLT->mOldEdge )
1732  {
1733  pLT->mOldEdge = edge;
1734  RefreshTrack( pLT );
1735  }
1736  // IF edge!=0 THEN we've set the cursor and we're done.
1737  // signal this by setting the tip.
1738  if( edge != 0 )
1739  {
1740  tip =
1741  (pLT->mbHitCenter ) ?
1742  _("Drag one or more label boundaries.") :
1743  _("Drag label boundary.");
1744  }
1745 }
1746 
1747 namespace {
1748 
1749 // This returns true if we're a spectral editing track.
1750 inline bool isSpectralSelectionTrack(const Track *pTrack) {
1751  if (pTrack &&
1752  pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
1753  const WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<const WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
1754  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = wt->GetSpectrogramSettings();
1755  const int display = wt->GetDisplay();
1756  return (display == WaveTrack::Spectrum) && settings.SpectralSelectionEnabled();
1757  }
1758  else {
1759  return false;
1760  }
1761 }
1762 
1763 } // namespace
1764 
1765 // If we're in OnDemand mode, we may change the tip.
1766 void TrackPanel::MaySetOnDemandTip( Track * t, wxString &tip )
1767 {
1768  wxASSERT( t );
1769  //For OD regions, we need to override and display the percent complete for this task.
1770  //first, make sure it's a wavetrack.
1771  if(t->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
1772  return;
1773  //see if the wavetrack exists in the ODManager (if the ODManager exists)
1774  if(!ODManager::IsInstanceCreated())
1775  return;
1776  //ask the wavetrack for the corresponding tip - it may not change tip, but that's fine.
1777  ODManager::Instance()->FillTipForWaveTrack(static_cast<WaveTrack*>(t), tip);
1778  return;
1779 }
1780 
1781 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
1782 void TrackPanel::HandleCenterFrequencyCursor
1783 (bool shiftDown, wxString &tip, const wxCursor ** ppCursor)
1784 {
1785 #ifndef SPECTRAL_EDITING_ESC_KEY
1786  tip =
1787  shiftDown ?
1788  _("Click and drag to move center selection frequency.") :
1789  _("Click and drag to move center selection frequency to a spectral peak.");
1790 
1791 #else
1792  shiftDown;
1793 
1794  tip =
1795  _("Click and drag to move center selection frequency.");
1796 
1797 #endif
1798 
1799  *ppCursor = mEnvelopeCursor;
1800 }
1801 
1802 void TrackPanel::HandleCenterFrequencyClick
1803 (bool shiftDown, Track *pTrack, double value)
1804 {
1805  if (shiftDown) {
1806  // Disable time selection
1807  mSelStartValid = false;
1808  mFreqSelTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
1809  mFreqSelPin = value;
1810  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_DRAG_CENTER;
1811  }
1812  else {
1813 #ifndef SPECTRAL_EDITING_ESC_KEY
1814  // Start center snapping
1815  WaveTrack *wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
1816  // Turn center snapping on (the only way to do this)
1817  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER;
1818  // Disable time selection
1819  mSelStartValid = false;
1820  StartSnappingFreqSelection(wt);
1821 #endif
1822  }
1823 }
1824 #endif
1825 
1826 // The select tool can have different cursors and prompts depending on what
1827 // we hover over, most notably when hovering over the selction boundaries.
1828 // Determine and set the cursor and tip accordingly.
1829 void TrackPanel::SetCursorAndTipWhenSelectTool( Track * t,
1830  wxMouseEvent & event, wxRect &rect, bool bMultiToolMode,
1831  wxString &tip, const wxCursor ** ppCursor )
1832 {
1833  // Do not set the default cursor here and re-set later, that causes
1834  // flashing.
1835  *ppCursor = mSelectCursor;
1836 
1837  //In Multi-tool mode, give multitool prompt if no-special-hit.
1838  if( bMultiToolMode ) {
1839  // Look up the current key binding for Preferences.
1840  // (Don't assume it's the default!)
1841  wxString keyStr
1842  (GetProject()->GetCommandManager()->GetKeyFromName(wxT("Preferences")));
1843  if (keyStr.IsEmpty())
1844  // No keyboard preference defined for opening Preferences dialog
1845  /* i18n-hint: These are the names of a menu and a command in that menu */
1846  keyStr = _("Edit, Preferences...");
1847  else
1848  keyStr = KeyStringDisplay(keyStr);
1849  /* i18n-hint: %s is usually replaced by "Ctrl+P" for Windows/Linux, "Command+," for Mac */
1850  tip = wxString::Format(
1851  _("Multi-Tool Mode: %s for Mouse and Keyboard Preferences."),
1852  keyStr.c_str());
1853  // Later in this function we may point to some other string instead.
1854  }
1855 
1856  // Not over a track? Get out of here.
1857  if(!t)
1858  return;
1859 
1860  //Make sure we are within the selected track
1861  // Adjusting the selection edges can be turned off in
1862  // the preferences...
1863  if ( !t->GetSelected() || !mAdjustSelectionEdges)
1864  {
1865  MaySetOnDemandTip( t, tip );
1866  return;
1867  }
1868 
1869  {
1870  wxInt64 leftSel = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(), rect.x);
1871  wxInt64 rightSel = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1(), rect.x);
1872  // Something is wrong if right edge comes before left edge
1873  wxASSERT(!(rightSel < leftSel));
1874  }
1875 
1876  const bool bShiftDown = event.ShiftDown();
1877 
1878 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
1879  if ( (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER) &&
1880  isSpectralSelectionTrack(t)) {
1881  // Not shift-down, but center frequency snapping toggle is on
1882  tip = _("Click and drag to set frequency bandwidth.");
1883  *ppCursor = mEnvelopeCursor;
1884  return;
1885  }
1886 #endif
1887 
1888  // If not shift-down and not snapping center, then
1889  // choose boundaries only in snapping tolerance,
1890  // and may choose center.
1891  // But don't change the cursor when scrubbing.
1892  SelectionBoundary boundary =
1893 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
1894  IsScrubbing()
1895  ? SBNone
1896  :
1897 #endif
1898  ChooseBoundary(event, t, rect, !bShiftDown, !bShiftDown);
1899 
1900 #ifdef USE_MIDI
1901  // The MIDI HitTest will only succeed if we are on a midi track, so
1902  // typically we will fall through.
1903  switch( boundary) {
1904  case SBNone:
1905  case SBLeft:
1906  case SBRight:
1907  if ( HitTestStretch(t, rect, event)) {
1908  tip = _("Click and drag to stretch within selected region.");
1909  *ppCursor = mStretchCursor;
1910  return;
1911  }
1912  break;
1913  default:
1914  break;
1915  }
1916 #endif
1917 
1918  switch (boundary) {
1919  case SBNone:
1920  if( bShiftDown ){
1921  // wxASSERT( false );
1922  // Same message is used for moving left right top or bottom edge.
1923  tip = _("Click to move selection boundary to cursor.");
1924  // No cursor change.
1925  return;
1926  }
1927  break;
1928  case SBLeft:
1929  tip = _("Click and drag to move left selection boundary.");
1930  *ppCursor = mAdjustLeftSelectionCursor;
1931  return;
1932  case SBRight:
1933  tip = _("Click and drag to move right selection boundary.");
1934  *ppCursor = mAdjustRightSelectionCursor;
1935  return;
1936 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
1937  case SBBottom:
1938  tip = _("Click and drag to move bottom selection frequency.");
1939  *ppCursor = mBottomFrequencyCursor;
1940  return;
1941  case SBTop:
1942  tip = _("Click and drag to move top selection frequency.");
1943  *ppCursor = mTopFrequencyCursor;
1944  return;
1945  case SBCenter:
1946  HandleCenterFrequencyCursor(bShiftDown, tip, ppCursor);
1947  return;
1948  case SBWidth:
1949  tip = _("Click and drag to adjust frequency bandwidth.");
1950  *ppCursor = mBandWidthCursor;
1951  return;
1952 #endif
1953  default:
1954  wxASSERT(false);
1955  } // switch
1956  // Falls through the switch if there was no boundary found.
1957 
1958  MaySetOnDemandTip( t, tip );
1959 }
1960 
1963 void TrackPanel::SetCursorAndTipByTool( int tool,
1964  wxMouseEvent & event, wxString& )
1965 {
1966  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
1967 
1968  // Change the cursor based on the active tool.
1969  switch (tool) {
1970  case selectTool:
1971  wxFAIL;// should have already been handled
1972  break;
1973  case envelopeTool:
1974  SetCursor(unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mEnvelopeCursor);
1975  break;
1976  case slideTool:
1977  SetCursor(unsafe ? *mDisabledCursor : *mSlideCursor);
1978  break;
1979  case zoomTool:
1980  SetCursor(event.ShiftDown()? *mZoomOutCursor : *mZoomInCursor);
1981  break;
1982  case drawTool:
1983  if (unsafe)
1984  SetCursor(*mDisabledCursor);
1985  else
1986  SetCursor(event.AltDown()? *mSmoothCursor : *mPencilCursor);
1987  break;
1988  }
1989  // doesn't actually change the tip itself, but it could (should?) do at some
1990  // future date.
1991 }
1992 
1996 void TrackPanel::HandleCursor(wxMouseEvent & event)
1997 {
1998  mLastMouseEvent = event;
1999 
2000  // (1), If possible, set the cursor based on the current activity
2001  // ( leave the StatusBar alone ).
2002  if( SetCursorByActivity() )
2003  return;
2004 
2005  // (2) If we are not over a track at all, set the cursor to Arrow and
2006  // clear the StatusBar,
2007  wxRect labelRect, trackRect;
2008  Track *const label = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, true, &labelRect);
2009  Track *const nonlabel = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &trackRect);
2010  Track *const track = label ? label : nonlabel;
2011 
2012  if (!track) {
2013  SetCursor(*mArrowCursor);
2014  mListener->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(wxT(""));
2015  return;
2016  }
2017 
2018  // (3) The easy cases are done.
2019  // Now we've got to hit-test against a number of different possibilities.
2020  // We could be over the label or a vertical ruler etc...
2021 
2022  // Strategy here is to set the tip when we have determined and
2023  // set the correct cursor. We stop doing tests for what we've
2024  // hit once the tip is not NULL.
2025 
2026  wxString tip;
2027 
2028  // Are we within the vertical resize area?
2029  if (nonlabel
2030  ? within(event.m_y, trackRect.y + trackRect.height, TRACK_RESIZE_REGION)
2031  : within(event.m_y, labelRect.y + labelRect.height, TRACK_RESIZE_REGION))
2032  {
2033  SetCursorAndTipWhenInVResizeArea(nonlabel && track->GetLinked(), tip);
2034  // tip may still be NULL at this point, in which case we go on looking.
2035  }
2036 
2037  if ((tip == wxString()) && label) {
2038  SetCursorAndTipWhenInLabel( label, event, tip );
2039  }
2040 
2041  // Otherwise, we must be over a track of some kind
2042  // Is it a label track?
2043  if ((tip == wxString()) && (track->GetKind() == Track::Label))
2044  {
2045  // We are over a label track
2046  SetCursorAndTipWhenInLabelTrack( static_cast<LabelTrack*>(track), event, tip );
2047  // ..and if we haven't yet determined the cursor,
2048  // we go on to do all the standard track hit tests.
2049  }
2050 
2051  if ((tip == wxString()) &&
2052  nonlabel &&
2053  nonlabel->GetKind() == Track::Wave &&
2054  SetCursorForCutline(static_cast<WaveTrack*>(nonlabel), trackRect, event))
2055  return;
2056 
2057  if( tip == wxString() )
2058  {
2059  ToolsToolBar * ttb = mListener->TP_GetToolsToolBar();
2060  if( ttb == NULL )
2061  return;
2062  // JKC: DetermineToolToUse is called whenever the mouse
2063  // moves. I had some worries about calling it when in
2064  // multimode as it then has to hit-test all 'objects' in
2065  // the track panel, but performance seems fine in
2066  // practice (on a P500).
2067  int tool = DetermineToolToUse( ttb, event );
2068 
2069  tip = ttb->GetMessageForTool(tool);
2070 
2071  // We don't include the select tool in
2072  // SetCursorAndTipByTool() because it's more complex than
2073  // the other tool cases.
2074  if( tool != selectTool )
2075  {
2076  SetCursorAndTipByTool( tool, event, tip);
2077  }
2078  else
2079  {
2080  bool bMultiToolMode = ttb->IsDown(multiTool);
2081  const wxCursor *pSelection = 0;
2082  SetCursorAndTipWhenSelectTool
2083  ( track, event, trackRect, bMultiToolMode, tip, &pSelection );
2084  if (pSelection)
2085  // Set cursor once only here, to avoid flashing during drags
2086  SetCursor(*pSelection);
2087  }
2088  }
2089 
2090  if (tip != wxString())
2091  mListener->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(tip);
2092 }
2093 
2094 
2098 void TrackPanel::HandleSelect(wxMouseEvent & event)
2099 {
2100  wxRect rect;
2101  Track *t = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
2102 
2103  // AS: Ok, did the user just click the mouse, release the mouse,
2104  // or drag?
2105  if (event.LeftDown() ||
2106  (event.LeftDClick() && event.CmdDown())) {
2107  // AS: Now, did they click in a track somewhere? If so, we want
2108  // to extend the current selection or start a NEW selection,
2109  // depending on the shift key. If not, cancel all selections.
2110  if (t)
2111  SelectionHandleClick(event, t, rect);
2112  } else if (event.LeftUp() || event.RightUp()) {
2113  if (mSnapManager) {
2114  delete mSnapManager;
2115  mSnapManager = NULL;
2116  }
2117  // Do not draw yellow lines
2118  if (mSnapLeft != -1 || mSnapRight != -1) {
2119  mSnapLeft = mSnapRight = -1;
2120  Refresh(false);
2121  }
2122 
2123  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
2124  //Send the NEW selection state to the undo/redo stack:
2125  MakeParentModifyState(false);
2126 
2127 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2128  // This stops center snapping with mouse movement
2129  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_INVALID;
2130 #endif
2131 
2132  } else if (event.LeftDClick() && !event.ShiftDown()
2133 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2134  && !event.CmdDown()
2135 #endif
2136  ) {
2137  if (!mCapturedTrack) {
2138  wxRect rect;
2139  mCapturedTrack =
2140  FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
2141  if (!mCapturedTrack)
2142  return;
2143  }
2144 
2145  // Deselect all other tracks and select this one.
2146  SelectNone();
2147 
2148  mTracks->Select(mCapturedTrack);
2149 
2150  // Default behavior: select whole track
2151  SelectTrackLength(mCapturedTrack);
2152 
2153  // Special case: if we're over a clip in a WaveTrack,
2154  // select just that clip
2155  if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
2156  WaveTrack *w = (WaveTrack *)mCapturedTrack;
2157  WaveClip *selectedClip = w->GetClipAtX(event.m_x);
2158  if (selectedClip) {
2159  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(
2160  selectedClip->GetOffset(), selectedClip->GetEndTime());
2161  }
2162  //Also, capture this track for dragging until we up-click.
2163  mCapturedClipArray.Add(TrackClip(w, selectedClip));
2164 
2165  mMouseCapture = IsSliding;
2166 
2167  Refresh(false);
2168  StartSlide(event);
2169  goto done;
2170  }
2171 
2172  Refresh(false);
2173  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
2174  MakeParentModifyState(false);
2175  }
2176 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2177 #ifdef SPECTRAL_EDITING_ESC_KEY
2178  else if (!event.IsButton() &&
2179  mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER &&
2180  !mViewInfo->selectedRegion.isPoint())
2181  MoveSnappingFreqSelection(event.m_y, rect.y, rect.height, t);
2182 #endif
2183 #endif
2184  done:
2185  SelectionHandleDrag(event, t);
2186 }
2187 
2188 
2189 // Made obsolete by scrubbing:
2190 #ifndef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
2191 void TrackPanel::StartOrJumpPlayback(wxMouseEvent &event)
2192 {
2193  AudacityProject *p = GetActiveProject();
2194  if (p) {
2195  double clicktime = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, GetLeftOffset());
2196  const double t1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
2197  // Play to end of selection, or if that is not right of the pick, end of track
2198  double endtime = clicktime < t1 ? t1 : mViewInfo->total;
2199 
2200  //Behavior should differ depending upon whether we are
2201  //currently in playback mode or not.
2202 
2203  bool busy = gAudioIO->IsBusy();
2204  if (!busy)
2205  {
2206  //If we aren't currently playing back, start playing back at
2207  //the clicked point
2208  ControlToolBar * ctb = p->GetControlToolBar();
2209  //ctb->SetPlay(true);// Not needed as done in PlayPlayRegion
2210  ctb->PlayPlayRegion
2211  (SelectedRegion(clicktime, endtime), p->GetDefaultPlayOptions());
2212  }
2213  else
2214  {
2215  //If we are playing back, stop and move playback
2216  //to the clicked point.
2217  //This unpauses paused audio as well. The right thing to do might be to
2218  //leave it paused but move the point. This would probably
2219  //require a NEW method in ControlToolBar: SetPause();
2220  ControlToolBar * ctb = p->GetControlToolBar();
2221  ctb->StopPlaying();
2222  ctb->PlayPlayRegion(SelectedRegion(clicktime, endtime), p->GetDefaultPlayOptions());
2223  }
2224  }
2225 }
2226 #endif
2227 
2228 
2229 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2230 double TrackPanel::FindScrubSpeed(double timeAtMouse) const
2231 {
2232  // Map a time (which was mapped from a mouse position)
2233  // to a speed.
2234  // Map times to positive and negative speeds,
2235  // with the time at the midline of the screen mapping to 0,
2236  // and the extremes to the maximum scrub speed.
2237 
2238  // Width of visible track area, in time terms:
2239  const double screen = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo->h;
2240  const double origin = mViewInfo->h + screen / 2.0;
2241 
2242  // There are various snapping zones that are this fraction of screen:
2243  const double snap = 0.05;
2244 
2245  // By shrinking denom a bit, we make margins left and right
2246  // that snap to maximum and negative maximum speeds.
2247  const double factor = 1.0 - (snap * 2);
2248  const double denom = factor * screen / 2.0;
2249  double fraction = std::min(1.0, fabs(timeAtMouse - origin) / denom);
2250 
2251  // Snap to 1.0 and -1.0
2252  const double unity = 1.0 / mMaxScrubSpeed;
2253  const double tolerance = snap / factor;
2254  // Make speeds near 1 available too by remapping fractions outside
2255  // this snap zone
2256  if (fraction <= unity - tolerance)
2257  fraction *= unity / (unity - tolerance);
2258  else if (fraction < unity + tolerance)
2259  fraction = unity;
2260  else
2261  fraction = unity + (fraction - (unity + tolerance)) *
2262  (1.0 - unity) / (1.0 - (unity + tolerance));
2263 
2264  double result = fraction * mMaxScrubSpeed;
2265  if (timeAtMouse < origin)
2266  result *= -1.0;
2267  return result;
2268 }
2269 
2270 double TrackPanel::FindSeekSpeed(double timeAtMouse) const
2271 {
2272  // Map a time (which was mapped from a mouse position)
2273  // to a signed skip speed: a multiplier of the stutter duration,
2274  // by which to advance the play position.
2275  // (The stutter will play at unit speed.)
2276 
2277  // Times near the midline of the screen map to skip-less play,
2278  // and the extremes to a value proportional to maximum scrub speed.
2279 
2280  // If the maximum scrubbing speed defaults to 1.0 when you begin to scroll-scrub,
2281  // the extreme skipping for scroll-seek needs to be larger to be useful.
2282  static const double ARBITRARY_MULTIPLIER = 10.0;
2283  const double extreme = std::max(1.0, mMaxScrubSpeed * ARBITRARY_MULTIPLIER);
2284 
2285  // Width of visible track area, in time terms:
2286  const double screen = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo->h;
2287  const double halfScreen = screen / 2.0;
2288  const double origin = mViewInfo->h + halfScreen;
2289 
2290  // The snapping zone is this fraction of screen, on each side of the
2291  // center line:
2292  const double snap = 0.05;
2293  const double fraction =
2294  std::max(snap, std::min(1.0, fabs(timeAtMouse - origin) / halfScreen));
2295 
2296  double result = 1.0 + ((fraction - snap) / (1.0 - snap)) * (extreme - 1.0);
2297  if (timeAtMouse < origin)
2298  result *= -1.0;
2299  return result;
2300 }
2301 #endif
2302 
2303 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
2304 bool TrackPanel::PollIsSeeking()
2305 {
2306  return ::wxGetMouseState().LeftIsDown();
2307 }
2308 
2309 bool TrackPanel::IsScrubbing()
2310 {
2311  if (mScrubToken <= 0)
2312  return false;
2313  else if (mScrubToken == GetProject()->GetAudioIOToken())
2314  return true;
2315  else {
2316  mScrubToken = -1;
2317  mScrubStartPosition = -1;
2318 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2319  mSmoothScrollingScrub = false;
2320 #endif
2321  return false;
2322  }
2323 }
2324 
2325 void TrackPanel::MarkScrubStart(
2326  wxCoord xx
2327 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2328  , bool smoothScrolling
2329 #endif
2330 )
2331 {
2332  // Don't actually start scrubbing, but collect some information
2333  // needed for the decision to start scrubbing later when handling
2334  // drag events.
2335 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2336  mSmoothScrollingScrub = smoothScrolling;
2337 #endif
2338  mScrubStartPosition = xx;
2339  mScrubStartClockTimeMillis = ::wxGetLocalTimeMillis();
2340 }
2341 
2342 bool TrackPanel::MaybeStartScrubbing(wxMouseEvent &event)
2343 {
2344  if (IsScrubbing())
2345  return false;
2346  else if (mScrubStartPosition >= 0) {
2347  const bool busy = gAudioIO->IsBusy();
2348  if (busy && gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels() > 0) {
2349  // Do not stop recording, and don't try to start scrubbing after
2350  // recording stops
2351  mScrubStartPosition = -1;
2352  return false;
2353  }
2354 
2355  wxCoord position = event.m_x;
2356  AudacityProject *p = GetActiveProject();
2357  if (p &&
2358  abs(mScrubStartPosition - position) >= SCRUBBING_PIXEL_TOLERANCE) {
2359  ControlToolBar * ctb = p->GetControlToolBar();
2360  double maxTime = p->GetTracks()->GetEndTime();
2361  double time0 = std::min(maxTime,
2362  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mScrubStartPosition, GetLeftOffset())
2363  );
2364  double time1 = std::min(maxTime,
2365  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(position, GetLeftOffset())
2366  );
2367  if (time1 != time0)
2368  {
2369  if (busy)
2370  ctb->StopPlaying();
2371 
2372  AudioIOStartStreamOptions options(p->GetDefaultPlayOptions());
2373  options.timeTrack = NULL;
2374  options.scrubDelay = (kTimerInterval / 1000.0);
2375  options.scrubStartClockTimeMillis = mScrubStartClockTimeMillis;
2376  options.minScrubStutter = 0.2;
2377 #if 0
2378  // Take the starting speed limit from the transcription toolbar,
2379  // but it may be varied during the scrub.
2380  mMaxScrubSpeed = options.maxScrubSpeed =
2381  p->GetTranscriptionToolBar()->GetPlaySpeed();
2382 #else
2383  // That idea seems unpopular... just make it one
2384  mMaxScrubSpeed = options.maxScrubSpeed = 1.0;
2385 #endif
2386  options.maxScrubTime = mTracks->GetEndTime();
2387  const bool cutPreview = false;
2388  const bool backwards = time1 < time0;
2389 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SCROLL_WHEEL
2390  static const double maxScrubSpeedBase =
2391  pow(2.0, 1.0 / ScrubSpeedStepsPerOctave);
2392  mLogMaxScrubSpeed = floor(0.5 +
2393  log(mMaxScrubSpeed) / log(maxScrubSpeedBase)
2394  );
2395 #endif
2396  mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown = 0;
2397  mScrubToken =
2398  ctb->PlayPlayRegion(SelectedRegion(time0, time1), options, cutPreview, backwards);
2399  }
2400  }
2401  else
2402  // Wait to test again
2403  mScrubStartClockTimeMillis = ::wxGetLocalTimeMillis();
2404 
2405  if (IsScrubbing()) {
2406  mScrubHasFocus = true;
2407  //mMouseCapture = IsMiddleButtonScrubbing;
2408  //CaptureMouse();
2409  }
2410  return IsScrubbing();
2411  }
2412  else
2413  return false;
2414 }
2415 
2416 bool TrackPanel::ContinueScrubbing(wxCoord position, bool hasFocus, bool seek)
2417 {
2418  // When we don't have focus, enqueue silent scrubs until we regain focus.
2419  if (!hasFocus)
2420  return gAudioIO->EnqueueScrubBySignedSpeed(0, mMaxScrubSpeed, false);
2421 
2422  const double time = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(position, GetLeftOffset());
2423 
2424  if (seek)
2425  // Cause OnTimer() to suppress the speed display
2426  mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown = 1;
2427 
2428 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2429  if (mSmoothScrollingScrub) {
2430  const double speed = seek ? FindSeekSpeed(time) : FindScrubSpeed(time);
2431  return gAudioIO->EnqueueScrubBySignedSpeed(speed, mMaxScrubSpeed, seek);
2432  }
2433  else
2434 #endif
2435  return gAudioIO->EnqueueScrubByPosition
2436  (time, seek ? 1.0 : mMaxScrubSpeed, seek);
2437 }
2438 
2439 bool TrackPanel::StopScrubbing()
2440 {
2441  if (IsScrubbing())
2442  {
2443  if (gAudioIO->IsBusy()) {
2444  AudacityProject *p = GetActiveProject();
2445  if (p) {
2446  ControlToolBar * ctb = p->GetControlToolBar();
2447  ctb->StopPlaying();
2448  }
2449  }
2450  return true;
2451  }
2452  else
2453  return false;
2454 }
2455 #endif
2456 
2457 
2460 void TrackPanel::SelectionHandleClick(wxMouseEvent & event,
2461  Track * pTrack, wxRect rect)
2462 {
2463  Track *rightTrack = NULL;
2464  mCapturedTrack = pTrack;
2465  rect.y += kTopMargin;
2466  rect.height -= kTopMargin + kBottomMargin;
2467  mCapturedRect = rect;
2468 
2469  mMouseCapture=IsSelecting;
2470  mInitialSelection = mViewInfo->selectedRegion;
2471 
2472  // Save initial state of track selections, also,
2473  // if the shift button is down and no track is selected yet,
2474  // at least select the track we clicked into.
2475  bool isAtLeastOneTrackSelected = false;
2476  mInitialTrackSelection->clear();
2477  {
2478  bool nextTrackIsLinkFromPTrack = false;
2479  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
2480  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
2481  const bool isSelected = t->GetSelected();
2482  mInitialTrackSelection->push_back(isSelected);
2483  if (isSelected) {
2484  isAtLeastOneTrackSelected = true;
2485  }
2486  if (!isAtLeastOneTrackSelected) {
2487  if (t == pTrack && t->GetLinked()) {
2488  nextTrackIsLinkFromPTrack = true;
2489  }
2490  else if (nextTrackIsLinkFromPTrack) {
2491  rightTrack = t;
2492  nextTrackIsLinkFromPTrack = false;
2493  }
2494  }
2495  }
2496  }
2497 
2498  // We create a NEW snap manager in case any snap-points have changed
2499  if (mSnapManager)
2500  delete mSnapManager;
2501 
2502  mSnapManager = new SnapManager(mTracks, mViewInfo);
2503 
2504  mSnapLeft = -1;
2505  mSnapRight = -1;
2506 
2507 #ifdef USE_MIDI
2508  mStretching = false;
2509  bool stretch = HitTestStretch(pTrack, rect, event);
2510 #endif
2511 
2512  if (event.ShiftDown()
2513 
2514 #ifdef USE_MIDI
2515  && !stretch
2516 #endif
2517  ) {
2518  if (!isAtLeastOneTrackSelected) {
2519  pTrack->SetSelected(true);
2520  if (rightTrack)
2521  rightTrack->SetSelected(true);
2522  else if (pTrack->GetLink())
2523  pTrack->GetLink()->SetSelected(true);
2524  }
2525 
2526  double value;
2527  // Shift-click, choose closest boundary
2528  SelectionBoundary boundary =
2529  ChooseBoundary(event, pTrack, rect, false, false, &value);
2530  switch (boundary) {
2531  case SBLeft:
2532  case SBRight:
2533  {
2534 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2535  // If drag starts, change time selection only
2536  // (also exit frequency snapping)
2537  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_INVALID;
2538 #endif
2539  mSelStartValid = true;
2540  mSelStart = value;
2541  ExtendSelection(event.m_x, rect.x, pTrack);
2542  break;
2543  }
2544 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2545  case SBBottom:
2546  case SBTop:
2547  {
2548  mFreqSelTrack = static_cast<const WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
2549  mFreqSelPin = value;
2550  mFreqSelMode =
2551  (boundary == SBBottom)
2552  ? FREQ_SEL_BOTTOM_FREE : FREQ_SEL_TOP_FREE;
2553 
2554  // Drag frequency only, not time:
2555  mSelStartValid = false;
2556  ExtendFreqSelection(event.m_y, rect.y, rect.height);
2557  break;
2558  }
2559  case SBCenter:
2560  HandleCenterFrequencyClick(true, pTrack, value);
2561  break;
2562 #endif
2563  default:
2564  wxASSERT(false);
2565  };
2566 
2567  UpdateSelectionDisplay();
2568  // For persistence of the selection change:
2569  MakeParentModifyState(false);
2570  return;
2571  }
2572 
2573  else if(event.CmdDown()
2574 #ifdef USE_MIDI
2575  && !stretch
2576 #endif
2577  ) {
2578 
2579 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
2580  if (
2581 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2582  event.LeftDClick() ||
2583 #endif
2584  event.LeftDown()) {
2585  MarkScrubStart(
2586  event.m_x
2587 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
2588  , event.LeftDClick()
2589 #endif
2590  );
2591  return;
2592  }
2593 
2594 #else
2595 
2596  StartOrJumpPlayback(event);
2597 
2598 #endif
2599 
2600  // Not starting a drag
2601  SetCapturedTrack(NULL, IsUncaptured);
2602  return;
2603  }
2604 
2605  //Make sure you are within the selected track
2606  bool startNewSelection = true;
2607  if (pTrack && pTrack->GetSelected()) {
2608  // Adjusting selection edges can be turned off in the
2609  // preferences now
2610  if (mAdjustSelectionEdges) {
2611 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2612  if (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER &&
2613  isSpectralSelectionTrack(pTrack)) {
2614  // Ignore whether we are inside the time selection.
2615  // Exit center-snapping, start dragging the width.
2616  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_PINNED_CENTER;
2617  mFreqSelTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
2618  mFreqSelPin = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.fc();
2619  // Do not adjust time boundaries
2620  mSelStartValid = false;
2621  ExtendFreqSelection(event.m_y, rect.y, rect.height);
2622  UpdateSelectionDisplay();
2623  // Frequency selection persists too, so do this:
2624  MakeParentModifyState(false);
2625 
2626  return;
2627  }
2628  else
2629 #endif
2630  {
2631  // Not shift-down, choose boundary only within snapping
2632  double value;
2633  SelectionBoundary boundary =
2634  ChooseBoundary(event, pTrack, rect, true, true, &value);
2635  switch (boundary) {
2636  case SBNone:
2637  // startNewSelection remains true
2638  break;
2639  case SBLeft:
2640  case SBRight:
2641  startNewSelection = false;
2642 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2643  // Disable frequency selection
2644  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_INVALID;
2645 #endif
2646  mSelStartValid = true;
2647  mSelStart = value;
2648  break;
2649 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2650  case SBBottom:
2651  case SBTop:
2652  case SBWidth:
2653  startNewSelection = false;
2654  // Disable time selection
2655  mSelStartValid = false;
2656  mFreqSelTrack = static_cast<const WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
2657  mFreqSelPin = value;
2658  mFreqSelMode =
2659  (boundary == SBWidth) ? FREQ_SEL_PINNED_CENTER :
2660  (boundary == SBBottom) ? FREQ_SEL_BOTTOM_FREE :
2661  FREQ_SEL_TOP_FREE;
2662  break;
2663  case SBCenter:
2664  HandleCenterFrequencyClick(false, pTrack, value);
2665  startNewSelection = false;
2666  break;
2667 #endif
2668  default:
2669  wxASSERT(false);
2670  }
2671  }
2672  } // mAdjustSelectionEdges
2673  }
2674 
2675 #ifdef USE_MIDI
2676  if (stretch) {
2677  NoteTrack *nt = (NoteTrack *) pTrack;
2678  // find nearest beat to sel0, sel1
2679  double minPeriod = 0.05; // minimum beat period
2680  double qBeat0, qBeat1;
2681  double centerBeat = 0.0f;
2682  mStretchSel0 = nt->NearestBeatTime(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(), &qBeat0);
2683  mStretchSel1 = nt->NearestBeatTime(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1(), &qBeat1);
2684 
2685  // If there is not (almost) a beat to stretch that is slower
2686  // than 20 beats per second, don't stretch
2687  if (within(qBeat0, qBeat1, 0.9) ||
2688  (mStretchSel1 - mStretchSel0) / (qBeat1 - qBeat0) < minPeriod) return;
2689 
2690  if (startNewSelection) { // mouse is not at an edge, but after
2691  // quantization, we could be indicating the selection edge
2692  mSelStartValid = true;
2693  mSelStart = std::max(0.0, mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x));
2694  mStretchStart = nt->NearestBeatTime(mSelStart, &centerBeat);
2695  if (within(qBeat0, centerBeat, 0.1)) {
2696  mListener->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(
2697  _("Click and drag to stretch selected region."));
2698  SetCursor(*mStretchLeftCursor);
2699  // mStretchMode = stretchLeft;
2700  mSelStart = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
2701  // condition that implies stretchLeft
2702  startNewSelection = false;
2703  } else if (within(qBeat1, centerBeat, 0.1)) {
2704  mListener->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(
2705  _("Click and drag to stretch selected region."));
2706  SetCursor(*mStretchRightCursor);
2707  // mStretchMode = stretchRight;
2708  mSelStart = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
2709  // condition that implies stretchRight
2710  startNewSelection = false;
2711  }
2712  }
2713 
2714  if (startNewSelection) {
2715  mStretchMode = stretchCenter;
2716  mStretchLeftBeats = qBeat1 - centerBeat;
2717  mStretchRightBeats = centerBeat - qBeat0;
2718  } else if (mSelStartValid && mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() == mSelStart) {
2719  // note that at this point, mSelStart is at the opposite
2720  // end of the selection from the cursor. If the cursor is
2721  // over sel0, then mSelStart is at sel1.
2722  mStretchMode = stretchLeft;
2723  } else {
2724  mStretchMode = stretchRight;
2725  }
2726 
2727  if (mStretchMode == stretchLeft) {
2728  mStretchLeftBeats = 0;
2729  mStretchRightBeats = qBeat1 - qBeat0;
2730  } else if (mStretchMode == stretchRight) {
2731  mStretchLeftBeats = qBeat1 - qBeat0;
2732  mStretchRightBeats = 0;
2733  }
2734  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(mStretchSel0, mStretchSel1);
2735  mStretching = true;
2736  mStretched = false;
2737 
2738  /* i18n-hint: (noun) The track that is used for MIDI notes which can be
2739  dragged to change their duration.*/
2740  MakeParentPushState(_("Stretch Note Track"),
2741  /* i18n-hint: In the history list, indicates a MIDI note has
2742  been dragged to change its duration (stretch it). Using either past
2743  or present tense is fine here. If unsure, go for whichever is
2744  shorter.*/
2745  _("Stretch"));
2746 
2747  // Full refresh since the label area may need to indicate
2748  // newly selected tracks. (I'm really not sure if the label area
2749  // needs to be refreshed or how to just refresh non-label areas.-RBD)
2750  Refresh(false);
2751 
2752  // Make sure the ruler follows suit.
2753  mRuler->DrawSelection();
2754 
2755  // As well as the SelectionBar.
2756  DisplaySelection();
2757 
2758  return;
2759  }
2760 #endif
2761  if (startNewSelection) {
2762  // If we didn't move a selection boundary, start a NEW selection
2763  SelectNone();
2764 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2765  StartFreqSelection (event.m_y, rect.y, rect.height, pTrack);
2766 #endif
2767  StartSelection(event.m_x, rect.x);
2768  mTracks->Select(pTrack);
2769  SetFocusedTrack(pTrack);
2770  //On-Demand: check to see if there is an OD thing associated with this track.
2771  if (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
2772  if(ODManager::IsInstanceCreated())
2773  ODManager::Instance()->DemandTrackUpdate((WaveTrack*)pTrack,mSelStart);
2774  }
2775  DisplaySelection();
2776  }
2777 }
2778 
2779 
2781 void TrackPanel::StartSelection(int mouseXCoordinate, int trackLeftEdge)
2782 {
2783  mSelStartValid = true;
2784  mSelStart = std::max(0.0, mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mouseXCoordinate, trackLeftEdge));
2785 
2786  double s = mSelStart;
2787
