2788  if (mSnapManager) {
2789  mSnapLeft = -1;
2790  mSnapRight = -1;
2791  bool snappedPoint, snappedTime;
2792  if (mSnapManager->Snap(mCapturedTrack, mSelStart, false,
2793  &s, &snappedPoint, &snappedTime)) {
2794  if (snappedPoint)
2795  mSnapLeft = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(s, trackLeftEdge);
2796  }
2797  }
2798 
2799  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(s, s);
2800 
2801  SonifyBeginModifyState();
2802  MakeParentModifyState(false);
2803  SonifyEndModifyState();
2804 }
2805 
2807 void TrackPanel::ExtendSelection(int mouseXCoordinate, int trackLeftEdge,
2808  Track *pTrack)
2809 {
2810  if (!mSelStartValid)
2811  // Must be dragging frequency bounds only.
2812  return;
2813 
2814  double selend = std::max(0.0, mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mouseXCoordinate, trackLeftEdge));
2815  clip_bottom(selend, 0.0);
2816 
2817  double origSel0, origSel1;
2818  double sel0, sel1;
2819 
2820  if (pTrack == NULL && mCapturedTrack != NULL)
2821  pTrack = mCapturedTrack;
2822 
2823  if (mSelStart < selend) {
2824  sel0 = mSelStart;
2825  sel1 = selend;
2826  }
2827  else {
2828  sel1 = mSelStart;
2829  sel0 = selend;
2830  }
2831 
2832  origSel0 = sel0;
2833  origSel1 = sel1;
2834 
2835  if (mSnapManager) {
2836  mSnapLeft = -1;
2837  mSnapRight = -1;
2838  bool snappedPoint, snappedTime;
2839  if (mSnapManager->Snap(mCapturedTrack, sel0, false,
2840  &sel0, &snappedPoint, &snappedTime)) {
2841  if (snappedPoint)
2842  mSnapLeft = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(sel0, trackLeftEdge);
2843  }
2844  if (mSnapManager->Snap(mCapturedTrack, sel1, true,
2845  &sel1, &snappedPoint, &snappedTime)) {
2846  if (snappedPoint)
2847  mSnapRight = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(sel1, trackLeftEdge);
2848  }
2849 
2850  // Check if selection endpoints are too close together to snap (unless
2851  // using snap-to-time -- then we always accept the snap results)
2852  if (mSnapLeft >= 0 && mSnapRight >= 0 && mSnapRight - mSnapLeft < 3 &&
2853  !snappedTime) {
2854  sel0 = origSel0;
2855  sel1 = origSel1;
2856  mSnapLeft = -1;
2857  mSnapRight = -1;
2858  }
2859  }
2860 
2861  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(sel0, sel1);
2862 
2863  //On-Demand: check to see if there is an OD thing associated with this track. If so we want to update the focal point for the task.
2864  if (pTrack && (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) && ODManager::IsInstanceCreated())
2865  ODManager::Instance()->DemandTrackUpdate((WaveTrack*)pTrack,sel0); //sel0 is sometimes less than mSelStart
2866 }
2867 
2868 void TrackPanel::UpdateSelectionDisplay()
2869 {
2870  // Full refresh since the label area may need to indicate
2871  // newly selected tracks.
2872  Refresh(false);
2873 
2874  // Make sure the ruler follows suit.
2875  mRuler->DrawSelection();
2876 
2877  // As well as the SelectionBar.
2878  DisplaySelection();
2879 }
2880 
2881 void TrackPanel::UpdateAccessibility()
2882 {
2883  if (mAx)
2884  mAx->Updated();
2885 }
2886 
2887 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
2888 namespace {
2889 
2890 inline double findMaxRatio(double center, double rate)
2891 {
2892  const double minFrequency = 1.0;
2893  const double maxFrequency = (rate / 2.0);
2894  const double frequency =
2895  std::min(maxFrequency,
2896  std::max(minFrequency, center));
2897  return
2898  std::min(frequency / minFrequency, maxFrequency / frequency);
2899 }
2900 
2901 }
2902 
2903 void TrackPanel::SnapCenterOnce(const WaveTrack *pTrack, bool up)
2904 {
2905  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = pTrack->GetSpectrogramSettings();
2906  const int windowSize = settings.GetFFTLength();
2907  const double rate = pTrack->GetRate();
2908  const double nyq = rate / 2.0;
2909  const double binFrequency = rate / windowSize;
2910 
2911  double f1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
2912  double centerFrequency = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.fc();
2913  if (centerFrequency <= 0) {
2914  centerFrequency = up ? binFrequency : nyq;
2915  f1 = centerFrequency * sqrt(2.0);
2916  }
2917 
2918  const double ratio = f1 / centerFrequency;
2919  const int originalBin = floor(0.5 + centerFrequency / binFrequency);
2920  const int limitingBin = up ? floor(0.5 + nyq / binFrequency) : 1;
2921 
2922  // This is crude and wasteful, doing the FFT each time the command is called.
2923  // It would be better to cache the data, but then invalidation of the cache would
2924  // need doing in all places that change the time selection.
2925  StartSnappingFreqSelection(pTrack);
2926  double snappedFrequency = centerFrequency;
2927  int bin = originalBin;
2928  if (up) {
2929  while (snappedFrequency <= centerFrequency &&
2930  bin < limitingBin)
2931  snappedFrequency = mFrequencySnapper->FindPeak(++bin * binFrequency, NULL);
2932  }
2933  else {
2934  while (snappedFrequency >= centerFrequency &&
2935  bin > limitingBin)
2936  snappedFrequency = mFrequencySnapper->FindPeak(--bin * binFrequency, NULL);
2937  }
2938 
2939  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies
2940  (snappedFrequency / ratio, snappedFrequency * ratio);
2941 }
2942 
2943 void TrackPanel::StartSnappingFreqSelection (const WaveTrack *pTrack)
2944 {
2945  static const sampleCount minLength = 8;
2946 
2947  const double rate = pTrack->GetRate();
2948 
2949  // Grab samples, just for this track, at these times
2950  std::vector<float> frequencySnappingData;
2951  const sampleCount start =
2952  pTrack->TimeToLongSamples(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0());
2953  const sampleCount end =
2954  pTrack->TimeToLongSamples(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1());
2955  const sampleCount length =
2956  std::min(sampleCount(frequencySnappingData.max_size()),
2957  std::min(sampleCount(10485760), // as in FreqWindow.cpp
2958  end - start));
2959  const sampleCount effectiveLength = std::max(minLength, length);
2960  frequencySnappingData.resize(effectiveLength, 0.0f);
2961  pTrack->Get(
2962  reinterpret_cast<samplePtr>(&frequencySnappingData[0]),
2963  floatSample, start, length);
2964 
2965  // Use same settings as are now used for spectrogram display,
2966  // except, shrink the window as needed so we get some answers
2967 
2968  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = pTrack->GetSpectrogramSettings();
2969  int windowSize = settings.GetFFTLength();
2970 
2971  while(windowSize > effectiveLength)
2972  windowSize >>= 1;
2973  const int windowType = settings.windowType;
2974 
2975  mFrequencySnapper->Calculate(
2976  SpectrumAnalyst::Spectrum, windowType, windowSize, rate,
2977  &frequencySnappingData[0], length);
2978 
2979  // We can now throw away the sample data but we keep the spectrum.
2980 }
2981 
2982 void TrackPanel::MoveSnappingFreqSelection (int mouseYCoordinate,
2983  int trackTopEdge,
2984  int trackHeight, Track *pTrack)
2985 {
2986  if (pTrack &&
2987  pTrack->GetSelected() &&
2988  isSpectralSelectionTrack(pTrack)) {
2989  WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
2990  // PRL:
2991  // What happens if center snapping selection began in one spectrogram track,
2992  // then continues inside another? We do not then recalculate
2993  // the spectrum (as was done in StartSnappingFreqSelection)
2994  // but snap according to the peaks in the old track.
2995  // I am not worrying about that odd case.
2996  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
2997  const double frequency =
2998  PositionToFrequency(wt, false, mouseYCoordinate,
2999  trackTopEdge, trackHeight);
3000  const double snappedFrequency =
3001  mFrequencySnapper->FindPeak(frequency, NULL);
3002  const double maxRatio = findMaxRatio(snappedFrequency, rate);
3003  double ratio = 2.0; // An arbitrary octave on each side, at most
3004  {
3005  const double f0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f0();
3006  const double f1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
3007  if (f1 >= f0 && f0 >= 0)
3008  // Preserve already chosen ratio instead
3009  ratio = sqrt(f1 / f0);
3010  }
3011  ratio = std::min(ratio, maxRatio);
3012 
3013  mFreqSelPin = snappedFrequency;
3014  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(
3015  snappedFrequency / ratio, snappedFrequency * ratio);
3016 
3017  mFreqSelTrack = wt;
3018  // SelectNone();
3019  // mTracks->Select(pTrack);
3020  SetFocusedTrack(pTrack);
3021  }
3022 }
3023 
3024 void TrackPanel::StartFreqSelection (int mouseYCoordinate, int trackTopEdge,
3025  int trackHeight, Track *pTrack)
3026 {
3027  mFreqSelTrack = 0;
3028  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_INVALID;
3029  mFreqSelPin = SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency;
3030 
3031  if (isSpectralSelectionTrack(pTrack)) {
3032  mFreqSelTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
3033  mFreqSelMode = FREQ_SEL_FREE;
3034  mFreqSelPin =
3035  PositionToFrequency(mFreqSelTrack, false, mouseYCoordinate,
3036  trackTopEdge, trackHeight);
3037  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(mFreqSelPin, mFreqSelPin);
3038  }
3039 }
3040 
3041 void TrackPanel::ExtendFreqSelection(int mouseYCoordinate, int trackTopEdge,
3042  int trackHeight)
3043 {
3044  // When dragWidth is true, and not dragging the center,
3045  // adjust both top and bottom about geometric mean.
3046 
3047  if (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_INVALID ||
3048  mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER)
3049  return;
3050 
3051  // Extension happens only when dragging in the same track in which we
3052  // started, and that is of a spectrogram display type.
3053 
3054  const WaveTrack* wt = mFreqSelTrack;
3055  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
3056  const double frequency =
3057  PositionToFrequency(wt, true, mouseYCoordinate,
3058  trackTopEdge, trackHeight);
3059 
3060  // Dragging center?
3061  if (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_DRAG_CENTER) {
3062  if (frequency == rate || frequency < 1.0)
3063  // snapped to top or bottom
3064  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(
3065  SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency,
3066  SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3067  else {
3068  // mFreqSelPin holds the ratio of top to center
3069  const double maxRatio = findMaxRatio(frequency, rate);
3070  const double ratio = std::min(maxRatio, mFreqSelPin);
3071  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(
3072  frequency / ratio, frequency * ratio);
3073  }
3074  }
3075  else if (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_PINNED_CENTER) {
3076  if (mFreqSelPin >= 0) {
3077  // Change both upper and lower edges leaving centre where it is.
3078  if (frequency == rate || frequency < 1.0)
3079  // snapped to top or bottom
3080  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(
3081  SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency,
3082  SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3083  else {
3084  // Given center and mouse position, find ratio of the larger to the
3085  // smaller, limit that to the frequency scale bounds, and adjust
3086  // top and bottom accordingly.
3087  const double maxRatio = findMaxRatio(mFreqSelPin, rate);
3088  double ratio = frequency / mFreqSelPin;
3089  if (ratio < 1.0)
3090  ratio = 1.0 / ratio;
3091  ratio = std::min(maxRatio, ratio);
3092  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setFrequencies(
3093  mFreqSelPin / ratio, mFreqSelPin * ratio);
3094  }
3095  }
3096  }
3097  else {
3098  // Dragging of upper or lower.
3099  const bool bottomDefined =
3100  !(mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_TOP_FREE && mFreqSelPin < 0);
3101  const bool topDefined =
3102  !(mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_BOTTOM_FREE && mFreqSelPin < 0);
3103  if (!bottomDefined || (topDefined && mFreqSelPin < frequency)) {
3104  // Adjust top
3105  if (frequency == rate)
3106  // snapped high; upper frequency is undefined
3107  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF1(SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3108  else
3109  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF1(std::max(1.0, frequency));
3110 
3111  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF0(mFreqSelPin);
3112  }
3113  else {
3114  // Adjust bottom
3115  if (frequency < 1.0)
3116  // snapped low; lower frequency is undefined
3117  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF0(SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3118  else
3119  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF0(std::min(rate / 2.0, frequency));
3120 
3121  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setF1(mFreqSelPin);
3122  }
3123  }
3124 }
3125 
3126 void TrackPanel::ToggleSpectralSelection()
3127 {
3128  SelectedRegion &region = mViewInfo->selectedRegion;
3129  const double f0 = region.f0();
3130  const double f1 = region.f1();
3131  const bool haveSpectralSelection =
3132  !(f0 == SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency &&
3133  f1 == SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3134  if (haveSpectralSelection)
3135  {
3136  mLastF0 = f0;
3137  mLastF1 = f1;
3138  region.setFrequencies
3139  (SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency, SelectedRegion::UndefinedFrequency);
3140  }
3141  else
3142  region.setFrequencies(mLastF0, mLastF1);
3143 }
3144 
3145 void TrackPanel::ResetFreqSelectionPin(double hintFrequency, bool logF)
3146 {
3147  switch (mFreqSelMode) {
3148  case FREQ_SEL_INVALID:
3149  case FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER:
3150  mFreqSelPin = -1.0;
3151  break;
3152 
3153  case FREQ_SEL_PINNED_CENTER:
3154  mFreqSelPin = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.fc();
3155  break;
3156 
3157  case FREQ_SEL_DRAG_CENTER:
3158  {
3159  // Re-pin the width
3160  const double f0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f0();
3161  const double f1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
3162  if (f0 >= 0 && f1 >= 0)
3163  mFreqSelPin = sqrt(f1 / f0);
3164  else
3165  mFreqSelPin = -1.0;
3166  }
3167  break;
3168 
3169  case FREQ_SEL_FREE:
3170  // Pin which? Farther from the hint which is the presumed
3171  // mouse position.
3172  {
3173  const double f0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f0();
3174  const double f1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
3175  if (logF) {
3176  if (f1 < 0)
3177  mFreqSelPin = f0;
3178  else {
3179  const double logf1 = log(std::max(1.0, f1));
3180  const double logf0 = log(std::max(1.0, f0));
3181  const double logHint = log(std::max(1.0, hintFrequency));
3182  if (std::abs (logHint - logf1) < std::abs (logHint - logf0))
3183  mFreqSelPin = f0;
3184  else
3185  mFreqSelPin = f1;
3186  }
3187  }
3188  else {
3189  if (f1 < 0 ||
3190  std::abs (hintFrequency - f1) < std::abs (hintFrequency - f0))
3191  mFreqSelPin = f0;
3192  else
3193  mFreqSelPin = f1;
3194  }
3195  }
3196  break;
3197 
3198  case FREQ_SEL_TOP_FREE:
3199  mFreqSelPin = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f0();
3200  break;
3201 
3202  case FREQ_SEL_BOTTOM_FREE:
3203  mFreqSelPin = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
3204  break;
3205 
3206  default:
3207  wxASSERT(false);
3208  }
3209 }
3210 #endif
3211 
3212 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3213 void TrackPanel::Stretch(int mouseXCoordinate, int trackLeftEdge,
3214  Track *pTrack)
3215 {
3216  if (mStretched) { // Undo stretch and redo it with NEW mouse coordinates
3217  // Drag handling was not originally implemented with Undo in mind --
3218  // there are saved pointers to tracks that are not supposed to change.
3219  // Undo will change tracks, so convert pTrack, mCapturedTrack to index
3220  // values, then look them up after the Undo
3221  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3222  int pTrackIndex = pTrack->GetIndex();
3223  int capturedTrackIndex =
3224  (mCapturedTrack ? mCapturedTrack->GetIndex() : 0);
3225 
3226  GetProject()->OnUndo();
3227 
3228  // Undo brings us back to the pre-click state, but we want to
3229  // quantize selected region to integer beat boundaries. These
3230  // were saved in mStretchSel[12] variables:
3231  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(mStretchSel0, mStretchSel1);
3232 
3233  mStretched = false;
3234  int index = 0;
3235  for (Track *t = iter.First(mTracks); t; t = iter.Next()) {
3236  if (index == pTrackIndex) pTrack = t;
3237  if (mCapturedTrack && index == capturedTrackIndex) mCapturedTrack = t;
3238  index++;
3239  }
3240  }
3241 
3242  if (pTrack == NULL && mCapturedTrack != NULL)
3243  pTrack = mCapturedTrack;
3244 
3245  if (!pTrack || pTrack->GetKind() != Track::Note) {
3246  return;
3247  }
3248 
3249  NoteTrack *pNt = (NoteTrack *) pTrack;
3250  double moveto = std::max(0.0, mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mouseXCoordinate, trackLeftEdge));
3251 
3252  // check to make sure tempo is not higher than 20 beats per second
3253  // (In principle, tempo can be higher, but not infinity.)
3254  double minPeriod = 0.05; // minimum beat period
3255  double qBeat0, qBeat1;
3256  pNt->NearestBeatTime(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(), &qBeat0); // get beat
3257  pNt->NearestBeatTime(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1(), &qBeat1);
3258 
3259  // We could be moving 3 things: left edge, right edge, a point between
3260  switch (mStretchMode) {
3261  case stretchLeft: {
3262  // make sure target duration is not too short
3263  double dur = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() - moveto;
3264  if (dur < mStretchRightBeats * minPeriod) {
3265  dur = mStretchRightBeats * minPeriod;
3266  moveto = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() - dur;
3267  }
3268  if (pNt->StretchRegion(mStretchSel0, mStretchSel1, dur)) {
3269  pNt->SetOffset(pNt->GetOffset() + moveto - mStretchSel0);
3270  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setT0(moveto);
3271  }
3272  break;
3273  }
3274  case stretchRight: {
3275  // make sure target duration is not too short
3276  double dur = moveto - mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
3277  if (dur < mStretchLeftBeats * minPeriod) {
3278  dur = mStretchLeftBeats * minPeriod;
3279  moveto = mStretchSel0 + dur;
3280  }
3281  if (pNt->StretchRegion(mStretchSel0, mStretchSel1, dur)) {
3282  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setT1(moveto);
3283  }
3284  break;
3285  }
3286  case stretchCenter: {
3287  // make sure both left and right target durations are not too short
3288  double left_dur = moveto - mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
3289  double right_dur = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() - moveto;
3290  double centerBeat;
3291  pNt->NearestBeatTime(mSelStart, &centerBeat);
3292  if (left_dur < mStretchLeftBeats * minPeriod) {
3293  left_dur = mStretchLeftBeats * minPeriod;
3294  moveto = mStretchSel0 + left_dur;
3295  }
3296  if (right_dur < mStretchRightBeats * minPeriod) {
3297  right_dur = mStretchRightBeats * minPeriod;
3298  moveto = mStretchSel1 - right_dur;
3299  }
3300  pNt->StretchRegion(mStretchStart, mStretchSel1, right_dur);
3301  pNt->StretchRegion(mStretchSel0, mStretchStart, left_dur);
3302  break;
3303  }
3304  default:
3305  wxASSERT(false);
3306  break;
3307  }
3308  MakeParentPushState(_("Stretch Note Track"), _("Stretch"),
3309  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE | UndoPush::AUTOSAVE);
3310  mStretched = true;
3311  Refresh(false);
3312 }
3313 #endif
3314 
3318 void TrackPanel::SelectionHandleDrag(wxMouseEvent & event, Track *clickedTrack)
3319 {
3320 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
3321  if (mScrubStartPosition >= 0) {
3322  MaybeStartScrubbing(event);
3323  // Do nothing more, don't change selection
3324  return;
3325  }
3326 #endif
3327 
3328  // AS: If we're not in the process of selecting (set in
3329  // the SelectionHandleClick above), fuhggeddaboudit.
3330  if (mMouseCapture!=IsSelecting)
3331  return;
3332 
3333  // Also fuhggeddaboudit if we're not dragging and not autoscrolling.
3334  if (!event.Dragging() && !mAutoScrolling)
3335  return;
3336 
3337  if (event.CmdDown()) {
3338  // Ctrl-drag has no meaning, fuhggeddaboudit
3339  return;
3340  }
3341 
3342  wxRect rect = mCapturedRect;
3343  Track *pTrack = mCapturedTrack;
3344 
3345  if (!pTrack) {
3346  pTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
3347  rect.y += kTopMargin;
3348  rect.height -= kTopMargin + kBottomMargin;
3349  }
3350 
3351  // Also fuhggeddaboudit if not in a track.
3352  if (!pTrack)
3353  return;
3354 
3355  int x = mAutoScrolling ? mMouseMostRecentX : event.m_x;
3356  int y = mAutoScrolling ? mMouseMostRecentY : event.m_y;
3357 
3358  // JKC: Logic to prevent a selection smaller than 5 pixels to
3359  // prevent accidental dragging when selecting.
3360  // (if user really wants a tiny selection, they should zoom in).
3361  // Can someone make this value of '5' configurable in
3362  // preferences?
3363  const int minimumSizedSelection = 5; //measured in pixels
3364 
3365  // Might be dragging frequency bounds only, test
3366  if (mSelStartValid) {
3367  wxInt64 SelStart = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mSelStart, rect.x); //cvt time to pixels.
3368  // Abandon this drag if selecting < 5 pixels.
3369  if (wxLongLong(SelStart-x).Abs() < minimumSizedSelection
3370 #ifdef USE_MIDI // limiting selection size is good, and not starting
3371  && !mStretching // stretch unless mouse moves 5 pixels is good, but
3372 #endif // once stretching starts, it's ok to move even 1 pixel
3373  )
3374  return;
3375  }
3376 
3377  // Handle which tracks are selected
3378  Track *sTrack = pTrack;
3379  if (Track *eTrack = FindTrack(x, y, false, false, NULL)) {
3380  // Swap the track pointers if needed
3381  if (eTrack->GetIndex() < sTrack->GetIndex()) {
3382  Track *t = eTrack;
3383  eTrack = sTrack;
3384  sTrack = t;
3385  }
3386 
3387  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3388  sTrack = iter.StartWith(sTrack);
3389  do {
3390  mTracks->Select(sTrack);
3391  if (sTrack == eTrack) {
3392  break;
3393  }
3394 
3395  sTrack = iter.Next();
3396  } while (sTrack);
3397  }
3398 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3399  if (mStretching) {
3400  // the following is also in ExtendSelection, called below
3401  // probably a good idea to "hoist" the code to before this "if" stmt
3402  if (clickedTrack == NULL && mCapturedTrack != NULL)
3403  clickedTrack = mCapturedTrack;
3404  Stretch(x, rect.x, clickedTrack);
3405  return;
3406  }
3407 #endif
3408 
3409 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
3410 #ifndef SPECTRAL_EDITING_ESC_KEY
3411  if (mFreqSelMode == FREQ_SEL_SNAPPING_CENTER &&
3412  !mViewInfo->selectedRegion.isPoint())
3413  MoveSnappingFreqSelection(y, rect.y, rect.height, pTrack);
3414  else
3415 #endif
3416  if (mFreqSelTrack == pTrack)
3417  ExtendFreqSelection(y, rect.y, rect.height);
3418 #endif
3419 
3420  ExtendSelection(x, rect.x, clickedTrack);
3421  UpdateSelectionDisplay();
3422 }
3423 
3424 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
3425 // Seems 4 is too small to work at the top. Why?
3426 enum { FREQ_SNAP_DISTANCE = 10 };
3427 
3430 double TrackPanel::PositionToFrequency(const WaveTrack *wt,
3431  bool maySnap,
3432  wxInt64 mouseYCoordinate,
3433  wxInt64 trackTopEdge,
3434  int trackHeight) const
3435 {
3436  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
3437 
3438  // Handle snapping
3439  if (maySnap &&
3440  mouseYCoordinate - trackTopEdge < FREQ_SNAP_DISTANCE)
3441  return rate;
3442  if (maySnap &&
3443  trackTopEdge + trackHeight - mouseYCoordinate < FREQ_SNAP_DISTANCE)
3444  return -1;
3445 
3446  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = wt->GetSpectrogramSettings();
3447  float minFreq, maxFreq;
3448  wt->GetSpectrumBounds(&minFreq, &maxFreq);
3449  const NumberScale numberScale(settings.GetScale(minFreq, maxFreq, rate, false));
3450  const double p = double(mouseYCoordinate - trackTopEdge) / trackHeight;
3451  return numberScale.PositionToValue(1.0 - p);
3452 }
3453 
3455 wxInt64 TrackPanel::FrequencyToPosition(const WaveTrack *wt,
3456  double frequency,
3457  wxInt64 trackTopEdge,
3458  int trackHeight) const
3459 {
3460  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
3461 
3462  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = wt->GetSpectrogramSettings();
3463  float minFreq, maxFreq;
3464  wt->GetSpectrumBounds(&minFreq, &maxFreq);
3465  const NumberScale numberScale(settings.GetScale(minFreq, maxFreq, rate, false));
3466  const float p = numberScale.ValueToPosition(frequency);
3467  return trackTopEdge + wxInt64((1.0 - p) * trackHeight);
3468 }
3469 #endif
3470 
3471 template<typename T>
3472 inline void SetIfNotNull( T * pValue, const T Value )
3473 {
3474  if( pValue == NULL )
3475  return;
3476  *pValue = Value;
3477 }
3478 
3479 
3480 TrackPanel::SelectionBoundary TrackPanel::ChooseTimeBoundary
3481 (double selend, bool onlyWithinSnapDistance,
3482  wxInt64 *pPixelDist, double *pPinValue) const
3483 {
3484  const double t0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
3485  const double t1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
3486  const wxInt64 posS = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(selend);
3487  const wxInt64 pos0 = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(t0);
3488  wxInt64 pixelDist = std::abs(posS - pos0);
3489  bool chooseLeft = true;
3490 
3491  if (mViewInfo->selectedRegion.isPoint())
3492  // Special case when selection is a point, and thus left
3493  // and right distances are the same
3494  chooseLeft = (selend < t0);
3495  else {
3496  const wxInt64 pos1 = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(t1);
3497  const wxInt64 rightDist = std::abs(posS - pos1);
3498  if (rightDist < pixelDist)
3499  chooseLeft = false, pixelDist = rightDist;
3500  }
3501 
3502  SetIfNotNull(pPixelDist, pixelDist);
3503 
3504  if (onlyWithinSnapDistance &&
3505  pixelDist >= SELECTION_RESIZE_REGION) {
3506  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, -1.0);
3507  return SBNone;
3508  }
3509  else if (chooseLeft) {
3510  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, t1);
3511  return SBLeft;
3512  }
3513  else {
3514  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, t0);
3515  return SBRight;
3516  }
3517 }
3518 
3519 
3520 TrackPanel::SelectionBoundary TrackPanel::ChooseBoundary
3521 (wxMouseEvent & event, const Track *pTrack, const wxRect &rect,
3522 bool mayDragWidth, bool onlyWithinSnapDistance,
3523  double *pPinValue) const
3524 {
3525  // Choose one of four boundaries to adjust, or the center frequency.
3526  // May choose frequencies only if in a spectrogram view and
3527  // within the time boundaries.
3528  // May choose no boundary if onlyWithinSnapDistance is true.
3529  // Otherwise choose the eligible boundary nearest the mouse click.
3530  const double selend = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x);
3531  wxInt64 pixelDist = 0;
3532  SelectionBoundary boundary =
3533  ChooseTimeBoundary(selend, onlyWithinSnapDistance,
3534  &pixelDist, pPinValue);
3535 
3536 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
3537  const double t0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0();
3538  const double t1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
3539  const double f0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f0();
3540  const double f1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.f1();
3541  const double fc = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.fc();
3542  double ratio = 0;
3543 
3544  bool chooseTime = true;
3545  bool chooseBottom = true;
3546  bool chooseCenter = false;
3547  // Consider adjustment of frequencies only if mouse is
3548  // within the time boundaries
3549  if (!mViewInfo->selectedRegion.isPoint() &&
3550  t0 <= selend && selend < t1 &&
3551  isSpectralSelectionTrack(pTrack)) {
3552  const WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<const WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
3553  const wxInt64 bottomSel = (f0 >= 0)
3554  ? FrequencyToPosition(wt, f0, rect.y, rect.height)
3555  : rect.y + rect.height;
3556  const wxInt64 topSel = (f1 >= 0)
3557  ? FrequencyToPosition(wt, f1, rect.y, rect.height)
3558  : rect.y;
3559  wxInt64 signedBottomDist = int(event.m_y - bottomSel);
3560  wxInt64 verticalDist = std::abs(signedBottomDist);
3561  if (bottomSel == topSel)
3562  // Top and bottom are too close to resolve on screen
3563  chooseBottom = (signedBottomDist >= 0);
3564  else {
3565  const wxInt64 topDist = abs(int(event.m_y - topSel));
3566  if (topDist < verticalDist)
3567  chooseBottom = false, verticalDist = topDist;
3568  }
3569  if (fc > 0
3570 #ifdef SPECTRAL_EDITING_ESC_KEY
3571  && mayDragWidth
3572 #endif
3573  ) {
3574  const wxInt64 centerSel =
3575  FrequencyToPosition(wt, fc, rect.y, rect.height);
3576  const wxInt64 centerDist = abs(int(event.m_y - centerSel));
3577  if (centerDist < verticalDist)
3578  chooseCenter = true, verticalDist = centerDist,
3579  ratio = f1 / fc;
3580  }
3581  if (verticalDist >= 0 &&
3582  verticalDist < pixelDist) {
3583  pixelDist = verticalDist;
3584  chooseTime = false;
3585  }
3586  }
3587 
3588  if (!chooseTime) {
3589  // PRL: Seems I need a larger tolerance to make snapping work
3590  // at top of track, not sure why
3591  if (onlyWithinSnapDistance &&
3592  pixelDist >= FREQ_SNAP_DISTANCE) {
3593  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, -1.0);
3594  return SBNone;
3595  }
3596  else if (chooseCenter) {
3597  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, ratio);
3598  return SBCenter;
3599  }
3600  else if (mayDragWidth && fc > 0) {
3601  SetIfNotNull(pPinValue, fc);
3602  return SBWidth;
3603  }
3604  else if (chooseBottom) {
3605  SetIfNotNull( pPinValue, f1 );
3606  return SBBottom;
3607  }
3608  else {
3609  SetIfNotNull(pPinValue, f0);
3610  return SBTop;
3611  }
3612  }
3613  else
3614 #endif
3615  {
3616  return boundary;
3617  }
3618 }
3619 
3622 void TrackPanel::HandleEnvelope(wxMouseEvent & event)
3623 {
3624  if (event.LeftDown()) {
3625  wxRect rect;
3626  Track *pTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
3627 
3628  if (!pTrack)
3629  return;
3630 
3631  SetCapturedTrack(pTrack, IsEnveloping);
3632 
3633  if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
3634  {
3635  mCapturedEnvelope =
3636  ((WaveTrack*)mCapturedTrack)->GetEnvelopeAtX(event.GetX());
3637  } else {
3638  mCapturedEnvelope = NULL;
3639  }
3640 
3641  mCapturedRect = rect;
3642  mCapturedRect.y += kTopMargin;
3643  mCapturedRect.height -= kTopMargin + kBottomMargin;
3644  }
3645  // AS: if there's actually a selected track, then forward all of the
3646  // mouse events to its envelope.
3647  if (mCapturedTrack)
3648  ForwardEventToEnvelope(event);
3649 
3650  if (event.LeftUp()) {
3651  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
3652  MakeParentPushState(
3653  /* i18n-hint: (verb) Audacity has just adjusted the envelope .*/
3654  _("Adjusted envelope."),
3655  /* i18n-hint: The envelope is a curve that controls the audio loudness.*/
3656  _("Envelope")
3657  );
3658  }
3659 }
3660 
3663 void TrackPanel::ForwardEventToTimeTrackEnvelope(wxMouseEvent & event)
3664 {
3665  TimeTrack *ptimetrack = (TimeTrack *) mCapturedTrack;
3666  Envelope *pspeedenvelope = ptimetrack->GetEnvelope();
3667 
3668  wxRect envRect = mCapturedRect;
3669  double lower = ptimetrack->GetRangeLower(), upper = ptimetrack->GetRangeUpper();
3670  const double dBRange = mViewInfo->dBr;
3671  if (ptimetrack->GetDisplayLog()) {
3672  // MB: silly way to undo the work of GetWaveYPos while still getting a logarithmic scale
3673  lower = LINEAR_TO_DB(std::max(1.0e-7, lower)) / dBRange + 1.0;
3674  upper = LINEAR_TO_DB(std::max(1.0e-7, upper)) / dBRange + 1.0;
3675  }
3676  bool needUpdate =
3677  pspeedenvelope->MouseEvent(
3678  event, envRect,
3679  *mViewInfo,
3680  ptimetrack->GetDisplayLog(), dBRange, lower, upper);
3681  if (needUpdate) {
3682  RefreshTrack(mCapturedTrack);
3683  }
3684 }
3685 
3688 void TrackPanel::ForwardEventToWaveTrackEnvelope(wxMouseEvent & event)
3689 {
3690  WaveTrack *pwavetrack = (WaveTrack *) mCapturedTrack;
3691  Envelope *penvelope = mCapturedEnvelope;
3692 
3693  // Possibly no-envelope, for example when in spectrum view mode.
3694  // if so, then bail out.
3695  if (!penvelope)
3696  return;
3697 
3698  // AS: WaveTracks can be displayed in several different formats.
3699  // This asks which one is in use. (ie, Wave, Spectrum, etc)
3700  int display = pwavetrack->GetDisplay();
3701 
3702  if (display == WaveTrack::Waveform) {
3703  const bool dB = !pwavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().isLinear();
3704  const double dBRange = pwavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange;
3705  bool needUpdate;
3706 
3707  // AS: Then forward our mouse event to the envelope.
3708  // It'll recalculate and then tell us whether or not to redraw.
3709  wxRect envRect = mCapturedRect;
3710  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
3711  pwavetrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
3712  needUpdate = penvelope->MouseEvent(
3713  event, envRect,
3714  *mViewInfo,
3715  dB, dBRange, zoomMin, zoomMax);
3716 
3717  // If this track is linked to another track, make the identical
3718  // change to the linked envelope:
3719  WaveTrack *link = (WaveTrack *) mCapturedTrack->GetLink();
3720  if (link) {
3721  Envelope *e2 = link->GetEnvelopeAtX(event.GetX());
3722  // There isn't necessarily an envelope there; no guarantee a
3723  // linked track has the same WaveClip structure...
3724  bool updateNeeded = false;
3725  if (e2) {
3726  wxRect envRect = mCapturedRect;
3727  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
3728  pwavetrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
3729  updateNeeded = e2->MouseEvent(event, envRect,
3730  *mViewInfo, dB, dBRange,
3731  zoomMin, zoomMax);
3732  needUpdate |= updateNeeded;
3733  }
3734  if(!e2 || !updateNeeded) // no envelope found at this x point, or found but not updated
3735  {
3736  if( (e2 = link->GetActiveEnvelope()) != 0 ) // search for any active DragPoint
3737  {
3738  wxRect envRect = mCapturedRect;
3739  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
3740  pwavetrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
3741  needUpdate |= e2->MouseEvent(event, envRect,
3742  *mViewInfo, dB, dBRange,
3743  zoomMin, zoomMax);
3744  }
3745  }
3746  }
3747 
3748  if (needUpdate) {
3749  RefreshTrack(mCapturedTrack);
3750  }
3751  }
3752 }
3753 
3754 
3758 
3759 // AS: I'm not sure why we can't let the Envelope take care of
3760 // redrawing itself. ?
3761 
3762 void TrackPanel::ForwardEventToEnvelope(wxMouseEvent & event)
3763 {
3764  if (mCapturedTrack && mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Time)
3765  {
3766  ForwardEventToTimeTrackEnvelope( event );
3767  }
3768  else if (mCapturedTrack && mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
3769  {
3770  ForwardEventToWaveTrackEnvelope( event );
3771  }
3772 }
3773 
3774 void TrackPanel::HandleSlide(wxMouseEvent & event)
3775 {
3776  if (event.LeftDown())
3777  StartSlide(event);
3778 
3779  if (mMouseCapture != IsSliding)
3780  return;
3781 
3782  if (event.Dragging() && mCapturedTrack)
3783  DoSlide(event);
3784 
3785  if (event.LeftUp()) {
3786  for (size_t i = 0; i < mCapturedClipArray.size(); i++)
3787  {
3788  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[i];
3789  WaveClip* pWaveClip = trackClip.clip;
3790  // Note that per TrackPanel::AddClipsToCaptured(Track *t, double t0, double t1),
3791  // in the non-WaveTrack case, the code adds a NULL clip to mCapturedClipArray,
3792  // so we have to check for that any time we're going to deref it.
3793  // Previous code did not check it here, and that caused bug 367 crash.
3794  if (pWaveClip &&
3795  trackClip.track != trackClip.origTrack)
3796  {
3797  // Now that user has dropped the clip into a different track,
3798  // make sure the sample rate matches the destination track (mCapturedTrack).
3799  pWaveClip->Resample(static_cast<WaveTrack*>(trackClip.track)->GetRate());
3800  pWaveClip->MarkChanged();
3801  }
3802  }
3803 
3804  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
3805 
3806  if (mSnapManager) {
3807  delete mSnapManager;
3808  mSnapManager = NULL;
3809  }
3810 
3811  // Do not draw yellow lines
3812  if (mSnapLeft != -1 || mSnapRight != -1) {
3813  mSnapLeft = mSnapRight = -1;
3814  Refresh(false);
3815  }
3816 
3817  if (!mDidSlideVertically && mHSlideAmount==0)
3818  return;
3819 
3820  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
3821 
3822  wxString msg;
3823  bool consolidate;
3824  if (mDidSlideVertically) {
3825  msg.Printf(_("Moved clips to another track"));
3826  consolidate = false;
3827  }
3828  else {
3829  wxString direction = mHSlideAmount>0 ?
3830  /* i18n-hint: a direction as in left or right.*/
3831  _("right") :
3832  /* i18n-hint: a direction as in left or right.*/
3833  _("left");
3834  /* i18n-hint: %s is a direction like left or right */
3835  msg.Printf(_("Time shifted tracks/clips %s %.02f seconds"),
3836  direction.c_str(), fabs(mHSlideAmount));
3837  consolidate = true;
3838  }
3839  MakeParentPushState(msg, _("Time-Shift"),
3840  consolidate ? (UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE) : (UndoPush::AUTOSAVE));
3841  }
3842 }
3843 
3844 namespace {
3845  // Don't count right channels.
3846  WaveTrack *NthAudioTrack(TrackList &list, int nn)
3847  {
3848  if (nn >= 0) {
3849  TrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Wave, &list);
3850  Track *pTrack = iter.First();
3851  while (pTrack && nn--)
3852  pTrack = iter.Next(true);
3853  return static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
3854  }
3855 
3856  return NULL;
3857  }
3858 
3859  // Don't count right channels.
3860  int TrackPosition(TrackList &list, Track *pFindTrack)
3861  {
3862  Track *const partner = pFindTrack->GetLink();
3863  TrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Wave, &list);
3864  int nn = 0;
3865  for (Track *pTrack = iter.First(); pTrack; pTrack = iter.Next(true), ++nn) {
3866  if (pTrack == pFindTrack ||
3867  pTrack == partner)
3868  return nn;
3869  }
3870  return -1;
3871  }
3872 
3873  WaveClip *FindClipAtTime(WaveTrack *pTrack, double time)
3874  {
3875  if (pTrack) {
3876  // WaveClip::GetClipAtX doesn't work unless the clip is on the screen and can return bad info otherwise
3877  // instead calculate the time manually
3878  double rate = pTrack->GetRate();
3879  sampleCount s0 = (sampleCount)(time * rate + 0.5);
3880 
3881  if (s0 >= 0)
3882  return pTrack->GetClipAtSample(s0);
3883  }
3884 
3885  return 0;
3886  }
3887 }
3888 
3890 void TrackPanel::StartSlide(wxMouseEvent & event)
3891 {
3892  wxRect rect;
3893 
3894  mHSlideAmount = 0.0;
3895  mDidSlideVertically = false;
3896 
3897  mTrackExclusions.Clear();
3898 
3899  Track *vt = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
3900  if (!vt)
3901  return;
3902 
3903  ToolsToolBar * ttb = mListener->TP_GetToolsToolBar();
3904  bool multiToolModeActive = (ttb && ttb->IsDown(multiTool));
3905 
3906  double clickTime =
3907  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, GetLeftOffset());
3908  mCapturedClipIsSelection =
3909  (vt->GetSelected() &&
3910  clickTime > mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0() &&
3911  clickTime < mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1());
3912 
3913  if ((vt->GetKind() == Track::Wave
3914 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3915  || vt->GetKind() == Track::Note
3916 #endif
3917  ) && !event.ShiftDown())
3918  {
3919 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3920  if (vt->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
3921 #endif
3922  WaveTrack* wt = (WaveTrack*)vt;
3923  mCapturedClip = wt->GetClipAtX(event.m_x);
3924  if (mCapturedClip == NULL)
3925  return;
3926 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3927  }
3928  else {
3929  mCapturedClip = NULL;
3930  }
3931 #endif
3932  // The captured clip is the focus, but we need to create a list
3933  // of all clips that have to move, also...
3934 
3935  mCapturedClipArray.Clear();
3936 
3937  // First, if click was in selection, capture selected clips; otherwise
3938  // just the clicked-on clip
3939  if (mCapturedClipIsSelection) {
3940  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3941  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
3942  if (t->GetSelected()) {
3943  AddClipsToCaptured(t, true);
3944  if (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
3945  mTrackExclusions.Add(t);
3946  }
3947  }
3948  }
3949  else {
3950  mCapturedClipArray.Add(TrackClip(vt, mCapturedClip));
3951 
3952  // Check for stereo partner
3953  Track *partner = mTracks->GetLink(vt);
3954  if (mCapturedClip && partner && partner->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
3955  WaveClip *const clip =
3956  FindClipAtTime(static_cast<WaveTrack*>(partner),
3957  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, GetLeftOffset()));
3958  if (clip)
3959  mCapturedClipArray.Add(TrackClip(partner, clip));
3960  }
3961  }
3962 
3963  // Now, if sync-lock is enabled, capture any clip that's linked to a
3964  // captured clip.
3965  if (GetProject()->IsSyncLocked()) {
3966  // AWD: mCapturedClipArray expands as the loop runs, so newly-added
3967  // clips are considered (the effect is like recursion and terminates
3968  // because AddClipsToCaptured doesn't add duplicate clips); to remove
3969  // this behavior just store the array size beforehand.
3970  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < mCapturedClipArray.size(); ++i) {
3971  // Capture based on tracks that have clips -- that means we
3972  // don't capture based on links to label tracks for now (until
3973  // we can treat individual labels as clips)
3974  if (mCapturedClipArray[i].clip) {
3975  // Iterate over sync-lock group tracks.
3976  SyncLockedTracksIterator git(mTracks);
3977  for (Track *t = git.StartWith(mCapturedClipArray[i].track);
3978  t; t = git.Next() )
3979  {
3980  AddClipsToCaptured(t,
3981  mCapturedClipArray[i].clip->GetStartTime(),
3982  mCapturedClipArray[i].clip->GetEndTime() );
3983  if (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
3984  mTrackExclusions.Add(t);
3985  }
3986  }
3987 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3988  // Capture additional clips from NoteTracks
3989  Track *nt = mCapturedClipArray[i].track;
3990  if (nt->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
3991  // Iterate over sync-lock group tracks.
3992  SyncLockedTracksIterator git(mTracks);
3993  for (Track *t = git.StartWith(nt); t; t = git.Next())
3994  {
3995  AddClipsToCaptured(t, nt->GetStartTime(), nt->GetEndTime());
3996  if (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
3997  mTrackExclusions.Add(t);
3998  }
3999  }
4000 #endif
4001  }
4002  }
4003 
4004  } else {
4005  mCapturedClip = NULL;
4006  mCapturedClipArray.Clear();
4007  }
4008 
4009  mSlideUpDownOnly = event.CmdDown() && !multiToolModeActive;
4010 
4011  mCapturedTrack = vt;
4012  mCapturedRect = rect;
4013 
4014  mMouseClickX = event.m_x;
4015  mMouseClickY = event.m_y;
4016 
4017  mSelStartValid = true;
4018  mSelStart = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x);
4019 
4020  if (mSnapManager)
4021  delete mSnapManager;
4022  mSnapManager = new SnapManager(mTracks,
4023  mViewInfo,
4024  &mCapturedClipArray,
4025  &mTrackExclusions,
4026  true); // don't snap to time
4027  mSnapLeft = -1;
4028  mSnapRight = -1;
4029  mSnapPreferRightEdge = false;
4030  if (mCapturedClip) {
4031  if (fabs(mSelStart - mCapturedClip->GetEndTime()) <
4032  fabs(mSelStart - mCapturedClip->GetStartTime()))
4033  mSnapPreferRightEdge = true;
4034  }
4035 
4036  mMouseCapture = IsSliding;
4037 }
4038 
4039 // Helper for the above, adds a track's clips to mCapturedClipArray (eliminates
4040 // duplication of this logic)
4041 void TrackPanel::AddClipsToCaptured(Track *t, bool withinSelection)
4042 {
4043  if (withinSelection)
4044  AddClipsToCaptured(t, mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(),
4045  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1());
4046  else
4047  AddClipsToCaptured(t, t->GetStartTime(), t->GetEndTime());
4048 }
4049 
4050 // Adds a track's clips to mCapturedClipArray within a specified time
4051 void TrackPanel::AddClipsToCaptured(Track *t, double t0, double t1)
4052 {
4053  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4054  {
4055  WaveClipList::compatibility_iterator it =
4056  ((WaveTrack *)t)->GetClipIterator();
4057  while (it)
4058  {
4059  WaveClip *clip = it->GetData();
4060 
4061  if ( ! clip->AfterClip(t0) && ! clip->BeforeClip(t1) )
4062  {
4063  // Avoid getting clips that were already captured
4064  bool newClip = true;
4065  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < mCapturedClipArray.size(); ++i) {
4066  if (mCapturedClipArray[i].clip == clip) {
4067  newClip = false;
4068  break;
4069  }
4070  }
4071 
4072  if (newClip)
4073  mCapturedClipArray.Add(TrackClip(t, clip));
4074  }
4075  it = it->GetNext();
4076  }
4077  }
4078  else
4079  {
4080  // This handles label tracks rather heavy-handedly -- it would be nice to
4081  // treat individual labels like clips
4082 
4083  // Avoid adding a track twice
4084  bool newClip = true;
4085  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < mCapturedClipArray.size(); ++i) {
4086  if (mCapturedClipArray[i].track == t) {
4087  newClip = false;
4088  break;
4089  }
4090  }
4091 
4092  if (newClip) {
4093 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4094  // do not add NoteTrack if the data is outside of time bounds
4095  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
4096  if (t->GetEndTime() < t0 || t->GetStartTime() > t1)
4097  return;
4098  }
4099 #endif
4100  mCapturedClipArray.Add(TrackClip(t, NULL));
4101  }
4102  }
4103 }
4104 
4107 
4108 // GM: DoSlide now implementing snap-to
4109 // samples functionality based on sample rate.
4110 void TrackPanel::DoSlide(wxMouseEvent & event)
4111 {
4112  unsigned int i;
4113 
4114  // find which track the mouse is currently in (mouseTrack) -
4115  // this may not be the same as the one we started in...
4116  Track *mouseTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, NULL);
4117  if (mouseTrack == NULL) {
4118  // Allow sliding if the pointer is not over any track, but only if x is
4119  // within the bounds of the tracks area.
4120  int width;
4121  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
4122  if (event.m_x >= GetLeftOffset() && event.m_x < GetLeftOffset() + width)
4123  mouseTrack = mCapturedTrack;
4124  else
4125  return;
4126  }
4127 
4128  // Start by undoing the current slide amount; everything
4129  // happens relative to the original horizontal position of
4130  // each clip...
4131 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4132  if (mCapturedClipArray.size())
4133 #else
4134  if (mCapturedClip)
4135 #endif
4136  {
4137  for(i=0; i<mCapturedClipArray.size(); i++) {
4138  if (mCapturedClipArray[i].clip)
4139  mCapturedClipArray[i].clip->Offset(-mHSlideAmount);
4140  else
4141  mCapturedClipArray[i].track->Offset(-mHSlideAmount);
4142  }
4143  }
4144  else {
4145  mCapturedTrack->Offset(-mHSlideAmount);
4146  Track* link = mTracks->GetLink(mCapturedTrack);
4147  if (link)
4148  link->Offset(-mHSlideAmount);
4149  }
4150 
4151  if (mCapturedClipIsSelection) {
4152  // Slide the selection, too
4153  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.move(-mHSlideAmount);
4154  }
4155  mHSlideAmount = 0.0;
4156 
4157  // Implement sliding within the track(s)
4158  double desiredSlideAmount;
4159  if (mSlideUpDownOnly) {
4160  desiredSlideAmount = 0.0;
4161  }
4162  else {
4163  desiredSlideAmount =
4164  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x) -
4165  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mMouseClickX);
4166  bool trySnap = false;
4167  double clipLeft = 0, clipRight = 0;
4168 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4169  if (mouseTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
4170  WaveTrack *mtw = (WaveTrack *)mouseTrack;
4171  desiredSlideAmount = rint(mtw->GetRate() * desiredSlideAmount) /
4172  mtw->GetRate(); // set it to a sample point
4173  }
4174  // Adjust desiredSlideAmount using SnapManager
4175  if (mSnapManager && mCapturedClipArray.size()) {
4176  trySnap = true;
4177  if (mCapturedClip) {
4178  clipLeft = mCapturedClip->GetStartTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4179  clipRight = mCapturedClip->GetEndTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4180  }
4181  else {
4182  clipLeft = mCapturedTrack->GetStartTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4183  clipRight = mCapturedTrack->GetEndTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4184  }
4185  }
4186 #else
4187  {
4188  trySnap = true;
4189  desiredSlideAmount = rint(mouseTrack->GetRate() * desiredSlideAmount) /
4190  mouseTrack->GetRate(); // set it to a sample point
4191  if (mSnapManager && mCapturedClip) {
4192  clipLeft = mCapturedClip->GetStartTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4193  clipRight = mCapturedClip->GetEndTime() + desiredSlideAmount;
4194  }
4195  }
4196 #endif
4197  if (trySnap) {
4198  double newClipLeft = clipLeft;
4199  double newClipRight = clipRight;
4200 
4201  bool dummy1, dummy2;
4202  mSnapManager->Snap(mCapturedTrack, clipLeft, false, &newClipLeft,
4203  &dummy1, &dummy2);
4204  mSnapManager->Snap(mCapturedTrack, clipRight, false, &newClipRight,
4205  &dummy1, &dummy2);
4206 
4207  // Only one of them is allowed to snap
4208  if (newClipLeft != clipLeft && newClipRight != clipRight) {
4209  if (mSnapPreferRightEdge)
4210  newClipLeft = clipLeft;
4211  else
4212  newClipRight = clipRight;
4213  }
4214 
4215  // Take whichever one snapped (if any) and compute the NEW desiredSlideAmount
4216  mSnapLeft = -1;
4217  mSnapRight = -1;
4218  if (newClipLeft != clipLeft) {
4219  double difference = (newClipLeft - clipLeft);
4220  desiredSlideAmount += difference;
4221  mSnapLeft = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(newClipLeft, GetLeftOffset());
4222  }
4223  else if (newClipRight != clipRight) {
4224  double difference = (newClipRight - clipRight);
4225  desiredSlideAmount += difference;
4226  mSnapRight = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(newClipRight, GetLeftOffset());
4227  }
4228  }
4229  }
4230 
4231  // Scroll during vertical drag.
4232  // EnsureVisible(mouseTrack); //vvv Gale says this has problems on Linux, per bug 393 thread. Revert for 2.0.2.
4233  bool slidVertically = false;
4234 
4235  // If the mouse is over a track that isn't the captured track,
4236  // decide which tracks the captured clips should go to.
4237  if (mCapturedClip && mouseTrack != mCapturedTrack /*&&
4238  !mCapturedClipIsSelection*/)
4239  {
4240  const int diff =
4241  TrackPosition(*mTracks, mouseTrack) -
4242  TrackPosition(*mTracks, mCapturedTrack);
4243  for (unsigned ii = 0, nn = mCapturedClipArray.size(); ii < nn; ++ii) {
4244  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[ii];
4245  if (trackClip.clip) {
4246  // Move all clips up or down by an equal count of audio tracks.
4247  Track *const pSrcTrack = trackClip.track;
4248  Track *pDstTrack = NthAudioTrack(*mTracks,
4249  diff + TrackPosition(*mTracks, pSrcTrack));
4250  // Can only move mono to mono, or left to left, or right to right
4251  // And that must be so for each captured clip
4252  bool stereo = (pSrcTrack->GetLink() != 0);
4253  if (pDstTrack && stereo && !pSrcTrack->GetLinked())
4254  pDstTrack = pDstTrack->GetLink();
4255  bool ok = pDstTrack &&
4256  (stereo == (pDstTrack->GetLink() != 0)) &&
4257  (!stereo || (pSrcTrack->GetLinked() == pDstTrack->GetLinked()));
4258  if (ok)
4259  trackClip.dstTrack = pDstTrack;
4260  else
4261  return;
4262  }
4263  }
4264 
4265  // Having passed that test, remove clips temporarily from their
4266  // tracks, so moving clips don't interfere with each other
4267  // when we call CanInsertClip()
4268  for (unsigned ii = 0, nn = mCapturedClipArray.size(); ii < nn; ++ii) {
4269  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[ii];
4270  WaveClip *const pSrcClip = trackClip.clip;
4271  if (pSrcClip)
4272  static_cast<WaveTrack*>(trackClip.track)->MoveClipToTrack(pSrcClip, NULL);
4273  }
4274 
4275  // Now check that the move is possible
4276  bool ok = true;
4277  for (unsigned ii = 0, nn = mCapturedClipArray.size(); ok && ii < nn; ++ii) {
4278  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[ii];
4279  WaveClip *const pSrcClip = trackClip.clip;
4280  if (pSrcClip)
4281  ok = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(trackClip.dstTrack)->CanInsertClip(pSrcClip);
4282  }
4283 
4284  if (!ok) {
4285  // Failure -- put clips back where they were
4286  for (unsigned ii = 0, nn = mCapturedClipArray.size(); ii < nn; ++ii) {
4287  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[ii];
4288  WaveClip *const pSrcClip = trackClip.clip;
4289  if (pSrcClip) {
4290  static_cast<WaveTrack*>(trackClip.track)->AddClip(pSrcClip);
4291  }
4292  }
4293  return;
4294  }
4295  else {
4296  // Do the vertical moves of clips
4297  for (unsigned ii = 0, nn = mCapturedClipArray.size(); ii < nn; ++ii) {
4298  TrackClip &trackClip = mCapturedClipArray[ii];
4299  WaveClip *const pSrcClip = trackClip.clip;
4300  if (pSrcClip) {
4301  Track *const dstTrack = trackClip.dstTrack;
4302  static_cast<WaveTrack*>(dstTrack)->AddClip(pSrcClip);
4303  trackClip.track = dstTrack;
4304  }
4305  }
4306 
4307  mCapturedTrack = mouseTrack;
4308  mDidSlideVertically = true;
4309 
4310  // Make the offset permanent; start from a "clean slate"
4311  mMouseClickX = event.m_x;
4312  }
4313 
4314  // Not done yet, check for horizontal movement.
4315  slidVertically = true;
4316  }
4317 
4318  if (desiredSlideAmount == 0.0) {
4319  Refresh(false);
4320  return;
4321  }
4322 
4323  mHSlideAmount = desiredSlideAmount;
4324 
4325 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4326  if (mCapturedClipArray.size())
4327 #else
4328  if (mCapturedClip)
4329 #endif
4330  {
4331  double allowed;
4332  double initialAllowed;
4333  double safeBigDistance = 1000 + 2.0 * (mTracks->GetEndTime() -
4334  mTracks->GetStartTime());
4335 
4336  do { // loop to compute allowed, does not actually move anything yet
4337  initialAllowed = mHSlideAmount;
4338 
4339  unsigned int i, j;
4340  for(i=0; i<mCapturedClipArray.size(); i++) {
4341  WaveTrack *track = (WaveTrack *)mCapturedClipArray[i].track;
4342  WaveClip *clip = mCapturedClipArray[i].clip;
4343 
4344  if (clip) { // only audio clips are used to compute allowed
4345  // Move all other selected clips totally out of the way
4346  // temporarily because they're all moving together and
4347  // we want to find out if OTHER clips are in the way,
4348  // not one of the moving ones
4349  for(j=0; j<mCapturedClipArray.size(); j++) {
4350  WaveClip *clip2 = mCapturedClipArray[j].clip;
4351  if (clip2 && clip2 != clip)
4352  clip2->Offset(-safeBigDistance);
4353  }
4354 
4355  if (track->CanOffsetClip(clip, mHSlideAmount, &allowed)) {
4356  if (mHSlideAmount != allowed) {
4357  mHSlideAmount = allowed;
4358  mSnapLeft = mSnapRight = -1; // see bug 1067
4359  }
4360  }
4361  else {
4362  mHSlideAmount = 0.0;
4363  mSnapLeft = mSnapRight = -1; // see bug 1067
4364  }
4365 
4366  for(j=0; j<mCapturedClipArray.size(); j++) {
4367  WaveClip *clip2 = mCapturedClipArray[j].clip;
4368  if (clip2 && clip2 != clip)
4369  clip2->Offset(safeBigDistance);
4370  }
4371  }
4372  }
4373  } while (mHSlideAmount != initialAllowed);
4374 
4375  if (mHSlideAmount != 0.0) { // finally, here is where clips are moved
4376  unsigned int i;
4377  for(i=0; i<mCapturedClipArray.size(); i++) {
4378  Track *track = mCapturedClipArray[i].track;
4379  WaveClip *clip = mCapturedClipArray[i].clip;
4380  if (clip)
4381  clip->Offset(mHSlideAmount);
4382  else
4383  track->Offset(mHSlideAmount);
4384  }
4385  }
4386  }
4387  else {
4388  // For Shift key down, or
4389  // For non wavetracks, specifically label tracks ...
4390  mCapturedTrack->Offset(mHSlideAmount);
4391  Track* link = mTracks->GetLink(mCapturedTrack);
4392  if (link)
4393  link->Offset(mHSlideAmount);
4394  }
4395 
4396  if (mCapturedClipIsSelection) {
4397  // Slide the selection, too
4398  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.move(mHSlideAmount);
4399  }
4400 
4401  if (slidVertically) {
4402  // NEW origin
4403  mHSlideAmount = 0;
4404  }
4405 
4406  Refresh(false);
4407 }
4408 
4409 
4420 void TrackPanel::HandleZoom(wxMouseEvent & event)
4421 {
4422  if (event.ButtonDown() || event.LeftDClick()) {
4423  HandleZoomClick(event);
4424  }
4425  else if (mMouseCapture == IsZooming) {
4426  if (event.Dragging()) {
4427  HandleZoomDrag(event);
4428  }
4429  else if (event.ButtonUp()) {
4430  HandleZoomButtonUp(event);
4431  }
4432  }
4433 }
4434 
4436 void TrackPanel::HandleZoomClick(wxMouseEvent & event)
4437 {
4438  if (mCapturedTrack)
4439  return;
4440 
4441  mCapturedTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false,
4442  &mCapturedRect);
4443  if (!mCapturedTrack)
4444  return;
4445 
4446  SetCapturedTrack(mCapturedTrack, IsZooming);
4447 
4448  mZoomStart = event.m_x;
4449  mZoomEnd = event.m_x;
4450 }
4451 
4453 void TrackPanel::HandleZoomDrag(wxMouseEvent & event)
4454 {
4455  const int left = GetLeftOffset();
4456  const int right = GetSize().x - kRightMargin - 1;
4457 
4458  mZoomEnd = event.m_x;
4459 
4460  if (event.m_x < left) {
4461  mZoomEnd = left;
4462  }
4463  else if (event.m_x > right) {
4464  mZoomEnd = right;
4465  }
4466 
4467  if (IsDragZooming()) {
4468  Refresh(false);
4469  }
4470 }
4471 
4473 void TrackPanel::HandleZoomButtonUp(wxMouseEvent & event)
4474 {
4475  if (mZoomEnd < mZoomStart)
4476  std::swap(mZoomStart, mZoomEnd);
4477 
4478  if (IsDragZooming())
4479  DragZoom(event, GetLeftOffset());
4480  else
4481  DoZoomInOut(event, GetLeftOffset());
4482 
4483  mZoomEnd = mZoomStart = 0;
4484 
4485  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
4486 
4487  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
4488  Refresh(false);
4489 }
4490 
4492 bool TrackPanel::IsDragZooming(int zoomStart, int zoomEnd)
4493 {
4494  return (abs(zoomEnd - zoomStart) > DragThreshold);
4495 }
4496 
4498 bool TrackPanel::IsMouseCaptured()
4499 {
4500  return (mMouseCapture != IsUncaptured || mCapturedTrack != NULL);
4501 }
4502 
4503 
4506 void TrackPanel::DragZoom(wxMouseEvent & event, int trackLeftEdge)
4507 {
4508  double left = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mZoomStart, trackLeftEdge);
4509  double right = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mZoomEnd, trackLeftEdge);
4510  double multiplier = (GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo->h) / (right - left);
4511  if (event.ShiftDown())
4512  multiplier = 1.0 / multiplier;
4513 
4514  mViewInfo->ZoomBy(multiplier);
4515 
4516  mViewInfo->h = left;
4517 }
4518 
4522 void TrackPanel::DoZoomInOut(wxMouseEvent & event, int trackLeftEdge)
4523 {
4524  double center_h = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, trackLeftEdge);
4525 
4526  const double multiplier =
4527  (event.RightUp() || event.RightDClick() || event.ShiftDown())
4528  ? 0.5 : 2.0;
4529  mViewInfo->ZoomBy(multiplier);
4530 
4531  if (event.MiddleUp() || event.MiddleDClick())
4532  mViewInfo->SetZoom(ZoomInfo::GetDefaultZoom()); // AS: Reset zoom.
4533 
4534  double new_center_h = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, trackLeftEdge);
4535 
4536  mViewInfo->h += (center_h - new_center_h);
4537 }
4538 
4541 void TrackPanel::HandleVZoom(wxMouseEvent & event)
4542 {
4543  if (event.ButtonDown() || event.ButtonDClick()) {
4544  HandleVZoomClick( event );
4545  }
4546  else if (event.Dragging()) {
4547  HandleVZoomDrag( event );
4548  }
4549  else if (event.ButtonUp()) {
4550  HandleVZoomButtonUp( event );
4551  }
4552  //TODO-MB: add timetrack zooming here!
4553 }
4554 
4556 void TrackPanel::HandleVZoomClick( wxMouseEvent & event )
4557 {
4558  if (mCapturedTrack)
4559  return;
4560  mCapturedTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, false,
4561  &mCapturedRect);
4562  if (!mCapturedTrack)
4563  return;
4564 
4565  if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave
4566 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4567  || mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note
4568 #endif
4569  )
4570  {
4571  mMouseCapture = IsVZooming;
4572  mZoomStart = event.m_y;
4573  mZoomEnd = event.m_y;
4574  // change note track to zoom like audio track
4575  //#ifdef USE_MIDI
4576  // if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
4577  // ((NoteTrack *) mCapturedTrack)->StartVScroll();
4578  // }
4579  //#endif
4580  }
4581 }
4582 
4584 void TrackPanel::HandleVZoomDrag( wxMouseEvent & event )
4585 {
4586  mZoomEnd = event.m_y;
4587  if (IsDragZooming()){
4588  // changed Note track to work like audio track
4589  //#ifdef USE_MIDI
4590  // if (mCapturedTrack && mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
4591  // ((NoteTrack *) mCapturedTrack)->VScroll(mZoomStart, mZoomEnd);
4592  // }
4593  //#endif
4594  Refresh(false);
4595  }
4596 }
4597 
4603 void TrackPanel::HandleVZoomButtonUp( wxMouseEvent & event )
4604 {
4605  if (!mCapturedTrack)
4606  return;
4607 
4608  mMouseCapture = IsUncaptured;
4609 
4610 #ifdef USE_MIDI
4611  // handle vertical scrolling in Note Track. This is so different from
4612  // zooming in audio tracks that it is handled as a special case from
4613  // which we then return
4614  if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
4615  NoteTrack *nt = (NoteTrack *) mCapturedTrack;
4616  if (IsDragZooming()) {
4617  nt->ZoomTo(mZoomStart, mZoomEnd);
4618  } else if (event.ShiftDown() || event.RightUp()) {
4619  nt->ZoomOut(mZoomEnd);
4620  } else {
4621  nt->ZoomIn(mZoomEnd);
4622  }
4623  mZoomEnd = mZoomStart = 0;
4624  Refresh(false);
4625  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
4626  MakeParentModifyState(true);
4627  return;
4628  }
4629 #endif
4630 
4631 
4632  // don't do anything if track is not wave
4633  if (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
4634  return;
4635 
4636  /*
4637  if (event.RightUp() &&
4638  !(event.ShiftDown() || event.CmdDown())) {
4639  OnVRulerMenu(mCapturedTrack, &event);
4640  return;
4641  }
4642  */
4643 
4644  HandleWaveTrackVZoom(static_cast<WaveTrack*>(mCapturedTrack),
4645  event.ShiftDown(), event.RightUp());
4646  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
4647 }
4648 
4649 void TrackPanel::HandleWaveTrackVZoom(WaveTrack *track, bool shiftDown, bool rightUp)
4650 {
4651  HandleWaveTrackVZoom(mTracks, mCapturedRect, mZoomStart, mZoomEnd,
4652  track, shiftDown, rightUp, false);
4653  mZoomEnd = mZoomStart = 0;
4654  UpdateVRuler(track);
4655  Refresh(false);
4656  MakeParentModifyState(true);
4657 }
4658 
4659 //static
4660 void TrackPanel::HandleWaveTrackVZoom
4661 (TrackList *tracks, const wxRect &rect,
4662  int zoomStart, int zoomEnd,
4663  WaveTrack *track, bool shiftDown, bool rightUp,
4664  bool fixedMousePoint)
4665 {
4666  WaveTrack *const partner = static_cast<WaveTrack *>(tracks->GetLink(track));
4667  int height = track->GetHeight() - (kTopMargin + kBottomMargin);
4668  int ypos = rect.y + kBorderThickness;
4669 
4670  // Ensure start and end are in order (swap if not).
4671  if (zoomEnd < zoomStart)
4672  std::swap(zoomStart, zoomEnd);
4673 
4674  float min, max, minBand = 0;
4675  const double rate = track->GetRate();
4676  const float halfrate = rate / 2;
4677  const SpectrogramSettings &settings = track->GetSpectrogramSettings();
4678  NumberScale scale;
4679  const bool spectral = (track->GetDisplay() == WaveTrack::Spectrum);
4680  const bool spectrumLinear = spectral &&
4681  (track->GetSpectrogramSettings().scaleType == SpectrogramSettings::stLinear);
4682 
4683  if (spectral) {
4684  track->GetSpectrumBounds(&min, &max);
4685  scale = (settings.GetScale(min, max, rate, false));
4686  const int fftLength = settings.GetFFTLength();
4687  const float binSize = rate / fftLength;
4688 
4689  // JKC: Following discussions of Bug 1208 I'm allowing zooming in
4690  // down to one bin.
4691 // const int minBins =
4692 // std::min(10, fftLength / 2); //minimum 10 freq bins, unless there are less
4693  const int minBins = 1;
4694  minBand = minBins * binSize;
4695  }
4696  else
4697  track->GetDisplayBounds(&min, &max);
4698 
4699  if (IsDragZooming(zoomStart, zoomEnd)) {
4700  // Drag Zoom
4701  const float tmin = min, tmax = max;
4702 
4703  if (spectral) {
4704  double xmin = 1 - (zoomEnd - ypos) / (float)height;
4705  double xmax = 1 - (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4706  const float middle = (xmin + xmax) / 2;
4707  const float middleValue = scale.PositionToValue(middle);
4708 
4709  min = std::max(spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f,
4710  std::min(middleValue - minBand / 2,
4711  scale.PositionToValue(xmin)
4712  ));
4713  max = std::min(halfrate,
4714  std::max(middleValue + minBand / 2,
4715  scale.PositionToValue(xmax)
4716  ));
4717  }
4718  else {
4719  const float p1 = (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4720  const float p2 = (zoomEnd - ypos) / (float)height;
4721  max = (tmax * (1.0-p1) + tmin * p1);
4722  min = (tmax * (1.0-p2) + tmin * p2);
4723 
4724  // Waveform view - allow zooming down to a range of ZOOMLIMIT
4725  if (max - min < ZOOMLIMIT) { // if user attempts to go smaller...
4726  const float c = (min+max)/2; // ...set centre of view to centre of dragged area and top/bottom to ZOOMLIMIT/2 above/below
4727  min = c - ZOOMLIMIT/2.0;
4728  max = c + ZOOMLIMIT/2.0;
4729  }
4730  }
4731  }
4732  else if (shiftDown || rightUp) {
4733  // Zoom OUT
4734  if (spectral) {
4735  if (shiftDown && rightUp) {
4736  // Zoom out full
4737  min = spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f;
4738  max = halfrate;
4739  }
4740  else {
4741  // Zoom out
4742 
4743  const float p1 = (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4744  // (Used to zoom out centered at midline, ignoring the click, if linear view.
4745  // I think it is better to be consistent. PRL)
4746  // Center zoom-out at the midline
4747  const float middle = // spectrumLinear ? 0.5f :
4748  1.0f - p1;
4749 
4750  if (fixedMousePoint) {
4751  min = std::max(spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f, scale.PositionToValue(-middle));
4752  max = std::min(halfrate, scale.PositionToValue(1.0f + p1));
4753  }
4754  else {
4755  min = std::max(spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f, scale.PositionToValue(middle - 1.0f));
4756  max = std::min(halfrate, scale.PositionToValue(middle + 1.0f));
4757  }
4758  }
4759  }
4760  else {
4761  // Zoom out to -1.0...1.0 first, then, and only
4762  // then, if they click again, allow one more
4763  // zoom out.
4764  if (shiftDown && rightUp) {
4765  // Zoom out full
4766  min = -1.0;
4767  max = 1.0;
4768  }
4769  else {
4770  // Zoom out
4771  const WaveformSettings &settings = track->GetWaveformSettings();
4772  const bool linear = settings.isLinear();
4773  const float top = linear
4774  ? 2.0
4775  : (LINEAR_TO_DB(2.0) + settings.dBRange) / settings.dBRange;
4776  if (min <= -1.0 && max >= 1.0) {
4777  // Go to the maximal zoom-out
4778  min = -top;
4779  max = top;
4780  }
4781  else {
4782  // limit to +/- 1 range unless already outside that range...
4783  float minRange = (min < -1) ? -top : -1.0;
4784  float maxRange = (max > 1) ? top : 1.0;
4785  // and enforce vertical zoom limits.
4786  const float p1 = (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4787  if (fixedMousePoint) {
4788  const float oldRange = max - min;
4789  const float c = (max * (1.0 - p1) + min * p1);
4790  min = std::min(maxRange - ZOOMLIMIT,
4791  std::max(minRange, c - 2 * (1.0f - p1) * oldRange));
4792  max = std::max(minRange + ZOOMLIMIT,
4793  std::min(maxRange, c + 2 * p1 * oldRange));
4794  }
4795  else {
4796  const float c = p1 * min + (1 - p1) * max;
4797  const float l = (max - min);
4798  min = std::min(maxRange - ZOOMLIMIT,
4799  std::max(minRange, c - l));
4800  max = std::max(minRange + ZOOMLIMIT,
4801  std::min(maxRange, c + l));
4802  }
4803  }
4804  }
4805  }
4806  }
4807  else {
4808  // Zoom IN
4809  if (spectral) {
4810  // Center the zoom-in at the click
4811  const float p1 = (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4812  const float middle = 1.0f - p1;
4813  const float middleValue = scale.PositionToValue(middle);
4814 
4815  if (fixedMousePoint) {
4816  min = std::max(spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f,
4817  std::min(middleValue - minBand * middle,
4818  scale.PositionToValue(0.5f * middle)
4819  ));
4820  max = std::min(halfrate,
4821  std::max(middleValue + minBand * p1,
4822  scale.PositionToValue(middle + 0.5f * p1)
4823  ));
4824  }
4825  else {
4826  min = std::max(spectrumLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f,
4827  std::min(middleValue - minBand / 2,
4828  scale.PositionToValue(middle - 0.25f)
4829  ));
4830  max = std::min(halfrate,
4831  std::max(middleValue + minBand / 2,
4832  scale.PositionToValue(middle + 0.25f)
4833  ));
4834  }
4835  }
4836  else {
4837  // Zoom in centered on cursor
4838  if (min < -1.0 || max > 1.0) {
4839  min = -1.0;
4840  max = 1.0;
4841  }
4842  else {
4843  // Enforce maximum vertical zoom
4844  const float oldRange = max - min;
4845  const float l = std::max(ZOOMLIMIT, 0.5f * oldRange);
4846  const float ratio = l / (max - min);
4847 
4848  const float p1 = (zoomStart - ypos) / (float)height;
4849  const float c = (max * (1.0 - p1) + min * p1);
4850  if (fixedMousePoint)
4851  min = c - ratio * (1.0f - p1) * oldRange,
4852  max = c + ratio * p1 * oldRange;
4853  else
4854  min = c - 0.5 * l,
4855  max = c + 0.5 * l;
4856  }
4857  }
4858  }
4859 
4860  if (spectral) {
4861  track->SetSpectrumBounds(min, max);
4862  if (partner)
4863  partner->SetSpectrumBounds(min, max);
4864  }
4865  else {
4866  track->SetDisplayBounds(min, max);
4867  if (partner)
4868  partner->SetDisplayBounds(min, max);
4869  }
4870 }
4871 
4872 namespace {
4873 // Is the sample horizontally nearest to the cursor sufficiently separated from
4874 // its neighbors that the pencil tool should be allowed to drag it?
4875 bool SampleResolutionTest(const ViewInfo &viewInfo, const WaveTrack *wt, double time, double rate, int width)
4876 {
4877  // Require more than 3 pixels per sample
4878  // Round to an exact sample time
4879  const double adjustedTime = wt->LongSamplesToTime(wt->TimeToLongSamples(time));
4880  const wxInt64 xx = std::max(wxInt64(0), viewInfo.TimeToPosition(adjustedTime));
4881  ZoomInfo::Intervals intervals;
4882  viewInfo.FindIntervals(rate, intervals, width);
4883  ZoomInfo::Intervals::const_iterator it = intervals.begin(), end = intervals.end(), prev;
4884  wxASSERT(it != end && it->position == 0);
4885  do
4886  prev = it++;
4887  while (it != end && it->position <= xx);
4888  const double threshold = 3 * rate; // three times as many pixels per second, as samples
4889  return prev->averageZoom > threshold;
4890 }
4891 }
4892 
4896 bool TrackPanel::IsSampleEditingPossible( wxMouseEvent &event, Track * t )
4897 {
4898  //Exit if we don't have a track
4899  if(!t)
4900  return false;
4901 
4902  //Exit if it's not a WaveTrack
4903  if(t->GetKind() != Track::Wave)
4904  return false;
4905 
4906  //Get out of here if we shouldn't be drawing right now:
4907  //If we aren't displaying the waveform, Display a message dialog
4908  WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(t);
4909  const int display = wt->GetDisplay();
4910 
4911  if (WaveTrack::Waveform != display)
4912  {
4913  wxMessageBox(_("To use Draw, choose 'Waveform' in the Track Drop-down Menu."), _("Draw Tool"));
4914  return false;
4915  }
4916 
4917  bool showPoints;
4918  {
4919  wxRect rect;
4920  FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
4921  WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(t);
4922  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
4923  const double time = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x);
4924  int width;
4925  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
4926  showPoints = SampleResolutionTest(*mViewInfo, wt, time, rate, width);
4927  }
4928 
4929  //If we aren't zoomed in far enough, show a message dialog.
4930  if(!showPoints)
4931  {
4932  wxMessageBox(_("To use Draw, zoom in further until you can see the individual samples."), _("Draw Tool"));
4933  return false;
4934  }
4935  return true;
4936 }
4937 
4938 float TrackPanel::FindSampleEditingLevel(wxMouseEvent &event, double dBRange, double t0)
4939 {
4940  // Calculate where the mouse is located vertically (between +/- 1)
4941  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
4942  mDrawingTrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
4943 
4944  const int y = event.m_y - mDrawingTrackTop;
4945  const int height = mDrawingTrack->GetHeight() - (kTopMargin + kBottomMargin);
4946  const bool dB = !mDrawingTrack->GetWaveformSettings().isLinear();
4947  float newLevel =
4948  ::ValueOfPixel(y, height, false, dB, dBRange, zoomMin, zoomMax);
4949 
4950  //Take the envelope into account
4951  Envelope *const env = mDrawingTrack->GetEnvelopeAtX(event.m_x);
4952  if (env)
4953  {
4954  double envValue = env->GetValue(t0);
4955  if (envValue > 0)
4956  newLevel /= envValue;
4957  else
4958  newLevel = 0;
4959 
4960  //Make sure the NEW level is between +/-1
4961  newLevel = std::max(-1.0f, std::min(1.0f, newLevel));
4962  }
4963 
4964  return newLevel;
4965 }
4966 
4969 void TrackPanel::HandleSampleEditingClick( wxMouseEvent & event )
4970 {
4971  //declare a rectangle to determine clicking position
4972  wxRect rect;
4973 
4974  //Get the track the mouse is over, and save it away for future events
4975  mDrawingTrack = NULL;
4976  Track *const t = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
4977 
4978  if (!t || (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave))
4979  return;
4980 
4981  if( !IsSampleEditingPossible( event, t ) )
4982  return;
4983 
4985  mDrawingTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(t);
4986  mDrawingTrackTop=rect.y + kTopMargin;
4987 
4988  //If we are still around, we are drawing in earnest. Set some member data structures up:
4989  //First, calculate the starting sample. To get this, we need the time
4990  double t0 = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, GetLeftOffset());
4991 
4992  //convert t0 to samples
4993  mDrawingStartSample = mDrawingTrack->TimeToLongSamples(t0);
4994  // quantize
4995  t0 = mDrawingTrack->LongSamplesToTime(mDrawingStartSample);
4996 
4997  //Determine how drawing should occur. If alt is down,
4998  //do a smoothing, instead of redrawing.
4999  if( event.m_altDown )
5000  {
5001  //*************************************************
5002  //*** ALT-DOWN-CLICK (SAMPLE SMOOTHING) ***
5003  //*************************************************
5004  //
5005  // Smoothing works like this: There is a smoothing kernel radius constant that
5006  // determines how wide the averaging window is. Plus, there is a smoothing brush radius,
5007  // which determines how many pixels wide around the selected pixel this smoothing is applied.
5008  //
5009  // Samples will be replaced by a mixture of the original points and the smoothed points,
5010  // with a triangular mixing probability whose value at the center point is
5011  // SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MAX and at the far bounds is SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MIN
5012 
5013  //Get the region of samples around the selected point
5014  int sampleRegionSize = 1 + 2 * (SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS);
5015  float *sampleRegion = new float[sampleRegionSize];
5016  float * newSampleRegion = new float[1 + 2 * SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS];
5017 
5018  //Get a sample from the track to do some tricks on.
5019  mDrawingTrack->Get((samplePtr)sampleRegion, floatSample,
5020  (int)mDrawingStartSample - SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS - SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS,
5021  sampleRegionSize);
5022  int i, j;
5023 
5024  //Go through each point of the smoothing brush and apply a smoothing operation.
5025  for(j = -SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS; j <= SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS; j++){
5026  float sumOfSamples = 0;
5027  for (i= -SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS; i <= SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS; i++){
5028  //Go through each point of the smoothing kernel and find the average
5029 
5030  //The average is a weighted average, scaled by a weighting kernel that is simply triangular
5031  // A triangular kernel across N items, with a radius of R ( 2 R + 1 points), if the farthest:
5032  // points have a probability of a, the entire triangle has total probability of (R + 1)^2.
5033  // For sample number i and middle brush sample M, (R + 1 - abs(M-i))/ ((R+1)^2) gives a
5034  // legal distribution whose total probability is 1.
5035  //
5036  //
5037  // weighting factor value
5038  sumOfSamples += (SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + 1 - abs(i)) * sampleRegion[i + j + SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS];
5039 
5040  }
5041  newSampleRegion[j + SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS] = sumOfSamples/((SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + 1) *(SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + 1) );
5042  }
5043 
5044 
5045  // Now that the NEW sample levels are determined, go through each and mix it appropriately
5046  // with the original point, according to a 2-part linear function whose center has probability
5047  // SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MAX and extends out SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS, at which the probability is
5048  // SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MIN. _MIN and _MAX specify how much of the smoothed curve make it through.
5049 
5050  float prob;
5051 
5052  for(j=-SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS; j <= SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS; j++){
5053 
5054  prob = SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MAX - (float)abs(j)/SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS * (SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MAX - SMOOTHING_PROPORTION_MIN);
5055 
5056  newSampleRegion[j+SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS] =
5057  newSampleRegion[j + SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS] * prob +
5058  sampleRegion[SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS + SMOOTHING_KERNEL_RADIUS + j] * (1 - prob);
5059  }
5060  //Set the sample to the point of the mouse event
5061  mDrawingTrack->Set((samplePtr)newSampleRegion, floatSample, mDrawingStartSample - SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS, 1 + 2 * SMOOTHING_BRUSH_RADIUS);
5062 
5063  //Clean this up right away to avoid a memory leak
5064  delete[] sampleRegion;
5065  delete[] newSampleRegion;
5066 
5067  mDrawingLastDragSampleValue = 0;
5068  }
5069  else
5070  {
5071  //*************************************************
5072  //*** PLAIN DOWN-CLICK (NORMAL DRAWING) ***
5073  //*************************************************
5074 
5075  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsAdjustingSample);
5076 
5077  //Otherwise (e.g., the alt button is not down) do normal redrawing, based on the mouse position.
5078  const float newLevel = FindSampleEditingLevel
5079  (event, mDrawingTrack->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange, t0);
5080 
5081  //Set the sample to the point of the mouse event
5082  mDrawingTrack->Set((samplePtr)&newLevel, floatSample, mDrawingStartSample, 1);
5083 
5084  mDrawingLastDragSampleValue = newLevel;
5085  }
5086 
5087  //Set the member data structures for drawing
5088  mDrawingLastDragSample=mDrawingStartSample;
5089 
5090  //Redraw the region of the selected track
5091  RefreshTrack(mDrawingTrack);
5092 }
5093 
5094 void TrackPanel::HandleSampleEditingDrag( wxMouseEvent & event )
5095 {
5096  //*************************************************
5097  //*** DRAG-DRAWING ***
5098  //*************************************************
5099 
5100  //The following will happen on a drag or a down-click.
5101  // The point should get re-drawn at the location of the mouse.
5102  //Exit if the mDrawingTrack is null.
5103  if( mDrawingTrack == NULL)
5104  return;
5105 
5106  //Exit dragging if the alt key is down--Don't allow left-right dragging for smoothing operation
5107  if (mMouseCapture != IsAdjustingSample)
5108  return;
5109 
5110  sampleCount s0; //declare this for use below. It designates the sample number which to draw.
5111 
5112  // Figure out what time the click was at
5113  //Find the point that we want to redraw at. If the control button is down,
5114  //adjust only the originally clicked-on sample
5115 
5116  if( event.m_controlDown) {
5117  //*************************************************
5118  //*** CTRL-DOWN (Hold Initial Sample Constant ***
5119  //*************************************************
5120 
5121  s0 = mDrawingStartSample;
5122  }
5123  else {
5124  //*************************************************
5125  //*** Normal CLICK-drag (Normal drawing) ***
5126  //*************************************************
5127 
5128  //Otherwise, adjust the sample you are dragging over right now.
5129  //convert this to samples
5130  const double t = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, GetLeftOffset());
5131  s0 = mDrawingTrack->TimeToLongSamples(t);
5132  }
5133 
5134  const double t0 = mDrawingTrack->LongSamplesToTime(s0);
5135 
5136  //Otherwise, do normal redrawing, based on the mouse position.
5137  // Calculate where the mouse is located vertically (between +/- 1)
5138 
5139  const float newLevel = FindSampleEditingLevel
5140  (event, mDrawingTrack->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange, t0);
5141 
5142  //Now, redraw all samples between current and last redrawn sample, inclusive
5143  //Go from the smaller to larger sample.
5144  const int start = std::min( s0, mDrawingLastDragSample);
5145  const int end = std::max( s0, mDrawingLastDragSample);
5146  const int size = end - start + 1;
5147  if (size == 1) {
5148  mDrawingTrack->Set((samplePtr)&newLevel, floatSample, start, size);
5149  }
5150  else {
5151  std::vector<float> values(size);
5152  for (sampleCount i = start; i <= end; ++i) {
5153  //This interpolates each sample linearly:
5154  values[i - start] =
5155  mDrawingLastDragSampleValue + (newLevel - mDrawingLastDragSampleValue) *
5156  (float)(i - mDrawingLastDragSample) / (s0 - mDrawingLastDragSample);
5157  }
5158  mDrawingTrack->Set((samplePtr)&values[0], floatSample, start, size);
5159  }
5160 
5161  //Update the member data structures.
5162  mDrawingLastDragSample=s0;
5163  mDrawingLastDragSampleValue = newLevel;
5164 
5165  //Redraw the region of the selected track
5166  RefreshTrack(mDrawingTrack);
5167 }
5168 
5169 void TrackPanel::HandleSampleEditingButtonUp( wxMouseEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
5170 {
5171  //*************************************************
5172  //*** UP-CLICK (Finish drawing) ***
5173  //*************************************************
5174  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5175  //On up-click, send the state to the undo stack
5176  mDrawingTrack=NULL; //Set this to NULL so it will catch improper drag events.
5177  MakeParentPushState(_("Moved Samples"),
5178  _("Sample Edit"),
5179  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE | UndoPush::AUTOSAVE);
5180 }
5181 
5182 
5193 void TrackPanel::HandleSampleEditing(wxMouseEvent & event)
5194 {
5195  if (event.LeftDown() ) {
5196  HandleSampleEditingClick( event);
5197  } else if (mDrawingTrack && event.Dragging()) {
5198  HandleSampleEditingDrag( event );
5199  } else if(mDrawingTrack && event.ButtonUp()) {
5200  HandleSampleEditingButtonUp( event );
5201  }
5202 }
5203 
5204 
5205 // This is for when a given track gets the x.
5206 void TrackPanel::HandleClosing(wxMouseEvent & event)
5207 {
5208  Track *t = mCapturedTrack;
5209  wxRect rect = mCapturedRect;
5210 
5211  wxRect closeRect;
5212  mTrackInfo.GetCloseBoxRect(rect, closeRect);
5213 
5214  wxClientDC dc(this);
5215 
5216  if (event.Dragging())
5217  mTrackInfo.DrawCloseBox(&dc, rect, closeRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y));
5218  else if (event.LeftUp()) {
5219  mTrackInfo.DrawCloseBox(&dc, rect, false);
