5220  if (closeRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y)) {
5221  if (!IsUnsafe())
5222  GetProject()->RemoveTrack(t);
5223  }
5224  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5225  }
5226 
5227  this->UpdateViewIfNoTracks();
5228  this->Refresh(false);
5229 }
5230 
5231 void TrackPanel::UpdateViewIfNoTracks()
5232 {
5233  if (mTracks->IsEmpty())
5234  {
5235  // BG: There are no more tracks on screen
5236  //BG: Set zoom to normal
5237  mViewInfo->SetZoom(ZoomInfo::GetDefaultZoom());
5238 
5239  //STM: Set selection to 0,0
5240  //PRL: and default the rest of the selection information
5241  mViewInfo->selectedRegion = SelectedRegion();
5242 
5243  // PRL: Following causes the time ruler to align 0 with left edge.
5244  // Bug 972
5245  mViewInfo->h = 0;
5246 
5247  mListener->TP_RedrawScrollbars();
5248  mListener->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(wxT("")); //STM: Clear message if all tracks are removed
5249  }
5250 }
5251 
5252 void TrackPanel::HandlePopping(wxMouseEvent & event)
5253 {
5254  Track *t = mCapturedTrack;
5255  wxRect rect = mCapturedRect;
5256 
5257  if( t==NULL ){
5258  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5259  return;
5260  }
5261 
5262  wxRect titleRect;
5263  mTrackInfo.GetTitleBarRect(rect, titleRect);
5264 
5265  wxClientDC dc(this);
5266 
5267  if (event.Dragging()) {
5268  mTrackInfo.DrawTitleBar(&dc, rect, t, titleRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y));
5269  }
5270  else if (event.LeftUp()) {
5271  if (titleRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y))
5272  {
5273  OnTrackMenu(t);
5274  }
5275 
5276  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5277 
5278  mTrackInfo.DrawTitleBar(&dc, rect, t, false);
5279  }
5280 }
5281 
5283 void TrackPanel::HandleMutingSoloing(wxMouseEvent & event, bool solo)
5284 {
5285  Track *t = mCapturedTrack;
5286  wxRect rect = mCapturedRect;
5287 
5288  if( t==NULL ){
5289  wxASSERT(false);// Soloing or muting but no captured track!
5290  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5291  return;
5292  }
5293 
5294  wxRect buttonRect;
5295  mTrackInfo.GetMuteSoloRect(rect, buttonRect, solo, HasSoloButton());
5296 
5297  wxClientDC dc(this);
5298 
5299  if (event.Dragging()){
5300  mTrackInfo.DrawMuteSolo(&dc, rect, t, buttonRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y),
5301  solo, HasSoloButton());
5302  }
5303  else if (event.LeftUp() )
5304  {
5305  if (buttonRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y))
5306  {
5307  // For either, MakeParentPushState to make the track state dirty.
5308  if(solo)
5309  GetProject()->DoTrackSolo(t, event.ShiftDown());
5310  else
5311  GetProject()->DoTrackMute(t, event.ShiftDown());
5312  }
5313  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5314  // mTrackInfo.DrawMuteSolo(&dc, rect, t, false, solo);
5315  Refresh(false);
5316  }
5317 }
5318 
5319 void TrackPanel::HandleMinimizing(wxMouseEvent & event)
5320 {
5321  Track *t = mCapturedTrack;
5322  wxRect rect = mCapturedRect;
5323 
5324  if (t == NULL) {
5325  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
5326  return;
5327  }
5328 
5329  wxRect buttonRect;
5330  mTrackInfo.GetMinimizeRect(rect, buttonRect);
5331 
5332  wxClientDC dc(this);
5333 
5334  if (event.Dragging()) {
5335  mTrackInfo.DrawMinimize(&dc, rect, t, buttonRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y));
5336  }
5337  else if (event.LeftUp()) {
5338  if (buttonRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y)) {
5339  t->SetMinimized(!t->GetMinimized());
5340  if (mTracks->GetLink(t))
5341  mTracks->GetLink(t)->SetMinimized(t->GetMinimized());
5342  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
5343  MakeParentModifyState(true);
5344  }
5345 
5346  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
5347 
5348  mTrackInfo.DrawMinimize(&dc, rect, t, false);
5349  Refresh(false);
5350  GetActiveProject()->RedrawProject();
5351  }
5352 }
5353 
5354 void TrackPanel::HandleSliders(wxMouseEvent &event, bool pan)
5355 {
5356  LWSlider *slider;
5357 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5358  bool panZero = false;
5359 #endif
5360 
5361  // On the Mac, we'll lose track capture if the slider dialog
5362  // is displayed, but it doesn't hurt to do this for all plats.
5363  WaveTrack *capturedTrack = (WaveTrack *) mCapturedTrack;
5364 
5365  if (pan)
5366  slider = mTrackInfo.PanSlider(capturedTrack, true);
5367  else
5368  slider = mTrackInfo.GainSlider(capturedTrack, true);
5369 
5370  slider->OnMouseEvent(event);
5371 
5372  //If we have a double-click, do this...
5373  if (event.LeftDClick())
5374  mMouseCapture = IsUncaptured;
5375 
5376  float newValue = slider->Get();
5377  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard(); // Update mixer board, too.
5378 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5379  if (capturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
5380 #endif
5381  WaveTrack *link = (WaveTrack *)mTracks->GetLink(capturedTrack);
5382 
5383  if (pan) {
5384 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5385  panZero = ((WaveTrack *)capturedTrack)->SetPan(newValue);
5386 #else
5387  ((WaveTrack *)capturedTrack)->SetPan(newValue);
5388 #endif
5389  if (link)
5390  link->SetPan(newValue);
5391 
5392 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5393  if(panZero) MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
5394 #endif
5395 
5396  if (pMixerBoard)
5397  pMixerBoard->UpdatePan((WaveTrack*)capturedTrack);
5398  }
5399  else {
5400  ((WaveTrack *)capturedTrack)->SetGain(newValue);
5401  if (link)
5402  link->SetGain(newValue);
5403 
5404  if (pMixerBoard)
5405  pMixerBoard->UpdateGain((WaveTrack*)capturedTrack);
5406  }
5407 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5408  } else { // Note: funny indentation to match "if" about 20 lines back
5409  if (!pan) {
5410  ((NoteTrack *) capturedTrack)->SetGain(newValue);
5411 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIXER_BOARD
5412  if (pMixerBoard)
5413  // probably should modify UpdateGain to take a track that is
5414  // either a WaveTrack or a NoteTrack.
5415  pMixerBoard->UpdateGain((WaveTrack*)capturedTrack);
5416 #endif
5417  }
5418  }
5419 #endif
5420 
5421  RefreshTrack(capturedTrack);
5422 
5423  if (event.ButtonUp()) {
5424 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5425  if (capturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
5426 #endif
5427  MakeParentPushState(pan ? _("Moved pan slider") : _("Moved gain slider"),
5428  pan ? _("Pan") : _("Gain"),
5429  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE);
5430 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5431  } else {
5432  MakeParentPushState(_("Moved velocity slider"), _("Velocity"), true);
5433  }
5434 #endif
5435  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5436  }
5437 }
5438 
5439 // The tracks positions within the list have changed, so update the vertical
5440 // ruler size for the track that triggered the event.
5441 void TrackPanel::OnTrackListResized(wxCommandEvent & e)
5442 {
5443  Track *t = (Track *) e.GetClientData();
5444 
5445  UpdateVRuler(t);
5446 
5447  e.Skip();
5448 }
5449 
5450 // Tracks have been added or removed from the list. Handle adds as if
5451 // a resize has taken place.
5452 void TrackPanel::OnTrackListUpdated(wxCommandEvent & e)
5453 {
5454  // Tracks may have been deleted, so check to see if the focused track was on of them.
5455  if (!mTracks->Contains(GetFocusedTrack())) {
5456  SetFocusedTrack(NULL);
5457  }
5458 
5459  if (e.GetClientData()) {
5460  OnTrackListResized(e);
5461  return;
5462  }
5463 
5464  e.Skip();
5465 }
5466 
5467 void TrackPanel::OnContextMenu(wxContextMenuEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
5468 {
5469  OnTrackMenu();
5470 }
5471 
5475 // That is, TrackInfo and vertical ruler rect.
5476 void TrackPanel::HandleLabelClick(wxMouseEvent & event)
5477 {
5478  // AS: If not a click, ignore the mouse event.
5479  if (!event.ButtonDown() && !event.ButtonDClick()) {
5480  return;
5481  }
5482 
5483  // MIDI tracks use the right mouse button, but other tracks get confused
5484  // if they see anything other than a left click.
5485  bool isleft = event.Button(wxMOUSE_BTN_LEFT);
5486 
5487  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
5488 
5489  wxRect rect;
5490 
5491  Track *t = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, true, &rect);
5492 
5493  // LL: Check close box
5494  if (isleft && CloseFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5495  return;
5496 
5497  // LL: Check title bar for popup
5498  if (isleft && PopupFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5499  return;
5500 
5501  // VJ: Check sync-lock icon and the blank area to the left of the minimize button.
5502  // Have to do it here, because if track is shrunk such that these areas occlude controls,
5503  // e.g., mute/solo, don't want the "Funcs" below to set up handling.
5504  // Only result of doing so is to select the track. Don't care whether isleft.
5505  bool bTrackSelClick = this->TrackSelFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y);
5506  if (!bTrackSelClick)
5507  {
5508  // MM: Check minimize buttons on WaveTracks. Must be before
5509  // solo/mute buttons, sliders etc.
5510  if (isleft && MinimizeFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5511  return;
5512 
5513  if (isleft && t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
5514  {
5515  // DM: Check Mute and Solo buttons on WaveTracks:
5516  if (MuteSoloFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y, false) ||
5517  MuteSoloFunc(t, rect, event.m_x, event.m_y, true))
5518  return;
5519 
5520  if (GainFunc(t, rect, event, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5521  return;
5522 
5523  if (PanFunc(t, rect, event, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5524  return;
5525  }
5526 #ifdef USE_MIDI
5527  // DM: If it's a NoteTrack, it has special controls
5528  else if (t->GetKind() == Track::Note)
5529  {
5530  wxRect midiRect;
5531 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5532  // this is an awful hack: make a NEW rectangle at an offset because
5533  // MuteSoloFunc thinks buttons are located below some text, e.g.
5534  // "Mono, 44100Hz 32-bit float", but this is not true for a Note track
5535  wxRect muteSoloRect(rect);
5536  muteSoloRect.y -= 34; // subtract the height of wave track text
5537  if (MuteSoloFunc(t, muteSoloRect, event.m_x, event.m_y, false) ||
5538  MuteSoloFunc(t, muteSoloRect, event.m_x, event.m_y, true))
5539  return;
5540 
5541  // this is a similar hack: GainFunc expects a Wave track slider, so it's
5542  // looking in the wrong place. We pass it a bogus rectangle created when
5543  // the slider was placed to "fake" GainFunc into finding the slider in
5544  // its actual location.
5545  if (GainFunc(t, ((NoteTrack *) t)->GetGainPlacementRect(),
5546  event, event.m_x, event.m_y))
5547  return;
5548 #endif
5549  mTrackInfo.GetTrackControlsRect(rect, midiRect);
5550  if (midiRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y) &&
5551  ((NoteTrack *) t)->LabelClick(midiRect, event.m_x, event.m_y,
5552  event.Button(wxMOUSE_BTN_RIGHT))) {
5553  Refresh(false);
5554  return;
5555  }
5556  }
5557 #endif // USE_MIDI
5558 
5559  }
5560 
5561  if (!isleft) {
5562  return;
5563  }
5564 
5565  // DM: If they weren't clicking on a particular part of a track label,
5566  // deselect other tracks and select this one.
5567 
5568  // JH: also, capture the current track for rearranging, so the user
5569  // can drag the track up or down to swap it with others
5570  if (!unsafe) {
5571  mRearrangeCount = 0;
5572  SetCapturedTrack( t, IsRearranging );
5573  TrackPanel::CalculateRearrangingThresholds(event);
5574  }
5575 
5576  // AS: If the shift button is being held down, invert
5577  // the selection on this track.
5578  if (event.ShiftDown()) {
5579  mTracks->Select(t, !t->GetSelected());
5580  Refresh(false);
5581  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard();
5582  if (pMixerBoard && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
5583  pMixerBoard->RefreshTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)t);
5584  return;
5585  }
5586 
5587  SelectNone();
5588  mTracks->Select(t);
5589  SetFocusedTrack(t);
5590  SelectTrackLength(t);
5591 
5592  this->Refresh(false);
5593  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard();
5594  if (pMixerBoard)
5595  pMixerBoard->RefreshTrackClusters();
5596 
5597  if (!unsafe)
5598  MakeParentModifyState(true);
5599 }
5600 
5603 void TrackPanel::HandleRearrange(wxMouseEvent & event)
5604 {
5605  // are we finishing the drag?
5606  if (event.LeftUp()) {
5607  if (mRearrangeCount != 0) {
5608  wxString dir;
5609  dir = mRearrangeCount < 0 ? _("up") : _("down");
5610  MakeParentPushState(wxString::Format(_("Moved '%s' %s"),
5611  mCapturedTrack->GetName().c_str(),
5612  dir.c_str()),
5613  _("Move Track"));
5614  }
5615 
5616  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
5617  SetCursor(*mArrowCursor);
5618  return;
5619  }
5620 
5621  // probably harmless during play? However, we do disallow the click, so check this too.
5622  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
5623  if (unsafe)
5624  return;
5625 
5626  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard(); // Update mixer board, too.
5627  if (event.m_y < mMoveUpThreshold || event.m_y < 0) {
5628  mTracks->MoveUp(mCapturedTrack);
5629  --mRearrangeCount;
5630 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5631  if (pMixerBoard && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave ||
5632  mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note))
5633  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster(mCapturedTrack, true /* up */);
5634 #else
5635  if (pMixerBoard && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
5636  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)mCapturedTrack, true /* up */);
5637 #endif
5638  }
5639  else if (event.m_y > mMoveDownThreshold || event.m_y > GetRect().GetHeight()) {
5640  mTracks->MoveDown(mCapturedTrack);
5641  ++mRearrangeCount;
5642  /* i18n-hint: a direction as in up or down.*/
5643 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_MIDI_OUT
5644  if (pMixerBoard && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave ||
5645  mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Note))
5646  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster(mCapturedTrack, false /* down */);
5647 #else
5648  if (pMixerBoard && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
5649  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)mCapturedTrack, false /* down */);
5650 #endif
5651  }
5652  else
5653  {
5654  return;
5655  }
5656 
5657  // JH: if we moved up or down, recalculate the thresholds and make sure the
5658  // track is fully on-screen.
5659  TrackPanel::CalculateRearrangingThresholds(event);
5660  EnsureVisible(mCapturedTrack);
5661 }
5662 
5665 void TrackPanel::CalculateRearrangingThresholds(wxMouseEvent & event)
5666 {
5667  wxASSERT(mCapturedTrack);
5668 
5669  // JH: this will probably need to be tweaked a bit, I'm just
5670  // not sure what formula will have the best feel for the
5671  // user.
5672  if (mTracks->CanMoveUp(mCapturedTrack))
5673  mMoveUpThreshold =
5674  event.m_y - mTracks->GetGroupHeight( mTracks->GetPrev(mCapturedTrack,true) );
5675  else
5676  mMoveUpThreshold = INT_MIN;
5677 
5678  if (mTracks->CanMoveDown(mCapturedTrack))
5679  mMoveDownThreshold =
5680  event.m_y + mTracks->GetGroupHeight( mTracks->GetNext(mCapturedTrack,true) );
5681  else
5682  mMoveDownThreshold = INT_MAX;
5683 }
5684 
5685 bool TrackPanel::GainFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, wxMouseEvent &event,
5686  int x, int y)
5687 {
5688  wxRect sliderRect;
5689  mTrackInfo.GetGainRect(rect, sliderRect);
5690  if (!sliderRect.Contains(x, y))
5691  return false;
5692 
5693  SetCapturedTrack( t, IsGainSliding);
5694  mCapturedRect = rect;
5695  HandleSliders(event, false);
5696 
5697  return true;
5698 }
5699 
5700 bool TrackPanel::PanFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, wxMouseEvent &event,
5701  int x, int y)
5702 {
5703  wxRect sliderRect;
5704  mTrackInfo.GetPanRect(rect, sliderRect);
5705  if (!sliderRect.Contains(x, y))
5706  return false;
5707 
5708  SetCapturedTrack( t, IsPanSliding);
5709  mCapturedRect = rect;
5710  HandleSliders(event, true);
5711 
5712  return true;
5713 }
5714 
5718 bool TrackPanel::MuteSoloFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, int x, int y,
5719  bool solo)
5720 {
5721  wxRect buttonRect;
5722  mTrackInfo.GetMuteSoloRect(rect, buttonRect, solo, HasSoloButton());
5723  if (!buttonRect.Contains(x, y))
5724  return false;
5725 
5726  wxClientDC dc(this);
5727  SetCapturedTrack( t, solo ? IsSoloing : IsMuting);
5728  mCapturedRect = rect;
5729 
5730  mTrackInfo.DrawMuteSolo(&dc, rect, t, true, solo, HasSoloButton());
5731  return true;
5732 }
5733 
5734 bool TrackPanel::TrackSelFunc(Track * WXUNUSED(t), wxRect rect, int x, int y)
5735 {
5736  // First check the blank space to left of minimize button.
5737  wxRect selRect;
5738  mTrackInfo.GetMinimizeRect(rect, selRect); // for y and height
5739  selRect.x = rect.x;
5740  selRect.width = 16; // (kTrackInfoBtnSize)
5741  selRect.height++;
5742  if (selRect.Contains(x, y))
5743  return true;
5744 
5745  // Try the sync-lock rect.
5746  mTrackInfo.GetSyncLockIconRect(rect, selRect);
5747  selRect.height++;
5748  return selRect.Contains(x, y);
5749 }
5750 
5751 bool TrackPanel::MinimizeFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, int x, int y)
5752 {
5753  wxRect buttonRect;
5754  mTrackInfo.GetMinimizeRect(rect, buttonRect);
5755  if (!buttonRect.Contains(x, y))
5756  return false;
5757 
5758  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsMinimizing);
5759  mCapturedRect = rect;
5760 
5761  wxClientDC dc(this);
5762  mTrackInfo.DrawMinimize(&dc, rect, t, true);
5763 
5764  return true;
5765 }
5766 
5767 bool TrackPanel::CloseFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, int x, int y)
5768 {
5769  wxRect closeRect;
5770  mTrackInfo.GetCloseBoxRect(rect, closeRect);
5771 
5772  if (!closeRect.Contains(x, y))
5773  return false;
5774 
5775  wxClientDC dc(this);
5776  SetCapturedTrack( t, IsClosing );
5777  mCapturedRect = rect;
5778 
5779  mTrackInfo.DrawCloseBox(&dc, rect, true);
5780  return true;
5781 }
5782 
5783 bool TrackPanel::PopupFunc(Track * t, wxRect rect, int x, int y)
5784 {
5785  wxRect titleRect;
5786  mTrackInfo.GetTitleBarRect(rect, titleRect);
5787  if (!titleRect.Contains(x, y))
5788  return false;
5789 
5790  wxClientDC dc(this);
5791  SetCapturedTrack( t, IsPopping );
5792  mCapturedRect = rect;
5793 
5794  mTrackInfo.DrawTitleBar(&dc, rect, t, true);
5795  return true;
5796 }
5797 
5802 void TrackPanel::HandleResizeClick( wxMouseEvent & event )
5803 {
5804  wxRect rTrack;
5805  wxRect rLabel;
5806 
5807  // DM: Figure out what track is about to be resized
5808  Track *track = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rTrack);
5809 
5810  if (!track) {
5811  // This will only return unlinked tracks or left channels of stereo tracks
5812  // or NULL:
5813  track = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, true, &rLabel);
5814  // If stereo, get the right channel.
5815  if (track && track->GetLinked())
5816  track = track->GetLink();
5817  }
5818 
5819  if (!track) {
5820  return;
5821  }
5822 
5823  mMouseClickY = event.m_y;
5824 
5825 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5826  // To do: escape key
5827  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(t)){
5828  //STM: Determine whether we should rescale one or two tracks
5829  if (t->GetVirtualStereo()) {
5830  // mCapturedTrack is the lower track
5831  mInitialTrackHeight = t->GetHeight(true);
5832  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = t->GetHeight();
5833  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks);
5834  }
5835  else {
5836  // mCapturedTrack is the upper track
5837  mInitialTrackHeight = t->GetHeight(true);
5838  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = t->GetHeight();
5839  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks);
5840  }
5841  }else{
5842  Track *prev = mTracks->GetPrev(t);
5843  Track *next = mTracks->GetNext(t);
5844 
5845  //STM: Determine whether we should rescale one or two tracks
5846  if (prev && prev->GetLink() == t) {
5847  // mCapturedTrack is the lower track
5848  mInitialTrackHeight = t->GetHeight();
5849  mInitialMinimized = t->GetMinimized();
5850  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = prev->GetHeight();
5851  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks);
5852  }
5853  else if (next && t->GetLink() == next) {
5854  // mCapturedTrack is the upper track
5855  mInitialTrackHeight = next->GetHeight();
5856  mInitialMinimized = next->GetMinimized();
5857  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = t->GetHeight();
5858  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks);
5859  }
5860  else {
5861  // DM: Save the initial mouse location and the initial height
5862  mInitialTrackHeight = t->GetHeight();
5863  mInitialMinimized = t->GetMinimized();
5864  SetCapturedTrack(t, IsResizing);
5865  }
5866  }
5867 #else // EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5868  Track *prev = mTracks->GetPrev(track);
5869  Track *next = mTracks->GetNext(track);
5870 
5871  //STM: Determine whether we should rescale one or two tracks
5872  if (prev && prev->GetLink() == track) {
5873  // mCapturedTrack is the lower track
5874  mInitialTrackHeight = track->GetHeight();
5875  mInitialActualHeight = track->GetActualHeight();
5876  mInitialMinimized = track->GetMinimized();
5877  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = prev->GetHeight();
5878  mInitialUpperActualHeight = prev->GetActualHeight();
5879  SetCapturedTrack(track, IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks);
5880  }
5881  else if (next && track->GetLink() == next) {
5882  // mCapturedTrack is the upper track
5883  mInitialTrackHeight = next->GetHeight();
5884  mInitialActualHeight = next->GetActualHeight();
5885  mInitialMinimized = next->GetMinimized();
5886  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = track->GetHeight();
5887  mInitialUpperActualHeight = track->GetActualHeight();
5888  SetCapturedTrack(track, IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks);
5889  }
5890  else {
5891  // DM: Save the initial mouse location and the initial height
5892  mInitialTrackHeight = track->GetHeight();
5893  mInitialActualHeight = track->GetActualHeight();
5894  mInitialMinimized = track->GetMinimized();
5895  SetCapturedTrack(track, IsResizing);
5896  }
5897 #endif // EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5898 }
5899 
5906 void TrackPanel::HandleResizeButtonUp(wxMouseEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
5907 {
5908  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
5909  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
5910  MakeParentModifyState(false);
5911 }
5912 
5917 void TrackPanel::HandleResizeDrag(wxMouseEvent & event)
5918 {
5919  int delta = (event.m_y - mMouseClickY);
5920 
5921  // On first drag, jump out of minimized mode. Initial height
5922  // will be height of minimized track.
5923  //
5924  // This used to be in HandleResizeClick(), but simply clicking
5925  // on a resize border would switch the minimized state.
5926  if (mCapturedTrack->GetMinimized()) {
5927  Track *link = mCapturedTrack->GetLink();
5928 
5929  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(mCapturedTrack->GetHeight());
5930  mCapturedTrack->SetMinimized(false);
5931 
5932  if (link) {
5933  link->SetHeight(link->GetHeight());
5934  link->SetMinimized(false);
5935  // Initial values must be reset since they weren't based on the
5936  // minimized heights.
5937  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = link->GetHeight();
5938  mInitialTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetHeight();
5939  }
5940 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5941  else if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(mCapturedTrack)){
5942  mCapturedTrack->SetMinimized(false);
5943  mInitialUpperTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetHeight();
5944  mInitialTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetHeight(true);
5945  }
5946 #endif
5947  }
5948 
5949  //STM: We may be dragging one or two (stereo) tracks.
5950  // If two, resize proportionally if we are dragging the lower track, and
5951  // adjust compensatively if we are dragging the upper track.
5952 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
5953  switch( mMouseCapture )
5954  {
5955  case IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks:
5956  {
5957  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(mCapturedTrack)){
5958  double proportion = static_cast < double >(mInitialTrackHeight)
5959  / (mInitialTrackHeight + mInitialUpperTrackHeight);
5960 
5961  int newTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
5962  (mInitialTrackHeight + delta * proportion);
5963 
5964  int newUpperTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
5965  (mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta * (1.0 - proportion));
5966 
5967  //make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
5968  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
5969  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
5970  if (newUpperTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
5971  newUpperTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
5972 
5973  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight,true);
5974  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
5975  }
5976  else{
5977  Track *prev = mTracks->GetPrev(mCapturedTrack);
5978 
5979  double proportion = static_cast < double >(mInitialTrackHeight)
5980  / (mInitialTrackHeight + mInitialUpperTrackHeight);
5981 
5982  int newTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
5983  (mInitialTrackHeight + delta * proportion);
5984 
5985  int newUpperTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
5986  (mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta * (1.0 - proportion));
5987 
5988  //make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
5989  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
5990  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
5991  if (newUpperTrackHeight < prev->GetMinimizedHeight())
5992  newUpperTrackHeight = prev->GetMinimizedHeight();
5993 
5994  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
5995  prev->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
5996  }
5997  break;
5998  }
5999  case IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks:
6000  {
6001  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(mCapturedTrack)){
6002  int newUpperTrackHeight = mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta;
6003  int newTrackHeight = mInitialTrackHeight - delta;
6004 
6005  // make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
6006  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6007  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6008  newUpperTrackHeight =
6009  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6010  }
6011  if (newUpperTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6012  newUpperTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6013  newTrackHeight =
6014  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6015  }
6016  float temp = 1.0f;
6017  if(newUpperTrackHeight != 0.0f)
6018  temp = (float)newUpperTrackHeight/(float)(newUpperTrackHeight + newTrackHeight);
6019 
6020  mCapturedTrack->SetVirtualTrackPercentage(temp);
6021  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
6022  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight,true);
6023  }
6024  else{
6025  Track *next = mTracks->GetNext(mCapturedTrack);
6026  int newUpperTrackHeight = mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta;
6027  int newTrackHeight = mInitialTrackHeight - delta;
6028 
6029  // make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
6030  if (newTrackHeight < next->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6031  newTrackHeight = next->GetMinimizedHeight();
6032  newUpperTrackHeight =
6033  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - next->GetMinimizedHeight();
6034  }
6035  if (newUpperTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6036  newUpperTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6037  newTrackHeight =
6038  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6039  }
6040 
6041  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
6042  next->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
6043  break;
6044  }
6045  break;
6046  }
6047  case IsResizing:
6048  {
6049  int newTrackHeight = mInitialTrackHeight + delta;
6050  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
6051  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6052  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
6053  break;
6054  }
6055  default:
6056  // don't refresh in this case.
6057  return;
6058  }
6059 #else // EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
6060  switch( mMouseCapture )
6061  {
6062  case IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks:
6063  {
6064  Track *prev = mTracks->GetPrev(mCapturedTrack);
6065 
6066  double proportion = static_cast < double >(mInitialTrackHeight)
6067  / (mInitialTrackHeight + mInitialUpperTrackHeight);
6068 
6069  int newTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
6070  (mInitialTrackHeight + delta * proportion);
6071 
6072  int newUpperTrackHeight = static_cast < int >
6073  (mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta * (1.0 - proportion));
6074 
6075  //make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
6076  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
6077  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6078  if (newUpperTrackHeight < prev->GetMinimizedHeight())
6079  newUpperTrackHeight = prev->GetMinimizedHeight();
6080 
6081  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
6082  prev->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
6083  break;
6084  }
6085  case IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks:
6086  {
6087  Track *next = mTracks->GetNext(mCapturedTrack);
6088  int newUpperTrackHeight = mInitialUpperTrackHeight + delta;
6089  int newTrackHeight = mInitialTrackHeight - delta;
6090 
6091  // make sure neither track is smaller than its minimum height
6092  if (newTrackHeight < next->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6093  newTrackHeight = next->GetMinimizedHeight();
6094  newUpperTrackHeight =
6095  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - next->GetMinimizedHeight();
6096  }
6097  if (newUpperTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight()) {
6098  newUpperTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6099  newTrackHeight =
6100  mInitialUpperTrackHeight + mInitialTrackHeight - mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6101  }
6102 
6103  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newUpperTrackHeight);
6104  next->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
6105  break;
6106  }
6107  case IsResizing:
6108  {
6109  int newTrackHeight = mInitialTrackHeight + delta;
6110  if (newTrackHeight < mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight())
6111  newTrackHeight = mCapturedTrack->GetMinimizedHeight();
6112  mCapturedTrack->SetHeight(newTrackHeight);
6113  break;
6114  }
6115  default:
6116  // don't refresh in this case.
6117  return;
6118  }
6119 #endif // EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
6120  Refresh(false);
6121 }
6122 
6128 void TrackPanel::HandleResize(wxMouseEvent & event)
6129 {
6130  if (event.LeftDown()) {
6131  HandleResizeClick( event );
6132  }
6133  else if (event.LeftUp())
6134  {
6135  HandleResizeButtonUp( event );
6136  }
6137  else if (event.Dragging()) {
6138  HandleResizeDrag( event );
6139  }
6140 }
6141 
6143 void TrackPanel::HandleWheelRotation(wxMouseEvent & event)
6144 {
6145  if (GetTracks()->IsEmpty())
6146  // Scrolling and Zoom in and out commands are disabled when there are no tracks.
6147  // This should be disabled too for consistency. Otherwise
6148  // you do see changes in the time ruler.
6149  return;
6150 
6151  // Special case of pointer in the vertical ruler
6152  {
6153  wxRect rect;
6154  Track *const pTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, false, &rect);
6155  if (pTrack && event.m_x >= GetVRulerOffset()) {
6156  HandleWheelRotationInVRuler(event, pTrack, rect);
6157  return;
6158  }
6159  }
6160 
6161  double steps = event.m_wheelRotation /
6162  (event.m_wheelDelta > 0 ? (double)event.m_wheelDelta : 120.0);
6163 
6164  if (event.ShiftDown()
6165 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
6166  // Don't pan during smooth scrolling. That would conflict with keeping
6167  // the play indicator centered.
6168  && !mSmoothScrollingScrub
6169 #endif
6170  )
6171  {
6172  // MM: Scroll left/right when used with Shift key down
6173  mListener->TP_ScrollWindow(
6174  mViewInfo->OffsetTimeByPixels(
6175  mViewInfo->PositionToTime(0), 50.0 * -steps));
6176  }
6177  else if (event.CmdDown())
6178  {
6179 #if 0
6180  // JKC: Alternative scroll wheel zooming code
6181  // using AudacityProject zooming, which is smarter,
6182  // it keeps selections on screen and centred if it can,
6183  // also this ensures mousewheel and zoom buttons give same result.
6184  double ZoomFactor = pow(2.0, steps);
6185  AudacityProject *p = GetProject();
6186  if( steps > 0 )
6187  p->ZoomInByFactor( ZoomFactor );
6188  else
6189  p->ZoomOutByFactor( ZoomFactor );
6190 #endif
6191  // MM: Zoom in/out when used with Control key down
6192  // We're converting pixel positions to times,
6193  // counting pixels from the left edge of the track.
6194  int trackLeftEdge = GetLeftOffset();
6195 
6196  // Time corresponding to mouse position
6197  wxCoord xx;
6198  double center_h;
6199 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
6200  if (mSmoothScrollingScrub) {
6201  // Expand or contract about the center, ignoring mouse position
6202  center_h = mViewInfo->h + (GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo->h) / 2.0;
6203  xx = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(center_h, trackLeftEdge);
6204  }
6205  else
6206 #endif
6207  {
6208  xx = event.m_x;
6209  center_h = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(xx, trackLeftEdge);
6210  }
6211  // Time corresponding to last (most far right) audio.
6212  double audioEndTime = mTracks->GetEndTime();
6213 
6214  // When zooming in in empty space, it's easy to 'lose' the waveform.
6215  // This prevents it.
6216  // IF zooming in
6217  if (steps > 0)
6218  {
6219  // IF mouse is to right of audio
6220  if (center_h > audioEndTime)
6221  // Zooming brings far right of audio to mouse.
6222  center_h = audioEndTime;
6223  }
6224 
6225  mViewInfo->ZoomBy(pow(2.0, steps));
6226 
6227  double new_center_h = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(xx, trackLeftEdge);
6228  mViewInfo->h += (center_h - new_center_h);
6229 
6230  MakeParentRedrawScrollbars();
6231  Refresh(false);
6232  }
6233  else
6234  {
6235 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SCROLL_WHEEL
6236  if (IsScrubbing()) {
6237  const int newLogMaxScrubSpeed = mLogMaxScrubSpeed + steps;
6238  static const double maxScrubSpeedBase =
6239  pow(2.0, 1.0 / ScrubSpeedStepsPerOctave);
6240  double newSpeed = pow(maxScrubSpeedBase, newLogMaxScrubSpeed);
6241  if (newSpeed >= AudioIO::GetMinScrubSpeed() &&
6242  newSpeed <= AudioIO::GetMaxScrubSpeed()) {
6243  mLogMaxScrubSpeed = newLogMaxScrubSpeed;
6244  mMaxScrubSpeed = newSpeed;
6245 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
6246  if (!mSmoothScrollingScrub)
6247 #endif
6248  // Show the speed for one second
6249  mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown = kOneSecondCountdown + 1;
6250  }
6251  }
6252  else
6253 #endif
6254  {
6255  // MM: Scroll up/down when used without modifier keys
6256  double lines = steps * 4 + mVertScrollRemainder;
6257  mVertScrollRemainder = lines - floor(lines);
6258  lines = floor(lines);
6259  mListener->TP_ScrollUpDown((int)-lines);
6260  }
6261  }
6262 }
6263 
6264 void TrackPanel::HandleWheelRotationInVRuler
6265  (wxMouseEvent &event, Track *pTrack, const wxRect &rect)
6266 {
6267  double steps = event.m_wheelRotation /
6268  (event.m_wheelDelta > 0 ? (double)event.m_wheelDelta : 120.0);
6269 
6270  if (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
6271  WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(pTrack);
6272  WaveTrack *const partner = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(wt->GetLink());
6273  const bool isDB =
6274  wt->GetDisplay() == WaveTrack::Waveform &&
6275  wt->GetWaveformSettings().scaleType == WaveformSettings::stLogarithmic;
6276  if (isDB && event.ShiftDown()) {
6277  // Special cases for Waveform dB only
6278 
6279  // Vary the bottom of the dB scale, but only if the midline is visible
6280  float min, max;
6281  wt->GetDisplayBounds(&min, &max);
6282  if (!(min < 0.0 && max > 0.0))
6283  return;
6284 
6285  WaveformSettings &settings = wt->GetIndependentWaveformSettings();
6286  float olddBRange = settings.dBRange;
6287  if (event.m_wheelRotation < 0)
6288  // Zoom out
6289  settings.NextLowerDBRange();
6290  else
6291  settings.NextHigherDBRange();
6292  float newdBRange = settings.dBRange;
6293 
6294  if (partner) {
6295  WaveformSettings &settings = partner->GetIndependentWaveformSettings();
6296  if (event.m_wheelRotation < 0)
6297  // Zoom out
6298  settings.NextLowerDBRange();
6299  else
6300  settings.NextHigherDBRange();
6301  }
6302 
6303  if (!event.CmdDown()) {
6304  // extra-special case that varies the db limit without changing
6305  // magnification
6306  const float extreme = (LINEAR_TO_DB(2) + newdBRange) / newdBRange;
6307  max = std::min(extreme, max * olddBRange / newdBRange);
6308  min = std::max(-extreme, min * olddBRange / newdBRange);
6309  wt->SetLastdBRange();
6310  wt->SetDisplayBounds(min, max);
6311  if (partner) {
6312  partner->SetLastdBRange();
6313  partner->SetDisplayBounds(min, max);
6314  }
6315  }
6316  }
6317  else if (event.CmdDown() && !event.ShiftDown()) {
6318  HandleWaveTrackVZoom(
6319  mTracks, rect, event.m_y, event.m_y,
6320  wt, false, (event.m_wheelRotation < 0),
6321  true);
6322  }
6323  else if (!(event.CmdDown() || event.ShiftDown())) {
6324  // Scroll some fixed number of pixels, independent of zoom level or track height:
6325  static const float movement = 10.0f;
6326  const int height = wt->GetHeight() - (kTopMargin + kBottomMargin);
6327  const bool spectral = (wt->GetDisplay() == WaveTrack::Spectrum);
6328  if (spectral) {
6329  const float delta = steps * movement / height;
6330  SpectrogramSettings &settings = wt->GetIndependentSpectrogramSettings();
6331  const bool isLinear = settings.scaleType == SpectrogramSettings::stLinear;
6332  float bottom, top;
6333  wt->GetSpectrumBounds(&bottom, &top);
6334  const double rate = wt->GetRate();
6335  const float bound = rate / 2;
6336  const NumberScale numberScale(settings.GetScale(bottom, top, rate, false));
6337  float newTop =
6338  std::min(bound, numberScale.PositionToValue(1.0f + delta));
6339  const float newBottom =
6340  std::max((isLinear ? 0.0f : 1.0f),
6341  numberScale.PositionToValue(numberScale.ValueToPosition(newTop) - 1.0f));
6342  newTop =
6343  std::min(bound,
6344  numberScale.PositionToValue(numberScale.ValueToPosition(newBottom) + 1.0f));
6345 
6346  wt->SetSpectrumBounds(newBottom, newTop);
6347  if (partner)
6348  partner->SetSpectrumBounds(newBottom, newTop);
6349  }
6350  else {
6351  float topLimit = 2.0;
6352  if (isDB) {
6353  const float dBRange = wt->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange;
6354  topLimit = (LINEAR_TO_DB(topLimit) + dBRange) / dBRange;
6355  }
6356  const float bottomLimit = -topLimit;
6357  float top, bottom;
6358  wt->GetDisplayBounds(&bottom, &top);
6359  const float range = top - bottom;
6360  const float delta = range * steps * movement / height;
6361  float newTop = std::min(topLimit, top + delta);
6362  const float newBottom = std::max(bottomLimit, newTop - range);
6363  newTop = std::min(topLimit, newBottom + range);
6364  wt->SetDisplayBounds(newBottom, newTop);
6365  if (partner)
6366  partner->SetDisplayBounds(newBottom, newTop);
6367  }
6368  }
6369  else
6370  return;
6371 
6372  UpdateVRuler(pTrack);
6373  Refresh(false);
6374  MakeParentModifyState(true);
6375  }
6376  else {
6377  // To do: time track? Note track?
6378  }
6379  return;
6380 }
6381 
6383 void TrackPanel::OnCaptureKey(wxCommandEvent & event)
6384 {
6385  // Only deal with LabelTracks
6386  Track *t = GetFocusedTrack();
6387  if (!t || t->GetKind() != Track::Label) {
6388  event.Skip();
6389  return;
6390  }
6391  wxKeyEvent *kevent = (wxKeyEvent *)event.GetEventObject();
6392 
6393  event.Skip(!((LabelTrack *)t)->CaptureKey(*kevent));
6394 }
6395 
6396 void TrackPanel::OnKeyDown(wxKeyEvent & event)
6397 {
6398  switch (event.GetKeyCode())
6399  {
6400  case WXK_ESCAPE:
6401  HandleEscapeKey(true);
6402  break;
6403 
6404  case WXK_ALT:
6405  HandleAltKey(true);
6406  break;
6407 
6408  case WXK_SHIFT:
6409  HandleShiftKey(true);
6410  break;
6411 
6412  case WXK_CONTROL:
6413  HandleControlKey(true);
6414  break;
6415 
6416  // Allow PageUp and PageDown keys to
6417  //scroll the Track Panel left and right
6418  case WXK_PAGEUP:
6419  HandlePageUpKey();
6420  return;
6421 
6422  case WXK_PAGEDOWN:
6423  HandlePageDownKey();
6424  return;
6425  }
6426 
6427  Track *t = GetFocusedTrack();
6428 
6429  // Only deal with LabelTracks
6430  if (!t || t->GetKind() != Track::Label) {
6431  event.Skip();
6432  return;
6433  }
6434 
6435  LabelTrack *lt = (LabelTrack *)t;
6436  double bkpSel0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(),
6437  bkpSel1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
6438 
6439  // Pass keystroke to labeltrack's handler and add to history if any
6440  // updates were done
6441  if (lt->OnKeyDown(mViewInfo->selectedRegion, event))
6442  MakeParentPushState(_("Modified Label"),
6443  _("Label Edit"),
6444  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE);
6445 
6446  // Make sure caret is in view
6447  int x;
6448  if (lt->CalcCursorX(this, &x)) {
6449  ScrollIntoView(x);
6450  }
6451 
6452  // If selection modified, refresh
6453  // Otherwise, refresh track display if the keystroke was handled
6454  if( bkpSel0 != mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0() ||
6455  bkpSel1 != mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() )
6456  Refresh( false );
6457  else if (!event.GetSkipped())
6458  RefreshTrack(t);
6459 }
6460 
6461 void TrackPanel::OnChar(wxKeyEvent & event)
6462 {
6463  switch (event.GetKeyCode())
6464  {
6465  case WXK_ESCAPE:
6466  case WXK_ALT:
6467  case WXK_SHIFT:
6468  case WXK_CONTROL:
6469  case WXK_PAGEUP:
6470  case WXK_PAGEDOWN:
6471  return;
6472  }
6473 
6474  // Only deal with LabelTracks
6475  Track *t = GetFocusedTrack();
6476  if (!t || t->GetKind() != Track::Label) {
6477  event.Skip();
6478  return;
6479  }
6480 
6481  double bkpSel0 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(),
6482  bkpSel1 = mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1();
6483  // Pass keystroke to labeltrack's handler and add to history if any
6484  // updates were done
6485  if (((LabelTrack *)t)->OnChar(mViewInfo->selectedRegion, event))
6486  MakeParentPushState(_("Modified Label"),
6487  _("Label Edit"),
6488  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE);
6489 
6490  // If selection modified, refresh
6491  // Otherwise, refresh track display if the keystroke was handled
6492  if( bkpSel0 != mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0() ||
6493  bkpSel1 != mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1() )
6494  Refresh( false );
6495  else if (!event.GetSkipped())
6496  RefreshTrack(t);
6497 }
6498 
6499 void TrackPanel::OnKeyUp(wxKeyEvent & event)
6500 {
6501  switch (event.GetKeyCode())
6502  {
6503  case WXK_ESCAPE:
6504  HandleEscapeKey(false);
6505  break;
6506  case WXK_ALT:
6507  HandleAltKey(false);
6508  break;
6509 
6510  case WXK_SHIFT:
6511  HandleShiftKey(false);
6512  break;
6513 
6514  case WXK_CONTROL:
6515  HandleControlKey(false);
6516  break;
6517  }
6518 
6519  event.Skip();
6520 }
6521 
6523 void TrackPanel::OnCaptureLost(wxMouseCaptureLostEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
6524 {
6525  wxMouseEvent e(wxEVT_LEFT_UP);
6526 
6527  e.m_x = mMouseMostRecentX;
6528  e.m_y = mMouseMostRecentY;
6529 
6530  OnMouseEvent(e);
6531 }
6532 
6536 void TrackPanel::OnMouseEvent(wxMouseEvent & event)
6537 {
6538  if (event.m_wheelRotation != 0)
6539  HandleWheelRotation(event);
6540 
6541  if (!mAutoScrolling) {
6542  mMouseMostRecentX = event.m_x;
6543  mMouseMostRecentY = event.m_y;
6544  }
6545 
6546  if (event.LeftDown()) {
6547  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
6548 
6549  // The activate event is used to make the
6550  // parent window 'come alive' if it didn't have focus.
6551  wxActivateEvent e;
6552  GetParent()->GetEventHandler()->ProcessEvent(e);
6553 
6554  // wxTimers seem to be a little unreliable, so this
6555  // "primes" it to make sure it keeps going for a while...
6556 
6557  // When this timer fires, we call TrackPanel::OnTimer and
6558  // possibly update the screen for offscreen scrolling.
6559  mTimer.Stop();
6560  mTimer.Start(kTimerInterval, FALSE);
6561  }
6562 
6563  if (event.ButtonDown()) {
6564  SetFocus();
6565  }
6566  if (event.ButtonUp()) {
6567  if (HasCapture())
6568  ReleaseMouse();
6569  }
6570 
6571  if (event.Leaving() && !event.ButtonIsDown(wxMOUSE_BTN_ANY))
6572  {
6573  // PRL: was this test really needed? It interfered with my refactoring
6574  // that tried to eliminate those enum values.
6575  // I think it was never true, that mouse capture was pan or gain sliding,
6576  // but no mouse button was down.
6577  // if (mMouseCapture != IsPanSliding && mMouseCapture != IsGainSliding)
6578  {
6579  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
6580 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
6581  // We must install the cursor ourselves since the window under
6582  // the mouse is no longer this one and wx2.8.12 makes that check.
6583  // Should re-evaluate with wx3.
6584  wxSTANDARD_CURSOR->MacInstall();
6585 #endif
6586  }
6587  }
6588 
6589  switch( mMouseCapture )
6590  {
6591  case IsVZooming:
6592  HandleVZoom(event);
6593  break;
6594  case IsClosing:
6595  HandleClosing(event);
6596  break;
6597  case IsPopping:
6598  HandlePopping(event);
6599  break;
6600  case IsMuting:
6601  HandleMutingSoloing(event, false);
6602  break;
6603  case IsSoloing:
6604  HandleMutingSoloing(event, true);
6605  break;
6606  case IsResizing:
6607  case IsResizingBetweenLinkedTracks:
6608  case IsResizingBelowLinkedTracks:
6609  HandleResize(event);
6610  HandleCursor(event);
6611  break;
6612  case IsRearranging:
6613  HandleRearrange(event);
6614  break;
6615  case IsGainSliding:
6616  HandleSliders(event, false);
6617  break;
6618  case IsPanSliding:
6619  HandleSliders(event, true);
6620  break;
6621  case IsMinimizing:
6622  HandleMinimizing(event);
6623  break;
6624  case IsZooming:
6625  HandleZoom(event);
6626  break;
6627  case IsAdjustingLabel:
6628  HandleGlyphDragRelease(static_cast<LabelTrack *>(mCapturedTrack), event);
6629  break;
6630  case IsSelectingLabelText:
6631  HandleTextDragRelease(static_cast<LabelTrack *>(mCapturedTrack), event);
6632  break;
6633  default: //includes case of IsUncaptured
6634  // This is where most button-downs are detected
6635  HandleTrackSpecificMouseEvent(event);
6636  break;
6637  }
6638 
6639  if (event.ButtonDown() && IsMouseCaptured()) {
6640  if (!HasCapture())
6641  CaptureMouse();
6642  }
6643 
6644  //EnsureVisible should be called after the up-click.
6645  if (event.ButtonUp()) {
6646  wxRect rect;
6647 
6648  Track *t = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
6649  if (t)
6650  EnsureVisible(t);
6651  }
6652 }
6653 
6654 namespace {
6655  int FindMergeLine(WaveTrack *track, double time)
6656  {
6657  const double tolerance = 0.5 / track->GetRate();
6658  int ii = 0;
6659  for (const auto loc: track->GetCachedLocations()) {
6660  if (loc.typ == WaveTrackLocation::locationMergePoint &&
6661  fabs(time - loc.pos) < tolerance)
6662  return ii;
6663  ++ii;
6664  }
6665  return -1;
6666  }
6667 }
6668 
6669 bool TrackPanel::HandleTrackLocationMouseEvent(WaveTrack * track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent &event)
6670 {
6671  // FIXME: Disable this and return true when CutLines aren't showing?
6672  // (Don't use gPrefs-> for the fix as registry access is slow).
6673 
6674  if (mMouseCapture == WasOverCutLine)
6675  {
6676  if (event.ButtonUp()) {
6677  mMouseCapture = IsUncaptured;
6678  return false;
6679  }
6680  else
6681  // Needed to avoid select events after button down
6682  return true;
6683  }
6684  else if (!IsUnsafe() && IsOverCutline(track, rect, event))
6685  {
6686  if (!mCapturedTrackLocationRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y))
6687  {
6688  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
6689  return false;
6690  }
6691 
6692  bool handled = false;
6693 
6694  if (event.LeftDown())
6695  {
6696  if (mCapturedTrackLocation.typ == WaveTrackLocation::locationCutLine)
6697  {
6698  // When user presses left button on cut line, expand the line again
6699  double cutlineStart = 0, cutlineEnd = 0;
6700 
6701  if (track->ExpandCutLine(mCapturedTrackLocation.pos, &cutlineStart, &cutlineEnd))
6702  {
6703  WaveTrack* linked = (WaveTrack*)mTracks->GetLink(track);
6704  if (linked) {
6705  // Expand the cutline in the opposite channel if it is present.
6706 
6707  // PRL: Do NOT report that the event is not handled if the other
6708  // channel doesn't also have a cutline to expand at the same time.
6709  // Just ignore the return. Bug1310.
6710 
6711  /* bool success = */
6712  linked->ExpandCutLine(mCapturedTrackLocation.pos);
6713  /*
6714  if (!success)
6715  return false;
6716  */
6717  }
6718 
6719  mViewInfo->selectedRegion.setTimes(cutlineStart, cutlineEnd);
6720  DisplaySelection();
6721  MakeParentPushState(_("Expanded Cut Line"), _("Expand"));
6722  handled = true;
6723  }
6724  }
6725  else if (mCapturedTrackLocation.typ == WaveTrackLocation::locationMergePoint) {
6726  const double pos = mCapturedTrackLocation.pos;
6727  if (!track->MergeClips(mCapturedTrackLocation.clipidx1, mCapturedTrackLocation.clipidx2))
6728  return false;
6729 
6730  WaveTrack* linked = (WaveTrack*)mTracks->GetLink(track);
6731  if (linked) {
6732  // Don't assume correspondence of merge points across channels!
6733  int idx = FindMergeLine(linked, pos);
6734  if (idx >= 0) {
6735  WaveTrack::Location location = linked->GetCachedLocations()[idx];
6736  if (!linked->MergeClips(location.clipidx1, location.clipidx2))
6737  return false;
6738  }
6739  }
6740 
6741  MakeParentPushState(_("Merged Clips"),_("Merge"), UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE);
6742  handled = true;
6743  }
6744  }
6745 
6746  if (!handled && event.RightDown())
6747  {
6748  track->RemoveCutLine(mCapturedTrackLocation.pos);
6749  WaveTrack* linked = (WaveTrack*)mTracks->GetLink(track);
6750  if (linked)
6751  linked->RemoveCutLine(mCapturedTrackLocation.pos);
6752  MakeParentPushState(_("Removed Cut Line"), _("Remove") );
6753  handled = true;
6754  }
6755 
6756  if (handled)
6757  {
6758  SetCapturedTrack( NULL );
6759  // Effect happened at button-down, but treat like a dragging mode until
6760  // button-up.
6761  mMouseCapture = WasOverCutLine;
6762  RefreshTrack(track);
6763  return true;
6764  }
6765 
6766  return true;
6767  }
6768 
6769  return false;
6770 }
6771 
6772 bool TrackPanel::IsOverCutline(WaveTrack * track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent &event)
6773 {
6774  for (auto loc: track->GetCachedLocations())
6775  {
6776  const double x = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(loc.pos);
6777  if (x >= 0 && x < rect.width)
6778  {
6779  wxRect locRect;
6780  locRect.x = int(rect.x + x) - 5;
6781  locRect.width = 11;
6782  locRect.y = rect.y;
6783  locRect.height = rect.height;
6784  if (locRect.Contains(event.m_x, event.m_y))
6785  {
6786  mCapturedTrackLocation = loc;
6787  mCapturedTrackLocationRect = locRect;
6788  return true;
6789  }
6790  }
6791  }
6792 
6793  return false;
6794 }
6795 
6796 
6798 bool TrackPanel::HandleLabelTrackClick(LabelTrack * lTrack, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent & event)
6799 {
6800  if (!event.ButtonDown())
6801  return false;
6802 
6803  if(event.LeftDown())
6804  {
6807  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6808  Track *n = iter.First();
6809 
6810  while (n) {
6811  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Label && lTrack != n) {
6812  ((LabelTrack *)n)->ResetFlags();
6813  ((LabelTrack *)n)->Unselect();
6814  }
6815  n = iter.Next();
6816  }
6817  }
6818 
6819  mCapturedRect = rect;
6820  mCapturedRect.width -= kRightMargin;
6821 
6822  lTrack->HandleClick(event, mCapturedRect, *mViewInfo, &mViewInfo->selectedRegion);
6823 
6824  if (lTrack->IsAdjustingLabel())
6825  {
6826  SetCapturedTrack(lTrack, IsAdjustingLabel);
6827 
6828  //If we are adjusting a label on a labeltrack, do not do anything
6829  //that follows. Instead, redraw the track.
6830  RefreshTrack(lTrack);
6831  return true;
6832  }
6833 
6834  // IF the user clicked a label, THEN select all other tracks by Label
6835  if (lTrack->IsSelected()) {
6836  mTracks->Select(lTrack);
6837  SelectTracksByLabel(lTrack);
6838  DisplaySelection();
6839 
6840  // Not starting a drag
6841  SetCapturedTrack(NULL, IsUncaptured);
6842 
6843  if(mCapturedTrack == NULL)
6844  SetCapturedTrack(lTrack, IsSelectingLabelText);
6845  // handle shift+mouse left button
6846  if (event.ShiftDown() && event.ButtonDown()) {
6847  // if the mouse is clicked in text box, set flags
6848  if (lTrack->OverTextBox(lTrack->GetLabel(lTrack->getSelectedIndex()), event.m_x, event.m_y)) {
6849  lTrack->SetInBox(true);
6850  lTrack->SetDragXPos(event.m_x);
6851  lTrack->SetResetCursorPos(true);
6852  RefreshTrack(lTrack);
6853  return true;
6854  }
6855  }
6856  return true;
6857  }
6858 
6859  // handle shift+ctrl down
6860  /*if (event.ShiftDown()) { // && event.ControlDown()) {
6861  lTrack->SetHighlightedByKey(true);
6862  Refresh(false);
6863  return;
6864  }*/
6865 
6866  // return false, there is more to do...
6867  return false;
6868 }
6869 
6871 void TrackPanel::HandleGlyphDragRelease(LabelTrack * lTrack, wxMouseEvent & event)
6872 {
6873  if (!lTrack)
6874  return;
6875 
6878  if (event.Dragging()) {
6879  ;
6880  } else if (event.LeftUp() && mCapturedTrack && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Label)) {
6881  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
6882  }
6883 
6884  if (lTrack->HandleGlyphDragRelease(event, mCapturedRect,
6885  *mViewInfo, &mViewInfo->selectedRegion)) {
6886  MakeParentPushState(_("Modified Label"),
6887  _("Label Edit"),
6888  UndoPush::CONSOLIDATE);
6889  }
6890 
6891  //If we are adjusting a label on a labeltrack, do not do anything
6892  //that follows. Instead, redraw the track.
6893  RefreshTrack(lTrack);
6894  return;
6895 }
6896 
6898 void TrackPanel::HandleTextDragRelease(LabelTrack * lTrack, wxMouseEvent & event)
6899 {
6900  if (!lTrack)
6901  return;
6902 
6903  lTrack->HandleTextDragRelease(event);
6904 
6907  if (event.Dragging()) {
6908  ;
6909  } else if (event.LeftUp() && mCapturedTrack && (mCapturedTrack->GetKind() == Track::Label)) {
6910  SetCapturedTrack(NULL);
6911  }
6912 
6913  // handle dragging
6914  if (event.Dragging()) {
6915  // locate the initial mouse position
6916  if (event.LeftIsDown()) {
6917  if (mLabelTrackStartXPos == -1) {
6918  mLabelTrackStartXPos = event.m_x;
6919  mLabelTrackStartYPos = event.m_y;
6920 
6921  if ((lTrack->getSelectedIndex() != -1) &&
6922  lTrack->OverTextBox(
6923  lTrack->GetLabel(lTrack->getSelectedIndex()),
6924  mLabelTrackStartXPos,
6925  mLabelTrackStartYPos))
6926  {
6927  mLabelTrackStartYPos = -1;
6928  }
6929  }
6930  // if initial mouse position in the text box
6931  // then only drag text
6932  if (mLabelTrackStartYPos == -1) {
6933  RefreshTrack(lTrack);
6934  return;
6935  }
6936  }
6937  }
6938 
6939  // handle mouse left button up
6940  if (event.LeftUp()) {
6941  mLabelTrackStartXPos = -1;
6942  }
6943 }
6944 
6945 // AS: I don't really understand why this code is sectioned off
6946 // from the other OnMouseEvent code.
6947 void TrackPanel::HandleTrackSpecificMouseEvent(wxMouseEvent & event)
6948 {
6949  Track * pTrack;
6950  Track * pControlTrack;
6951  wxRect rTrack;
6952  wxRect rLabel;
6953 
6954  bool unsafe = IsUnsafe();
6955 
6956  pControlTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, true, true, &rLabel);
6957  pTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rTrack);
6958 
6959  //call HandleResize if I'm over the border area
6960  if (event.LeftDown() &&
6961  (within(event.m_y, rTrack.y + rTrack.height, TRACK_RESIZE_REGION)
6962  || within(event.m_y, rLabel.y + rLabel.height,
6963  TRACK_RESIZE_REGION))) {
6964  HandleResize(event);
6965  HandleCursor(event);
6966  return;
6967  }
6968 
6969  // AS: If the user clicked outside all tracks, make nothing
6970  // selected.
6971  if ((event.ButtonDown() || event.ButtonDClick()) &&
6972  !(pTrack || pControlTrack)) {
6973  SelectNone();
6974  Refresh(false);
6975  return;
6976  }
6977 
6978  //Determine if user clicked on the track's left-hand label
6979  if (!mCapturedTrack && event.m_x < GetLeftOffset()) {
6980  if (event.m_x >= GetVRulerOffset()) {
6981  if( !event.Dragging() ) // JKC: Only want the mouse down event.
6982  HandleVZoom(event);
6983  HandleCursor(event);
6984  }
6985  else {
6986  HandleLabelClick(event);
6987  HandleCursor(event);
6988  }
6989  return;
6990  }
6991 
6992  //Determine if user clicked on a label track.
6993  //If so, use MouseDown handler for the label track.
6994  if (pTrack && (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Label))
6995  {
6996  if (HandleLabelTrackClick((LabelTrack *)pTrack, rTrack, event))
6997  return;
6998  }
6999 
7000 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
7001  if (IsScrubbing() &&
7002  GetRect().Contains(event.GetPosition()) &&
7003  (!pTrack ||
7004  pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)) {
7005  if (event.LeftDown()) {
7006  mScrubSeekPress = true;
7007  return;
7008  }
7009  else if (event.LeftIsDown())
7010  return;
7011  }
7012 #endif
7013 
7014  bool handled = false;
7015 
7016  if (pTrack && (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave) &&
7017  (mMouseCapture == IsUncaptured || mMouseCapture == WasOverCutLine))
7018  handled = HandleTrackLocationMouseEvent((WaveTrack *)pTrack, rTrack, event);
7019 
7020  ToolsToolBar * pTtb = mListener->TP_GetToolsToolBar();
7021  if( !handled && pTtb != NULL )
7022  {
7023  int toolToUse = DetermineToolToUse(pTtb, event);
7024 
7025  switch (toolToUse) {
7026  case selectTool:
7027  HandleSelect(event);
7028  break;
7029  case envelopeTool:
7030  if (!unsafe)
7031  HandleEnvelope(event);
7032  break;
7033  case slideTool:
7034  if (!unsafe)
7035  HandleSlide(event);
7036  break;
7037  case zoomTool:
7038  HandleZoom(event);
7039  break;
7040  case drawTool:
7041  if (!unsafe)
7042  HandleSampleEditing(event);
7043  break;
7044  }
7045  }
7046 
7047  if ((event.Moving() || event.LeftUp()) &&
7048  (mMouseCapture == IsUncaptured ))
7049 // (mMouseCapture != IsSelecting ) &&
7050 // (mMouseCapture != IsEnveloping) &&
7051 // (mMouseCapture != IsSliding) )
7052  {
7053  HandleCursor(event);
7054  }
7055  if (event.LeftUp()) {
7056  mCapturedTrack = NULL;
7057  }
7058 }
7059 
7064 int TrackPanel::DetermineToolToUse( ToolsToolBar * pTtb, wxMouseEvent & event)
7065 {
7066  int currentTool = pTtb->GetCurrentTool();
7067 
7068  // Unless in Multimode keep using the current tool.
7069  if( !pTtb->IsDown(multiTool) )
7070  return currentTool;
7071 
7072  // We NEVER change tools whilst we are dragging.
7073  if( event.Dragging() || event.LeftUp() )
7074  return currentTool;
7075 
7076  // Just like dragging.
7077  // But, this event might be the final button up
7078  // so keep the same tool.
7079 // if( mIsSliding || mIsSelecting || mIsEnveloping )
7080  if( mMouseCapture != IsUncaptured )
7081  return currentTool;
7082 
7083  // So now we have to find out what we are near to..
7084  wxRect rect;
7085 
7086  Track *pTrack = FindTrack(event.m_x, event.m_y, false, false, &rect);
7087  if( !pTrack )
7088  return currentTool;
7089 
7090  int trackKind = pTrack->GetKind();
7091  currentTool = selectTool; // the default.
7092 
7093  if (event.ButtonIsDown(wxMOUSE_BTN_RIGHT) || event.RightUp()){
7094  currentTool = zoomTool;
7095  }
7096  else if (trackKind == Track::Time){
7097  currentTool = envelopeTool;
7098  } else if( trackKind == Track::Label ){
7099  currentTool = selectTool;
7100  } else if( trackKind != Track::Wave) {
7101  currentTool = selectTool;
7102  // So we are in a wave track.
7103  //FIXME: Not necessarily. Haven't checked Track::Note (#if defined(USE_MIDI)).
7104  // From here on the order in which we hit test determines
7105  // which tool takes priority in the rare cases where it
7106  // could be more than one.
7107  } else if (event.CmdDown()){
7108  // msmeyer: If control is down, slide single clip
7109  // msmeyer: If control and shift are down, slide all clips
7110  currentTool = slideTool;
7111  } else if( HitTestEnvelope( pTrack, rect, event ) ){
7112  currentTool = envelopeTool;
7113  } else if( HitTestSlide( pTrack, rect, event )){
7114  currentTool = slideTool;
7115  } else if( HitTestSamples( pTrack, rect, event )){
7116  currentTool = drawTool;
7117  }
7118 
7119  //Use the false argument since in multimode we don't
7120  //want the button indicating which tool is in use to be updated.
7121  pTtb->SetCurrentTool( currentTool, false );
7122  return currentTool;
7123 }
7124 
7125 
7126 #ifdef USE_MIDI
7127 bool TrackPanel::HitTestStretch(Track *track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent & event)
7128 {
7129  // later, we may want a different policy, but for now, stretch is
7130  // selected when the cursor is near the center of the track and
7131  // within the selection
7132  if (!track || !track->GetSelected() || track->GetKind() != Track::Note ||
7133  IsUnsafe()) {
7134  return false;
7135  }
7136  int center = rect.y + rect.height / 2;
7137  int distance = abs(event.m_y - center);
7138  const int yTolerance = 10;
7139  wxInt64 leftSel = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t0(), rect.x);
7140  wxInt64 rightSel = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(mViewInfo->selectedRegion.t1(), rect.x);
7141  // Something is wrong if right edge comes before left edge
7142  wxASSERT(!(rightSel < leftSel));
7143  return (leftSel <= event.m_x && event.m_x <= rightSel &&
7144  distance < yTolerance);
7145 }
7146 #endif
7147 
7148 
7151 bool TrackPanel::HitTestEnvelope(Track *track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent & event)
7152 {
7153  wxASSERT(track);
7154  if( track->GetKind() != Track::Wave )
7155  return false;
7156  WaveTrack *wavetrack = (WaveTrack *)track;
7157  Envelope *envelope = wavetrack->GetEnvelopeAtX(event.GetX());
7158 
7159  if (!envelope)
7160  return false;
7161 
7162  const int displayType = wavetrack->GetDisplay();
7163  // Not an envelope hit, unless we're using a type of wavetrack display
7164  // suitable for envelopes operations, ie one of the Wave displays.
7165  if ( displayType != WaveTrack::Waveform)
7166  return false; // No envelope, not a hit, so return.
7167 
7168  // Get envelope point, range 0.0 to 1.0
7169  const bool dB = !wavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().isLinear();
7170  // Convert x to time.
7171  const double envValue = envelope->GetValue(mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x));
7172 
7173  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
7174  wavetrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
7175 
7176  const double dBRange = wavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange;
7177 
7178  // Get y position of envelope point.
7179  int yValue = GetWaveYPos( envValue,
7180  zoomMin, zoomMax,
7181  rect.height, dB, true, dBRange, false) + rect.y;
7182 
7183  // Get y position of center line
7184  int ctr = GetWaveYPos( 0.0,
7185  zoomMin, zoomMax,
7186  rect.height, dB, true, dBRange, false) + rect.y;
7187 
7188  // Get y distance of mouse from center line (in pixels).
7189  int yMouse = abs(ctr - event.m_y);
7190  // Get y distance of envelope from center line (in pixels)
7191  yValue = abs(ctr-yValue);
7192 
7193  // JKC: It happens that the envelope is actually drawn offset from its
7194  // 'true' position (it is 3 pixels wide). yMisalign is really a fudge
7195  // factor to allow us to hit it exactly, but I wouldn't dream of
7196  // calling it yFudgeFactor :)
7197  const int yMisalign = 2;
7198  // Perhaps yTolerance should be put into preferences?
7199  const int yTolerance = 5; // how far from envelope we may be and count as a hit.
7200  int distance;
7201 
7202  // For amplification using the envelope we introduced the idea of contours.
7203  // The contours have the same shape as the envelope, which may be partially off-screen.
7204  // The contours are closer in to the center line.
7205  int ContourSpacing = (int) (rect.height / (2* (zoomMax-zoomMin)));
7206  const int MaxContours = 2;
7207 
7208  // Adding ContourSpacing/2 selects a region either side of the contour.
7209  int yDisplace = yValue - yMisalign - yMouse + ContourSpacing/2;
7210  if (yDisplace > (MaxContours * ContourSpacing))
7211  return false;
7212  // Subtracting the ContourSpacing/2 we added earlier ensures distance is centred on the contour.
7213  distance = abs( ( yDisplace % ContourSpacing ) - ContourSpacing/2);
7214  return( distance < yTolerance );
7215 }
7216 
7219 bool TrackPanel::HitTestSamples(Track *track, wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent & event)
7220 {
7221  wxASSERT(track);
7222  if( track->GetKind() != Track::Wave )
7223  return false;
7224 
7225  WaveTrack *wavetrack = (WaveTrack *)track;
7226  //Get rate in order to calculate the critical zoom threshold
7227  double rate = wavetrack->GetRate();
7228  const double dBRange = wavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().dBRange;
7229 
7230  const int displayType = wavetrack->GetDisplay();
7231  if (WaveTrack::Waveform != displayType)
7232  return false; // Not a wave, so return.
7233  const bool dB = !wavetrack->GetWaveformSettings().isLinear();
7234 
7235  const double tt = mViewInfo->PositionToTime(event.m_x, rect.x);
7236  int width;
7237  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
7238  if (!SampleResolutionTest(*mViewInfo, wavetrack, tt, rate, width))
7239  return false;
7240 
7241  // Just get one sample.
7242  float oneSample;
7243  sampleCount s0 = (sampleCount)(tt * rate + 0.5);
7244  wavetrack->Get((samplePtr)&oneSample, floatSample, s0, 1);
7245 
7246  // Get y distance of envelope point from center line (in pixels).
7247  float zoomMin, zoomMax;
7248 
7249  wavetrack->GetDisplayBounds(&zoomMin, &zoomMax);
7250 
7251  double envValue = 1.0;
7252  Envelope* env = wavetrack->GetEnvelopeAtX(event.GetX());
7253  if (env)
7254  envValue = env->GetValue(tt);
7255 
7256  int yValue = GetWaveYPos( oneSample * envValue,
7257  zoomMin, zoomMax,
7258  rect.height, dB, true, dBRange, false) + rect.y;
7259 
7260  // Get y position of mouse (in pixels)
7261  int yMouse = event.m_y;
7262 
7263  // Perhaps yTolerance should be put into preferences?
7264  const int yTolerance = 10; // More tolerance on samples than on envelope.
7265  return( abs( yValue - yMouse ) < yTolerance );
7266 }
7267 
7270 bool TrackPanel::HitTestSlide(Track * WXUNUSED(track), wxRect &rect, wxMouseEvent & event)
7271 {
7272  // Perhaps we should delegate this to TrackArtist as only TrackArtist
7273  // knows what the real sizes are??
7274 
7275  // The drag Handle width includes border, width and a little extra margin.
7276  const int adjustedDragHandleWidth = 14;
7277  // The hotspot for the cursor isn't at its centre. Adjust for this.
7278  const int hotspotOffset = 5;
7279 
7280  // We are doing an approximate test here - is the mouse in the right or left border?
7281  if( event.m_x + hotspotOffset < rect.x + adjustedDragHandleWidth)
7282  return true;
7283 
7284  if( event.m_x + hotspotOffset > rect.x + rect.width - adjustedDragHandleWidth)
7285  return true;
7286 
7287  return false;
7288 }
7289 
7290 double TrackPanel::GetMostRecentXPos()
7291 {
7292  return mViewInfo->PositionToTime(mMouseMostRecentX, GetLabelWidth());
7293 }
7294 
7295 void TrackPanel::RefreshTrack(Track *trk, bool refreshbacking)
7296 {
7297  Track *link = trk->GetLink();
7298 
7299  if (link && !trk->GetLinked()) {
7300  trk = link;
7301  link = trk->GetLink();
7302  }
7303 
7304  // subtract insets and shadows from the rectangle, but not border
7305  // This matters because some separators do paint over the border
7306  wxRect rect(kLeftInset,
7307  -mViewInfo->vpos + trk->GetY() + kTopInset,
7308  GetRect().GetWidth() - kLeftInset - kRightInset - kShadowThickness,
7309  trk->GetHeight() - kTopInset - kShadowThickness);
7310 
7311  if (link) {
7312  rect.height += link->GetHeight();
7313  }
7314 
7315 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
7316  else if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(trk)){
7317  rect.height += trk->GetHeight(true);
7318  }
7319 #endif
7320 
7321  if( refreshbacking )
7322  {
7323  mRefreshBacking = true;
7324  }
7325 
7326  Refresh( false, &rect );
7327 }
7328 
7329 
7334 void TrackPanel::Refresh(bool eraseBackground /* = TRUE */,
7335  const wxRect *rect /* = NULL */)
7336 {
7337  // Tell OnPaint() to refresh the backing bitmap.
7338  //
7339  // Originally I had the check within the OnPaint() routine and it
7340  // was working fine. That was until I found that, even though a full
7341  // refresh was requested, Windows only set the onscreen portion of a
7342  // window as damaged.
7343  //
7344  // So, if any part of the trackpanel was off the screen, full refreshes
7345  // didn't work and the display got corrupted.
7346  if( !rect || ( *rect == GetRect() ) )
7347  {
7348  mRefreshBacking = true;
7349  }
7350  wxWindow::Refresh(eraseBackground, rect);
7351  DisplaySelection();
7352 }
7353 
7357 void TrackPanel::DrawTracks(wxDC * dc)
7358 {
7359  wxRegion region = GetUpdateRegion();
7360 
7361  wxRect clip = GetRect();
7362 
7363  wxRect panelRect = clip;
7364  panelRect.y = -mViewInfo->vpos;
7365 
7366  wxRect tracksRect = panelRect;
7367  tracksRect.x += GetLabelWidth();
7368  tracksRect.width -= GetLabelWidth();
7369 
7370  ToolsToolBar *pTtb = mListener->TP_GetToolsToolBar();
7371  bool bMultiToolDown = pTtb->IsDown(multiTool);
7372  bool envelopeFlag = pTtb->IsDown(envelopeTool) || bMultiToolDown;
7373  bool bigPointsFlag = pTtb->IsDown(drawTool) || bMultiToolDown;
7374  bool sliderFlag = bMultiToolDown;
7375 
7376  // The track artist actually draws the stuff inside each track
7377  mTrackArtist->DrawTracks(mTracks, GetProject()->GetFirstVisible(),
7378  *dc, region, tracksRect, clip,
7379  mViewInfo->selectedRegion, *mViewInfo,
7380  envelopeFlag, bigPointsFlag, sliderFlag);
7381 
7382  DrawEverythingElse(dc, region, clip);
7383 }
7384 
7389 void TrackPanel::DrawEverythingElse(wxDC * dc,
7390  const wxRegion &region,
7391  const wxRect & clip)
7392 {
7393  // We draw everything else
7394 
7395  wxRect focusRect(-1, -1, 0, 0);
7396  wxRect trackRect = clip;
7397  trackRect.height = 0; // for drawing background in no tracks case.
7398 
7399  VisibleTrackIterator iter(GetProject());
7400  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
7401  trackRect.y = t->GetY() - mViewInfo->vpos;
7402  trackRect.height = t->GetHeight();
7403 
7404  // If this track is linked to the next one, display a common
7405  // border for both, otherwise draw a normal border
7406  wxRect rect = trackRect;
7407  bool skipBorder = false;
7408  Track *l = t->GetLink();
7409 
7410  if (t->GetLinked()) {
7411  rect.height += l->GetHeight();
7412  }
7413  else if (l && trackRect.y >= 0) {
7414  skipBorder = true;
7415  }
7416 
7417 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
7418  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(t)){
7419  rect.height += t->GetHeight(true);
7420  }
7421 #endif
7422 
7423  // If the previous track is linked to this one but isn't on the screen
7424  // (and thus would have been skipped by VisibleTrackIterator) we need to
7425  // draw that track's border instead.
7426  Track *borderTrack = t;
7427  wxRect borderRect = rect, borderTrackRect = trackRect;
7428 
7429  if (l && !t->GetLinked() && trackRect.y < 0)
7430  {
7431  borderTrack = l;
7432 
7433  borderTrackRect.y = l->GetY() - mViewInfo->vpos;
7434  borderTrackRect.height = l->GetHeight();
7435 
7436  borderRect = borderTrackRect;
7437  borderRect.height += t->GetHeight();
7438  }
7439 
7440  if (!skipBorder) {
7441  if (mAx->IsFocused(t)) {
7442  focusRect = borderRect;
7443  }
7444  DrawOutside(borderTrack, dc, borderRect, borderTrackRect);
7445  }
7446 
7447  // Believe it or not, we can speed up redrawing if we don't
7448  // redraw the vertical ruler when only the waveform data has
7449  // changed. An example is during recording.
7450 
7451 #if DEBUG_DRAW_TIMING
7452 // wxRect rbox = region.GetBox();
7453 // wxPrintf(wxT("Update Region: %d %d %d %d\n"),
7454 // rbox.x, rbox.y, rbox.width, rbox.height);
7455 #endif
7456 
7457  if (region.Contains(0, trackRect.y, GetLeftOffset(), trackRect.height)) {
7458  wxRect rect = trackRect;
7459  rect.x += GetVRulerOffset();
7460  rect.y += kTopMargin;
7461  rect.width = GetVRulerWidth();
7462  rect.height -= (kTopMargin + kBottomMargin);
7463  mTrackArtist->DrawVRuler(t, dc, rect);
7464  }
7465 
7466 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OUTPUT_DISPLAY
7467  if(MONO_WAVE_PAN(t)){
7468  trackRect.y = t->GetY(true) - mViewInfo->vpos;
7469  trackRect.height = t->GetHeight(true);
7470  if (region.Contains(0, trackRect.y, GetLeftOffset(), trackRect.height)) {
7471  wxRect rect = trackRect;
7472  rect.x += GetVRulerOffset();
7473  rect.y += kTopMargin;
7474  rect.width = GetVRulerWidth();
7475  rect.height -= (kTopMargin + kBottomMargin);
7476  mTrackArtist->DrawVRuler(t, dc, rect);
7477  }
7478  }
7479 #endif
7480  }
7481 
7482  if ((mMouseCapture == IsZooming || mMouseCapture == IsVZooming) &&
7483  IsDragZooming()
7484  // note track zooming now works like audio track
7485  //#ifdef USE_MIDI
7486  // && mCapturedTrack && mCapturedTrack->GetKind() != Track::Note
7487  //#endif
7488  ) {
7489  DrawZooming(dc, clip);
7490  }
7491 
7492  // Paint over the part below the tracks
7493  trackRect.y += trackRect.height;
7494  if (trackRect.y < clip.GetBottom()) {
7495  AColor::TrackPanelBackground(dc, false);
7496  dc->DrawRectangle(trackRect.x,
7497  trackRect.y,
7498  trackRect.width,
7499  clip.height - trackRect.y);
7500  }
7501 
7502  // Sometimes highlight is not drawn on backing bitmap. I thought
7503  // it was because FindFocus did not return "this" on Mac, but
7504  // when I removed that test, yielding this condition:
7505  // if (GetFocusedTrack() != NULL) {
7506  // the highlight was reportedly drawn even when something else
7507  // was the focus and no highlight should be drawn. -RBD
7508  if (GetFocusedTrack() != NULL && wxWindow::FindFocus() == this) {
7509  HighlightFocusedTrack(dc, focusRect);
7510  }
7511 
7512  // Draw snap guidelines if we have any
7513  if (mSnapManager && (mSnapLeft >= 0 || mSnapRight >= 0)) {
7514  AColor::SnapGuidePen(dc);
7515  if (mSnapLeft >= 0) {
7516  AColor::Line(*dc, (int)mSnapLeft, 0, mSnapLeft, 30000);
7517  }
7518  if (mSnapRight >= 0) {
7519  AColor::Line(*dc, (int)mSnapRight, 0, mSnapRight, 30000);
7520  }
7521  }
7522 }
7523 
7524 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_BASIC
7525 bool TrackPanel::ShouldDrawScrubSpeed()
7526 {
7527  return IsScrubbing() &&
7528  mScrubHasFocus &&
7529  ((!PollIsSeeking() && mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown > 0)
7530 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7531  // Draw always for scroll-scrub and for scroll-seek
7532  || mSmoothScrollingScrub
7533 #endif
7534  );
7535 }
7536 
7537 void TrackPanel::TimerUpdateScrubbing(double playPos)
7538 {
7539  if (!IsScrubbing()) {
7540  mNextScrubRect = wxRect();
7541  return;
7542  }
7543 
7544  // Call ContinueScrubbing() here in the timer handler
7545  // rather than in SelectionHandleDrag()
7546  // so that even without drag events, we can instruct the play head to
7547  // keep approaching the mouse cursor, when its maximum speed is limited.
7548 
7549  // Thus scrubbing relies mostly on periodic polling of mouse and keys,
7550  // not event notifications. But there are a few event handlers that
7551  // leave messages for this routine, in mScrubSeekPress and in mScrubHasFocus.
7552 
7553  // Seek only when the pointer is in the panel. Else, scrub.
7554  const wxMouseState state(::wxGetMouseState());
7555  const wxPoint position = ScreenToClient(state.GetPosition());
7556  const bool inPanel = GetRect().Contains(position);
7557  const bool seek = inPanel && (mScrubSeekPress || PollIsSeeking());
7558  if (ContinueScrubbing(position.x, mScrubHasFocus, seek))
7559  mScrubSeekPress = false;
7560  // else, if seek requested, try again at a later time when we might
7561  // enqueue a long enough stutter
7562 
7563 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7564  if (mSmoothScrollingScrub)
7565  ;
7566  else
7567 #endif
7568  {
7569  if (mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown > 0)
7570  --mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown;
7571  }
7572 
7573  if (!ShouldDrawScrubSpeed()) {
7574  mNextScrubRect = wxRect();
7575  }
7576  else {
7577  int panelWidth, panelHeight;
7578  GetSize(&panelWidth, &panelHeight);
7579 
7580  // Where's the mouse?
7581  int xx, yy;
7582  ::wxGetMousePosition(&xx, &yy);
7583  ScreenToClient(&xx, &yy);
7584 
7585  const bool seeking = PollIsSeeking();
7586 
7587  // Find the text
7588  const double speed =
7589 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7590  mSmoothScrollingScrub
7591  ? seeking
7592  ? FindSeekSpeed(mViewInfo->PositionToTime(xx, GetLeftOffset()))
7593  : FindScrubSpeed(mViewInfo->PositionToTime(xx, GetLeftOffset()))
7594  :
7595 #endif
7596  mMaxScrubSpeed;
7597 
7598  const wxChar *format =
7599 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7600  mSmoothScrollingScrub
7601  ? seeking
7602  ? wxT("%+.2fX")
7603  : wxT("%+.2f")
7604  :
7605 #endif
7606  wxT("%.2f");
7607 
7608  mNextScrubSpeedText = wxString::Format(format, speed);
7609 
7610  // Find the origin for drawing text
7611  wxCoord width, height;
7612  {
7613  wxClientDC dc(this);
7614  static const wxFont labelFont(24, wxSWISS, wxNORMAL, wxNORMAL);
7615  dc.SetFont(labelFont);
7616  dc.GetTextExtent(mNextScrubSpeedText, &width, &height);
7617  }
7618  xx = std::max(0, std::min(panelWidth - width, xx - width / 2));
7619 
7620  // Put the text above the cursor, if it fits.
7621  enum { offset = 20 };
7622  yy -= height + offset;
7623  if (yy < 0)
7624  yy += height + 2 * offset;
7625  yy = std::max(0, std::min(panelHeight - height, yy));
7626 
7627  mNextScrubRect = wxRect(xx, yy, width, height);
7628  }
7629 
7630 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7631  if (mSmoothScrollingScrub) {
7632  // Pan the view, so that we center the play indicator.
7633  const int posX = mViewInfo->TimeToPosition(playPos);
7634  int width;
7635  GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
7636  const int deltaX = posX - width / 2;
7637  mViewInfo->h =
7638  mViewInfo->OffsetTimeByPixels(mViewInfo->h, deltaX, true);
7639  if (!mViewInfo->bScrollBeyondZero)
7640  // Can't scroll too far left
7641  mViewInfo->h = std::max(0.0, mViewInfo->h);
7642  Refresh(false);
7643  }
7644 #endif
7645 }
7646 
7647 std::pair<wxRect, bool> TrackPanel::GetScrubSpeedRectangle()
7648 {
7649  wxRect rect(mLastScrubRect);
7650 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
7651  rect.Inflate(1, 0);
7652 #endif
7653 
7654  const bool outdated =
7655  (mLastScrubRect != mNextScrubRect) ||
7656  (!mLastScrubRect.IsEmpty() && !ShouldDrawScrubSpeed()) ||
7657  (mLastScrubSpeedText != mNextScrubSpeedText);
7658  return std::make_pair(
7659  rect,
7660  outdated
7661  );
7662 }
7663 
7664 void TrackPanel::UndrawScrubSpeed(wxDC & dc)
7665 {
7666  if (!mLastScrubRect.IsEmpty())
7667 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
7668  // On OSX, if a HiDPI resolution is being used, the line will actually take up
7669  // more than 1 pixel (even though it is drawn as 1), so we restore the surrounding
7670  // pixels as well. (This is because the wxClientDC doesn't know about the scaling.)
7671  dc.Blit(
7672  mLastScrubRect.GetX() - 1, mLastScrubRect.GetY(),
7673  mLastScrubRect.GetWidth() + 3, mLastScrubRect.GetHeight(),
7674  &mBackingDC,
7675  mLastScrubRect.GetX() - 1, mLastScrubRect.GetY());
7676 #else
7677  dc.Blit(
7678  mLastScrubRect.GetX(), mLastScrubRect.GetY(),
7679  mLastScrubRect.GetWidth(), mLastScrubRect.GetHeight(),
7680  &mBackingDC,
7681  mLastScrubRect.GetX(), mLastScrubRect.GetY());
7682 #endif
7683 }
7684 
7685 void TrackPanel::DoDrawScrubSpeed(wxDC &dc)
7686 {
7687  if (!ShouldDrawScrubSpeed())
7688  return;
7689 
7690  mLastScrubRect = mNextScrubRect;
7691  mLastScrubSpeedText = mNextScrubSpeedText;
7692  const bool seeking = PollIsSeeking();
7693  if (// Draw for (non-scroll) scrub, sometimes, but never for seek
7694  (!seeking && mScrubSpeedDisplayCountdown > 0)
7695 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7696  // Draw always for scroll-scrub and for scroll-seek
7697  || mSmoothScrollingScrub
7698 #endif
7699 
7700  ) {
7701  static const wxFont labelFont(24, wxSWISS, wxNORMAL, wxNORMAL);
7702  dc.SetFont(labelFont);
7703 
7704  // These two colors were previously saturated red and green. However
7705  // we have a rule to try to only use red for reserved purposes of
7706  // (a) Recording
7707  // (b) Error alerts
7708  // So they were changed to 'orange' and 'lime'.
7709  static const wxColour clrNoScroll(215, 162, 0), clrScroll(0, 204, 153);
7710 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCRUBBING_SMOOTH_SCROLL
7711  if (mSmoothScrollingScrub)
7712  dc.SetTextForeground(clrScroll);
7713  else
7714 #endif
7715  dc.SetTextForeground(clrNoScroll);
7716 
7717  dc.DrawText(mLastScrubSpeedText, mLastScrubRect.GetX(), mLastScrubRect.GetY());
7718  }
7719 }
7720 #endif
7721 
7726 void TrackPanel::DrawZooming(wxDC * dc, const wxRect & clip)
7727 {
7728  wxRect rect;
7729 
7730  dc->SetBrush(*wxTRANSPARENT_BRUSH);
7731  dc->SetPen(*wxBLACK_DASHED_PEN);
7732 
7733  if (mMouseCapture==IsVZooming) {
7734  rect.y = std::min(mZoomStart, mZoomEnd);
7735  rect.height = 1 + abs(mZoomEnd - mZoomStart);
7736 
7737  rect.x = GetVRulerOffset();
7738  rect.SetRight(GetSize().x - kRightMargin); // extends into border rect
7739  }
7740  else {
7741  rect.x = std::min(mZoomStart, mZoomEnd);
7742  rect.width = 1 + abs(mZoomEnd - mZoomStart);
7743 
7744  rect.y = -1;
7745  rect.height = clip.height + 2;
7746  }
7747 
7748  dc->DrawRectangle(rect);
7749 }
7750 
7751 
7752 void TrackPanel::DrawOutside(Track * t, wxDC * dc, const wxRect & rec,
7753  const wxRect & trackRect)
7754 {
7755  wxRect rect = rec;
7756  int labelw = GetLabelWidth();
7757  int vrul = GetVRulerOffset();
7758 
7759  DrawOutsideOfTrack(t, dc, rect);
